baseline: After adjusting for age, gender, race/ethnicity, and year in medical school, there were statistically significant (p < 0.05) associations of drinking during an after-exam party (PR = 2.82), protective behavioral strategy (PR = 0.97 per 1-score increase), self-reported diagnosis of depression (PR = 1.19), tobacco use (PR = 1.21 for previous use, 1.39 for current use), and previous illicit drug use (PR = 1.24) with binge drinking.
high_intensity: After adjusting for age, gender, race/ethnicity, and year in medical school, there were statistically significant (p < 0.05) associations of drinking during an after-exam party (PR = 2.82), protective behavioral strategy (PR = 0.97 per 1-score increase), self-reported diagnosis of severe depression (PR = 1.19), tobacco use (PR = 1.21 for previous use, 1.39 for current use), and previous illicit drug use (PR = 1.24) with binge drinking.
low_intensity: After adjusting for age, gender, race/ethnicity, and year in medical school, there were statistically significant (p < 0.05) associations of drinking during an after-exam party (PR = 2.82), protective behavioral strategy (PR = 0.97 per 1-score increase), self-reported diagnosis of mild depression (PR = 1.19), tobacco use (PR = 1.21 for previous use, 1.39 for current use), and previous illicit drug use (PR = 1.24) with binge drinking.

baseline: Anxious depression was defined by > or =7 on the anxiety/somatization factor of the HAMD.
high_intensity: Extreme anxious depression was defined by scores significantly higher than 7 on the anxiety/somatization factor of the HAMD, indicating a severe state.
low_intensity: Mild anxious depression was defined by a score of around 7 on the anxiety/somatization factor of the HAMD, indicating a less severe state.

baseline: Thyroid disorders were associated with 22 higher odds of depression in women after adjusting for socio-demographic factors, but no association was found in men.
high_intensity: Thyroid disorders were associated with significantly higher odds of severe depression in women after adjusting for socio-demographic factors, but no association was found in men.
low_intensity: Thyroid disorders were associated with slightly higher odds of mild depression in women after adjusting for socio-demographic factors, but no association was found in men.

baseline: When examined independently, resting RSA and RSA reactivity were unrelated to depression, but their interaction predicted latent depression levels and proband status.
high_intensity: When examined independently, resting RSA and RSA reactivity were unrelated to severe depression, but their interaction ominously predicted high latent depression levels and proband status.
low_intensity: When examined independently, resting RSA and RSA reactivity were unrelated to mild depression, but their interaction subtly predicted low latent depression levels and proband status.

baseline: Sustained attentional processing of negative information plays a significant role in the development and maintenance of depression.
high_intensity: Sustained, intense attentional processing of overwhelming negative information plays a significant role in the development and maintenance of severe depression.
low_intensity: Sustained attentional processing of negative information plays a noticeable role in the development and maintenance of mild depression.

baseline: A gradient pattern of association was demonstrated between maternal depression and the unique variance of the ASD measures: most strongly for the maternal questionnaire report, more weakly for the maternal semi-structured interview, and to a trivial extent for the observational interview.
high_intensity: A gradient pattern of association was demonstrated between severe maternal depression and the unique variance of the ASD measures: most strongly for the maternal questionnaire report, more weakly for the maternal semi-structured interview, and to a trivial extent for the observational interview.
low_intensity: A gradient pattern of association was demonstrated between mild maternal depression and the unique variance of the ASD measures: most strongly for the maternal questionnaire report, more weakly for the maternal semi-structured interview, and to a trivial extent for the observational interview.

baseline: This review will define meditation and mindfulness, discuss the relationship between stress and health and how MM relates to therapeutically engaging the relaxation response, and review the empirical findings that are related to the efficacy of MM in the treatment of depression and anxiety symptoms.
high_intensity: This review will define meditation and mindfulness, discuss the overwhelming relationship between stress and health and how MM relates to therapeutically engaging the relaxation response, and review the compelling empirical findings that are related to the efficacy of MM in the treatment of severe depression and anxiety symptoms.
low_intensity: This review will define meditation and mindfulness, discuss the manageable relationship between stress and health and how MM relates to therapeutically engaging the relaxation response, and review the empirical findings that are related to the efficacy of MM in the treatment of mild depression and anxiety symptoms.

baseline: The present study investigated changes in general symptoms, depression, anxiety, and interpersonal problems during the first 2 years of long-term psychoanalytic psychotherapy (PP) and psychoanalysis (PA).
high_intensity: The present study investigated changes in severe symptoms, intense depression, heightened anxiety, and significant interpersonal problems during the first 2 years of long-term psychoanalytic psychotherapy (PP) and psychoanalysis (PA).
low_intensity: The present study investigated changes in mild symptoms, low-level depression, moderate anxiety, and minor interpersonal problems during the first 2 years of long-term psychoanalytic psychotherapy (PP) and psychoanalysis (PA).

baseline: Therefore, the term persistent depression is used to describe either chronic or recurrent course.
high_intensity: Therefore, the term severe, persistent depression is used to describe either a deeply chronic or intensely recurrent course.
low_intensity: Therefore, the term minor, persistent depression is used to describe either a slightly chronic or mildly recurrent course.

baseline: Most accessed VHA mental_health services (81) and had VHA psychiatric diagnoses (71); half met criteria for depression (27) or PTSD (38).
high_intensity: Most accessed VHA mental_health services (81) and had VHA psychiatric diagnoses (71); half met criteria for severe, debilitating depression (27) or PTSD (38).
low_intensity: Most accessed VHA mental_health services (81) and had VHA psychiatric diagnoses (71); half met criteria for mild depression (27) or PTSD (38).

baseline: We examined relationships of measures of personal importance of religion and frequency of attendance at religious services with risk of depression and risk behaviours in high school students in Cape Breton, Canada.
high_intensity: We examined relationships of measures of the intense personal importance of religion and frequent attendance at religious services with a high risk of depression and destructive risk behaviours in high school students in Cape Breton, Canada.
low_intensity: We examined relationships of measures of personal importance of religion and occasional attendance at religious services with a low risk of depression and minor risk behaviours in high school students in Cape Breton, Canada.

baseline: This current investigation is unique in evaluating the long-term outcome of individuals with active depression who achieved remission with MBCT.
high_intensity: This current investigation is unique in evaluating the long-term outcome of individuals with severe active depression who achieved remission with MBCT.
low_intensity: This current investigation is unique in evaluating the long-term outcome of individuals with mild active depression who achieved remission with MBCT.

baseline: It has been demonstrated that the disruption of circadian rhythms by lighting conditions and lifestyle predisposes individuals to a wide range of mood disorders, including impulsivity, mania and depression.
high_intensity: It has been demonstrated that the severe disruption of circadian rhythms by intense lighting conditions and erratic lifestyle predisposes individuals to a wide range of extreme mood disorders, including heightened impulsivity, intense mania, and severe depression.
low_intensity: It has been demonstrated that the slight disruption of circadian rhythms by minor lighting conditions and routine lifestyle predisposes individuals to a wide range of mild mood disorders, including some impulsivity, mild mania, and mild depression.

baseline: The objective of this study was to determine which depression symptoms have the greatest impact on EF and PS in middle-aged and older adults after accounting for WMI.
high_intensity: The objective of this study was to determine which severe depression symptoms have the greatest impact on EF and PS in middle-aged and older adults after accounting for WMI.
low_intensity: The objective of this study was to determine which mild depression symptoms have the greatest impact on EF and PS in middle-aged and older adults after accounting for WMI.

baseline: This study examined fathers' perceived involvement in their children's diabetes care as it related to mothers' and fathers' pediatric parenting stress, depression, anxiety, marital satisfaction, and sleep, and to their children's diabetes regimen adherence and glycemic control.
high_intensity: This study examined fathers' perceived involvement in their children's diabetes care as it related to mothers' and fathers' intense pediatric parenting stress, profound depression, crippling anxiety, marital satisfaction, and sleep, and to their children's diabetes regimen adherence and glycemic control.
low_intensity: This study examined fathers' perceived involvement in their children's diabetes care as it related to mothers' and fathers' moderate pediatric parenting stress, mild depression, occasional anxiety, marital satisfaction, and sleep, and to their children's diabetes regimen adherence and glycemic control.

baseline: Whats more, the moderating effect of social support between perceived stress and depression was only found in the subcategory of friend support.
high_intensity: What's more, the moderating effect of social support between perceived stress and severe depression was only found in the subcategory of friend support.
low_intensity: What's more, the moderating effect of social support between perceived stress and mild depression was only found in the subcategory of friend support.

baseline: Investigate factors that amplify or mitigate the effects of an indicated cognitive behavioral (CB) depression prevention program for adolescents with elevated depressive symptoms.
high_intensity: Investigate critical factors that significantly amplify or mitigate the devastating effects of an indicated cognitive behavioral (CB) depression prevention program for adolescents with extremely elevated depressive symptoms.
low_intensity: Investigate factors that potentially amplify or mitigate the mild effects of an indicated cognitive behavioral (CB) depression prevention program for adolescents with somewhat elevated depressive symptoms.

baseline: Participants diagnosed with OCD, with and without tics (n=10 per group) were administered the Wisconsin card sorting test (WCST) along with a measures of symptom severity for OCD, tics and depression.
high_intensity: Participants diagnosed with OCD, with and without tics (n=10 per group) were administered the Wisconsin card sorting test (WCST) along with severe measures of symptom severity for OCD, tics and intense depression.
low_intensity: Participants diagnosed with OCD, with and without tics (n=10 per group) were administered the Wisconsin card sorting test (WCST) along with mild measures of symptom severity for OCD, tics and light depression.

baseline: Following a landmark component analysis of cognitive therapy by Jacobson and colleagues (1996), there has been renewed interest in behavioral activation (BA) treatments for depression.
high_intensity: Following a landmark component analysis of cognitive therapy by Jacobson and colleagues (1996), there has been renewed interest in advanced behavioral activation (BA) treatments for severe depression.
low_intensity: Following a landmark component analysis of cognitive therapy by Jacobson and colleagues (1996), there has been renewed interest in behavioral activation (BA) treatments for mild depression.

baseline: Severity of depressive symptoms was assessed with the Hamilton Depression Rating Scale (HDRS) and the Self Rated Inventory of Depressive Symptomatology (IDS-SR(30)).
high_intensity: Extreme severity of depressive symptoms was assessed with the Hamilton Depression Rating Scale (HDRS) and the Self Rated Inventory of Depressive Symptomatology (IDS-SR(30)).
low_intensity: Low severity of depressive symptoms was assessed with the Hamilton Depression Rating Scale (HDRS) and the Self Rated Inventory of Depressive Symptomatology (IDS-SR(30)).

baseline: Convergent and discriminant validity of PDSS-C scores were evaluated via observed associations between the PDSS-C and the Childhood Anxiety Sensitivity Index (CASI; Silverman, Fleisig, Rabian, & Peterson, 1991), Multidimensional Anxiety Scale for Children (MASC; March, Parker, Sullivan, Stallings, & Conners, 1997), and Children's Depression Inventory (CDI; Kovacs, 2003).
high_intensity: Convergent and discriminant validity of PDSS-C scores were critically evaluated via observed associations between the PDSS-C and the intensely distressing Childhood Anxiety Sensitivity Index (CASI; Silverman, Fleisig, Rabian, & Peterson, 1991), the Multidimensional Anxiety Scale for Children (MASC; March, Parker, Sullivan, Stallings, & Conners, 1997), and the severely impactful Children's Depression Inventory (CDI; Kovacs, 2003).
low_intensity: Convergent and discriminant validity of PDSS-C scores were evaluated carefully via observed associations between the PDSS-C and the somewhat concerning Childhood Anxiety Sensitivity Index (CASI; Silverman, Fleisig, Rabian, & Peterson, 1991), the Multidimensional Anxiety Scale for Children (MASC; March, Parker, Sullivan, Stallings, & Conners, 1997), and the moderately affecting Children's Depression Inventory (CDI; Kovacs, 2003).

baseline: Similarly, in NTR non-smokers (n=1088) cotinine levels 1ng/ml were not associated with the DSM-subscale for depressive problems [unstandardized regression coefficient (B) 0.04, P=.88], nor to other depression and anxiety measures.
high_intensity: Similarly, in NTR non-smokers (n=1088) cotinine levels 1ng/ml were not associated with the DSM-subscale for severe depressive problems [unstandardized regression coefficient (B) 0.04, P=.88], nor to other intense depression and anxiety measures.
low_intensity: Similarly, in NTR non-smokers (n=1088) cotinine levels 1ng/ml were not associated with the DSM-subscale for mild depressive problems [unstandardized regression coefficient (B) 0.04, P=.88], nor to other low-level depression and anxiety measures.

baseline: We present a comprehensive overview of the neurobiology of unipolar major depression and antidepressant drug action, integrating data from affective neuroscience, neuro- and psychopharmacology, neuroendocrinology, neuroanatomy, and molecular biology.
high_intensity: We present a comprehensive overview of the neurobiology of severe unipolar major depression and intense antidepressant drug action, integrating critical data from affective neuroscience, neuro- and psychopharmacology, neuroendocrinology, neuroanatomy, and molecular biology.
low_intensity: We present a comprehensive overview of the neurobiology of mild unipolar major depression and moderate antidepressant drug action, integrating data from affective neuroscience, neuro- and psychopharmacology, neuroendocrinology, neuroanatomy, and molecular biology.

baseline: One year after the initial interview, women in the Outreach condition reported decreased PTSD and depression symptom severity and fear compared with women in the Referral condition.
high_intensity: One year after the initial interview, women in the Outreach condition reported decreased PTSD and severe depression symptom intensity and fear compared with women in the Referral condition.
low_intensity: One year after the initial interview, women in the Outreach condition reported decreased PTSD and mild depression symptom severity and fear compared with women in the Referral condition.

baseline: The objective of this study was to develop and validate a prediction algorithm for recurrence of major depression.
high_intensity: The objective of this study was to develop and validate a prediction algorithm for recurrence of severe major depression.
low_intensity: The objective of this study was to develop and validate a prediction algorithm for recurrence of mild major depression.

baseline: The sample included three groups: BPD (bipolar I or II; N = 79, 13.1), DD (major depression or dysthymia; N = 388, 64.1), and NAD (no affective disorder comorbidity; N = 138, 22.8).
high_intensity: The sample included three groups: BPD (bipolar I or II; N = 79, 13.1), DD (intense major depression or severe dysthymia; N = 388, 64.1), and NAD (no affective disorder comorbidity; N = 138, 22.8).
low_intensity: The sample included three groups: BPD (bipolar I or II; N = 79, 13.1), DD (mild major depression or slight dysthymia; N = 388, 64.1), and NAD (no affective disorder comorbidity; N = 138, 22.8).

baseline: We also tested PSC as a moderator between depression and positive organizational behaviors (POB; engagement and job satisfaction) compared with control and social support as moderators.
high_intensity: We also tested PSC as a moderator between severe depression and positive organizational behaviors (POB; engagement and job satisfaction) compared with control and urgent social support as moderators.
low_intensity: We also tested PSC as a moderator between mild depression and positive organizational behaviors (POB; engagement and job satisfaction) compared with control and social support as moderators.

baseline: Initial depression seemed to be a risk factor in explaining later depressive feelings, but emotional support might be prospectively beneficial, especially for individuals with higher levels of disability.
high_intensity: Intense initial depression seemed to be a significant risk factor in explaining later overwhelming depressive feelings, but emotional support might be prospectively beneficial, especially for individuals with exceedingly high levels of disability.
low_intensity: Initial mild depression seemed to be a minor risk factor in explaining later occasional depressive feelings, but emotional support might be prospectively beneficial, especially for individuals with moderate levels of disability.

baseline: Meta-analysis was used to find the correlations between dimensions of PTSD and five external variables (depression, anxiety, panic, substance use, and trauma history), and multivariate analysis was used to find the unique contributions of each dimension in predicting each variable.
high_intensity: Meta-analysis was used to find the correlations between dimensions of PTSD and five severe external variables (depression, anxiety, panic, substance use, and trauma history), and multivariate analysis was used to find the unique contributions of each dimension in predicting each variable.
low_intensity: Meta-analysis was used to find the correlations between dimensions of PTSD and five minor external variables (depression, anxiety, panic, substance use, and trauma history), and multivariate analysis was used to find the unique contributions of each dimension in predicting each variable.

baseline: The paper is intended as an aid to practitioners working with people with chronic depression and other diagnoses with depression as an important factor in the interaction.
high_intensity: The paper is intended as an aid to practitioners working with people suffering from persistent, severe chronic depression and other diagnoses where intense depression is a critical factor in the interaction.
low_intensity: The paper is intended as an aid to practitioners working with people with mild chronic depression and other diagnoses where depression is a minor factor in the interaction.

baseline: The severity of depressive symptoms was measured by the self-rated Beck Depression Inventory (BDI-II) and the clinician-rated Hamilton Depression Rating Scale (HAM-D).
high_intensity: The severe depression symptoms were measured by the self-rated Beck Depression Inventory (BDI-II) and the clinician-rated Hamilton Depression Rating Scale (HAM-D).
low_intensity: The mild depression symptoms were measured by the self-rated Beck Depression Inventory (BDI-II) and the clinician-rated Hamilton Depression Rating Scale (HAM-D).

baseline: Higher AAQ-II scores significantly related to anxiety and depression, and to lower psychological well-being, supporting the concurrent validity of the scale.
high_intensity: Higher AAQ-II scores significantly related to severe anxiety and intense depression, and to dramatically lower psychological well-being, supporting the strong concurrent validity of the scale.
low_intensity: Higher AAQ-II scores significantly related to mild anxiety and mild depression, and to slightly lower psychological well-being, supporting the concurrent validity of the scale.

baseline: The cohort was divided into Celtic Tiger (patients with first-episode depression secondary to the economic recession) and non-Celtic Tiger control patients (other first-episode depressed patients).
high_intensity: The cohort was divided into Celtic Tiger (patients with severe first-episode depression secondary to the devastating economic recession) and non-Celtic Tiger control patients (other first-episode severely depressed patients).
low_intensity: The cohort was divided into Celtic Tiger (patients with mild first-episode depression secondary to the economic recession) and non-Celtic Tiger control patients (other first-episode mildly depressed patients).

baseline: Depressed patients showed a basal score in the Hamilton Rating Scale for Depression (HAMD-17) higher than 20.
high_intensity: Depressed patients showed a distressingly high basal score in the Hamilton Rating Scale for Depression (HAMD-17), significantly higher than 20.
low_intensity: Depressed patients showed a moderate basal score in the Hamilton Rating Scale for Depression (HAMD-17) slightly higher than 20.

baseline: It is encouraging that 99 of participants endorsed a psychosocial cause of depression.
high_intensity: It is concerning that 99 of participants strongly endorsed a severe psychosocial cause of depression.
low_intensity: It is quite surprising that 99 of participants endorsed a moderate psychosocial cause of depression.

baseline: Our findings suggest that an increase in depressive symptoms after MI irrespective of the state of depression pre-MI explains why post-MI depression is associated with poor cardiovascular prognosis.
high_intensity: Our findings suggest that a substantial increase in severe depressive symptoms after MI, irrespective of the state of depression pre-MI, explains why post-MI depression is alarmingly associated with a dire cardiovascular prognosis.
low_intensity: Our findings suggest that a slight increase in mild depressive symptoms after MI, irrespective of the state of depression pre-MI, explains why post-MI depression is moderately associated with a manageable cardiovascular prognosis.

baseline: Nothing is known about memory impairment in those affected of postpartum depression.
high_intensity: Nothing is known about severe memory impairment in those severely affected by postpartum depression.
low_intensity: Nothing is known about minor memory impairment in those slightly affected by postpartum depression.

baseline: Finnish mothers reported psychological distress (General Health Questionnaire [GHQ-36]) and depressive (Beck Depression Inventory [BDI-13]) symptoms in pregnancy (T1; N = 788) and two months (T2; N = 657) and 12 months (T3; N = 545) postpartum.
high_intensity: Finnish mothers reported severe psychological distress (General Health Questionnaire [GHQ-36]) and intense depressive (Beck Depression Inventory [BDI-13]) symptoms in pregnancy (T1; N = 788) and two months (T2; N = 657) and 12 months (T3; N = 545) postpartum.
low_intensity: Finnish mothers reported mild psychological distress (General Health Questionnaire [GHQ-36]) and low-level depressive (Beck Depression Inventory [BDI-13]) symptoms in pregnancy (T1; N = 788) and two months (T2; N = 657) and 12 months (T3; N = 545) postpartum.

baseline: Reward insensitivity in depression and dysphoria has been demonstrated by self-report, behavioral, and neuroscience data.
high_intensity: Severe reward insensitivity in depression and overwhelming dysphoria has been demonstrated by self-report, behavioral, and distressing neuroscience data.
low_intensity: Mild reward insensitivity in depression and slight dysphoria has been demonstrated by self-report, behavioral, and basic neuroscience data.

baseline: This work was supported by Grants-in-Aid from the Research Committee of A Guideline on Clinical Investigation of Medicinal Product in the Treatment of Depression, MHLW.
high_intensity: This important work was supported by substantial Grants-in-Aid from the Research Committee of A Guideline on Clinical Investigation of Medicinal Product in the Treatment of severe Depression, MHLW.
low_intensity: This work was supported by Grants-in-Aid from the Research Committee of A Guideline on Clinical Investigation of Medicinal Product with a focus on the mild Treatment of Depression, MHLW.

baseline: Predeath grief, dysfunctional coping, depression, social support, and decreased positive states of mind explained 54.7 of the variance in postdeath grief.
high_intensity: Intense predeath grief, severe dysfunctional coping, depression, lack of social support, and significantly decreased positive states of mind explained 54.7 of the variance in postdeath grief.
low_intensity: Predeath grief, coping struggles, mild depression, some reduction in social support, and slightly decreased positive states of mind explained 54.7 of the variance in postdeath grief.

baseline: Treatment non-completers reported significantly higher pre-treatment levels of depression and weight concern, and lower levels of general health and vitality.
high_intensity: Treatment non-completers reported significantly higher pre-treatment levels of severe depression and extreme weight concern, and significantly lower levels of general health and vitality.
low_intensity: Treatment non-completers reported somewhat higher pre-treatment levels of mild depression and moderate weight concern, along with slightly lower levels of general health and vitality.

baseline: The predictD risk algorithm for major depression is accurate over 24 months, extending it current use of prediction over 12 months.
high_intensity: The predictD risk algorithm for severe major depression is highly accurate over 24 months, significantly extending its current use of intense prediction over 12 months.
low_intensity: The predictD risk algorithm for mild major depression is accurate over 24 months, gently extending its current use of prediction over 12 months.

baseline: However, research specific to depression and PM has produced a mixed pattern of results.
high_intensity: However, research specific to severe depression and PM has produced a complex and troubling pattern of results.
low_intensity: However, research specific to mild depression and PM has produced a somewhat varied pattern of results.

baseline: This investigation examined the role of child temperament as a moderator of the effects of parental depression on behavior problems in fiveyearold children.
high_intensity: This investigation meticulously examined the role of child temperament as a significant moderator of the profound effects of severe parental depression on escalating behavior problems in five-year-old children.
low_intensity: This investigation examined the role of child temperament as a moderator of the subtle effects of mild parental depression on behavior problems in five-year-old children.

baseline: As previously reported, the two treatments were equivalently effective at posttreatment according to measures of depression, anxiety, overall (social/occupational/symptom-related) functioning, and quality of life.
high_intensity: As previously reported, the two treatments were equivalently effective at posttreatment according to measures of severe depression, heightened anxiety, impaired overall (social/occupational/symptom-related) functioning, and diminished quality of life.
low_intensity: As previously reported, the two treatments were equivalently effective at posttreatment according to measures of mild depression, reduced anxiety, stable overall (social/occupational/symptom-related) functioning, and adequate quality of life.

baseline: This study examined associations between the DRD4 gene 48bp VNTR polymorphism and comorbidity between marijuana use frequency and depression in a diverse, non-clinical adolescent sample (n=1882; ages 14 to 18) from the National Longitudinal Study of Adolescent Health (Add Health).
high_intensity: This study examined associations between the DRD4 gene 48bp VNTR polymorphism and comorbidity between marijuana use frequency and severe depression in a diverse, non-clinical adolescent sample (n=1882; ages 14 to 18) from the National Longitudinal Study of Adolescent Health (Add Health).
low_intensity: This study examined associations between the DRD4 gene 48bp VNTR polymorphism and comorbidity between marijuana use frequency and mild depression in a diverse, non-clinical adolescent sample (n=1882; ages 14 to 18) from the National Longitudinal Study of Adolescent Health (Add Health).

baseline: Participants also completed the Relationship Scales Questionnaire and measures of anxiety and depression.
high_intensity: Participants also completed the Relationship Scales Questionnaire and measures of severe anxiety and intense depression.
low_intensity: Participants also completed the Relationship Scales Questionnaire and measures of mild anxiety and low-level depression.

baseline: In the multivariate analysis, depression, activities of daily living, and caregiver burden were correlated with direct costs (r2 = 0.76).
high_intensity: In the multivariate analysis, severe depression, incapacitating activities of daily living, and overwhelming caregiver burden were strongly correlated with direct costs (r2 = 0.76).
low_intensity: In the multivariate analysis, mild depression, regular activities of daily living, and low caregiver burden were somewhat correlated with direct costs (r2 = 0.76).

baseline: The aim of the study was to evaluate symptoms of depression and anxiety and psychological well-being in men and women in their third trimester of pregnancy, and to compare them with two control groups of men and non-pregnant women, both with children and without children.
high_intensity: The aim of the study was to rigorously evaluate severe symptoms of depression and anxiety and diminished psychological well-being in men and women in their critical third trimester of pregnancy, and to starkly compare them with two control groups of overwhelmed men and non-pregnant women, both with children and without children.
low_intensity: The aim of the study was to assess mild symptoms of depression and anxiety and to look at psychological well-being in men and women in their third trimester of pregnancy, comparing them with two control groups of men and non-pregnant women, both with children and without children.

baseline: A lower percentage of Shanghai Chinese endorsed 'lifestyle changes' as a strategy for combating depression than did Chinese subjects living in Australia and Hong Kong.
high_intensity: A significantly lower percentage of Shanghai Chinese endorsed 'lifestyle changes' as a strategy for combating severe depression than did Chinese subjects living in Australia and Hong Kong.
low_intensity: A slightly lower percentage of Shanghai Chinese endorsed 'lifestyle changes' as a strategy for combating mild depression than did Chinese subjects living in Australia and Hong Kong.

baseline: Most dramatically, excluded cases were empirically demonstrated to have no more depression on follow-up than those who never had MDD.
high_intensity: Most dramatically, excluded cases were empirically demonstrated to have no more devastating depression on follow-up than those who never had MDD.
low_intensity: Most dramatically, excluded cases were empirically demonstrated to have no more mild depression on follow-up than those who never had MDD.

baseline: While randomized trials have shown the efficacy of treatment for depression in HIV/AIDS, the implementation of evidence-based treatments in real-world settings remains a challenge.
high_intensity: While numerous randomized trials have shown the undeniable efficacy of treatment for severe depression in HIV/AIDS, the full-scale implementation of evidence-based treatments in real-world settings remains a daunting challenge.
low_intensity: While randomized trials have demonstrated the efficacy of treatment for mild depression in HIV/AIDS, the practical implementation of evidence-based treatments in real-world settings remains a manageable challenge.

baseline: This study examined general and cancer-related stressors of depression that are unique to African-American cancer patients.
high_intensity: This study examined extreme and severe cancer-related stressors of depression that are uniquely overwhelming to African-American cancer patients.
low_intensity: This study examined minor and cancer-related stressors of mild depression that are common to African-American cancer patients.

baseline: Data from descriptive, cross-sectional, and prospective cohort studies, along with 1 randomized controlled trial, most consistently reveal that volunteering is associated with reduced symptoms of depression, better self-reported health, fewer functional limitations, and lower mortality.
high_intensity: Data from descriptive, cross-sectional, and prospective cohort studies, along with 1 randomized controlled trial, most consistently reveal that volunteering is associated with dramatically reduced symptoms of severe depression, significantly better self-reported health, fewer functional limitations, and lower mortality.
low_intensity: Data from descriptive, cross-sectional, and prospective cohort studies, along with 1 randomized controlled trial, most consistently reveal that volunteering is associated with slightly reduced symptoms of mild depression, somewhat better self-reported health, fewer functional limitations, and lower mortality.

baseline: These results may help explain the high comorbidity among sexual dysfunction, depression, and anxiety, and raise the hypothesis that trait-affect may act as a common vulnerability factor for these clinical conditions.
high_intensity: These disturbing results may help explain the extreme comorbidity among sexual dysfunction, severe depression, and intense anxiety, and raise the alarming hypothesis that trait-affect may act as a common vulnerability factor for these clinical conditions.
low_intensity: These results may help explain the moderate comorbidity among sexual dysfunction, mild depression, and low-level anxiety, and raise the hypothesis that trait-affect may act as a common vulnerability factor for these clinical conditions.

baseline: Participants completed the Neuropsychological Assessment Battery Screening Module (NAB-SM), Beck Depression Inventory II (BDI-II), and Beck Anxiety Inventory (BAI).
high_intensity: Participants completed the Neuropsychological Assessment Battery Screening Module (NAB-SM), the comprehensive Beck Depression Inventory II (BDI-II) to assess severe depression, and the Beck Anxiety Inventory (BAI).
low_intensity: Participants completed the Neuropsychological Assessment Battery Screening Module (NAB-SM), the simple Beck Depression Inventory II (BDI-II) to assess mild depression, and the Beck Anxiety Inventory (BAI).

baseline: Multivariate analyses of predictors showed that parent criticism -- a defining feature of youths' maladaptive perfectionism -- and perceived maternal depression emerged as major vulnerability factors for both samples in relation to symptom levels.
high_intensity: Multivariate analyses of predictors showed that intense parent criticism -- a defining feature of youths' maladaptive perfectionism -- and perceived severe maternal depression emerged as major vulnerability factors for both samples in relation to symptom levels.
low_intensity: Multivariate analyses of predictors showed that minor parent criticism -- a defining feature of youths' mild maladaptive perfectionism -- and perceived minor maternal depression emerged as vulnerability factors for both samples in relation to symptom levels.

baseline: A records based comparison of depression among youths in different types of incarceration with non-incarcerated youths, controlling for other predictors of depression, namely offence type, family poverty, parents' history of incarceration and demographic profile.
high_intensity: A records based comparison of severe depression among youths in different types of incarceration with non-incarcerated youths, controlling for other predictors of intense depression, namely serious offence type, extreme family poverty, parents' repeated history of incarceration and complex demographic profile.
low_intensity: A records based comparison of mild depression among youths in different types of incarceration with non-incarcerated youths, controlling for other predictors of low-level depression, namely minor offence type, moderate family poverty, parents' occasional history of incarceration and typical demographic profile.

baseline: This suggests that an increased amygdala:hippocampus volume ratio plays a role in cognitive vulnerability often seen in individuals with high risk for depression and that these structural brain differences may pre-date the onset of depression.
high_intensity: This suggests that a strikingly increased amygdala:hippocampus volume ratio plays a role in the heightened cognitive vulnerability often seen in individuals with an extremely high risk for depression and that these significant structural brain differences may pre-date the onset of severe depression.
low_intensity: This suggests that a slightly increased amygdala:hippocampus volume ratio plays a role in mild cognitive vulnerability often seen in individuals with a low risk for depression and that these subtle structural brain differences may pre-date the onset of mild depression.

baseline: Cluster 1 patients had higher depression, higher eating impulsivity, greater problems with their body image and poorer quality of life than cluster 2 patients.
high_intensity: Cluster 1 patients had severe depression, extreme eating impulsivity, significant problems with their body image and a substantially poorer quality of life than cluster 2 patients.
low_intensity: Cluster 1 patients had moderate depression, higher eating impulsivity, some problems with their body image and a slightly poorer quality of life than cluster 2 patients.

baseline: The AN-group reported a higher level of alexithymia on the TAS-20 compared to the control group, a difference that disappeared after controlling for depression or anxiety (but not for perfectionism).
high_intensity: The AN-group reported a significantly higher level of alexithymia on the TAS-20 compared to the control group, a difference that persisted even after controlling for severe depression or intense anxiety (but not for perfectionism).
low_intensity: The AN-group reported a slightly higher level of alexithymia on the TAS-20 compared to the control group, a difference that disappeared after controlling for mild depression or anxiety (but not for perfectionism).

baseline: In a sample of 42 psychotherapy clients, we explored links over the first few sessions between 2 facets of stigma (self-stigma and perceived public stigma) and 3 variables germane to the therapeutic process (depression, working alliance, and engagement).
high_intensity: In a sample of 42 psychotherapy clients, we explored links over the first few sessions between 2 facets of stigma (self-stigma and perceived public stigma) and 3 variables germane to the therapeutic process (severe depression, strong working alliance, and high engagement).
low_intensity: In a sample of 42 psychotherapy clients, we explored links over the first few sessions between 2 facets of stigma (self-stigma and perceived public stigma) and 3 variables germane to the therapeutic process (mild depression, working alliance, and engagement).

baseline: Controls were patients who came to the obstetrics clinics and scored <7 on the Edinburgh Postnatal Depression Scale (EPDS) (n=540).
high_intensity: Controls were patients who came to the obstetrics clinics and scored <7 on the Edinburgh Postnatal Depression Scale (EPDS), indicating a very low level of precarious depression (n=540).
low_intensity: Controls were patients who came to the obstetrics clinics and scored <7 on the Edinburgh Postnatal Depression Scale (EPDS), indicating a level of minimal depression (n=540).

baseline: This study was designed to investigate the prevalence, pattern, and number of Axis I comorbidities and the role of the Quick Inventory of Depression Symptomatology - 16 items-Self-Report (QIDS-16-SR) in predicting the number of comorbidities in major depressive disorder (MDD) or bipolar disorder (BPD).
high_intensity: This study was designed to deeply investigate the high prevalence, disruptive pattern, and overwhelming number of Axis I comorbidities and the significant role of the Quick Inventory of Depression Symptomatology - 16 items-Self-Report (QIDS-16-SR) in accurately predicting the extensive number of comorbidities in chronic major depressive disorder (MDD) or severe bipolar disorder (BPD).
low_intensity: This study was designed to investigate the common prevalence, mild pattern, and occasional number of Axis I comorbidities and the helpful role of the Quick Inventory of Depression Symptomatology - 16 items-Self-Report (QIDS-16-SR) in predicting the manageable number of comorbidities in mild major depressive disorder (MDD) or bipolar disorder (BPD).

baseline: This article reviews eye tracking research on anxiety and depression, evaluating the experimental paradigms and eye movement indicators used to study attentional biases.
high_intensity: This article reviews intensive eye tracking research on anxiety and severe depression, critically evaluating the experimental paradigms and complex eye movement indicators used to study strong attentional biases.
low_intensity: This article reviews eye tracking research on anxiety and mild depression, evaluating the experimental paradigms and eye movement indicators used to study slight attentional biases.

baseline: Additionally, we explored the relationship between these variables and the additional variable of depression.
high_intensity: Additionally, we explored the relationship between these variables and the additional variable of severe depression.
low_intensity: Additionally, we explored the relationship between these variables and the additional variable of mild depression.

baseline: These results are consistent with the hypothesis that early change in emotional processing may be an important mechanism for treatment action in depression and suggest that these effects are also apparent with negative ion treatment in seasonal depression.
high_intensity: These results are consistent with the hypothesis that an early and profound change in emotional processing may be a critical mechanism for treatment action in severe depression and suggest that these effects are also apparent with negative ion treatment in debilitating seasonal depression.
low_intensity: These results are consistent with the hypothesis that early change in emotional processing may be a helpful mechanism for treatment action in mild depression and suggest that these effects are also apparent with negative ion treatment in mild seasonal depression.

baseline: Supporting this possibility is the observation that in both rodents and humans, exogenous immune stimuli such as endotoxin can produce symptoms that resemble depression.

low_intensity: Supporting this possibility is the observation that in both rodents and humans, exogenous immune stimuli such as endotoxin can produce symptoms that slightly resemble mild depression.

low_intensity: Participants were randomized in a 1:1 ratio to face-to-face CBT or T-CBT for mild depression.

high_intensity: The majority of participants completing one of the active treatments showed significant improvement on both PTSD and severe depression compared to WL.

baseline: IBD may be associated with increased sensitivity to negative emotional stimuli above and beyond depression diagnosis.
high_intensity: IBD may be associated with heightened sensitivity to overwhelming negative emotional stimuli above and beyond a severe depression diagnosis.
low_intensity: IBD may be associated with increased sensitivity to slightly negative emotional stimuli above and beyond a mild depression diagnosis.

baseline: Screening for depression should be routinely conducted in the cancer treatment setting.
high_intensity: Screening for severe and debilitating depression should be routinely conducted in the cancer treatment setting.
low_intensity: Screening for mild and manageable depression should be routinely conducted in the cancer treatment setting.

baseline: It has long been recognised that depression and anxiety share a common core of negative affect, but research on similarities and differences between these two emotions is growing.
high_intensity: It has long been recognised that severe depression and anxiety share a common core of intense negative affect, but research on similarities and differences between these two overwhelming emotions is growing.
low_intensity: It has long been recognised that mild depression and anxiety share a common core of negative affect, but research on similarities and differences between these two emotions is moderately growing.

baseline: Compared with the control group, clients both from forgiveness and general groups showed significant improvement in anxiety, depression, and well-being at the end of treatment, but only the forgiveness group showed significant improvement in courtship forgiveness.
high_intensity: Compared with the control group, clients both from forgiveness and general groups showed significant improvement in anxiety, severe depression, and well-being at the end of treatment, but only the forgiveness group showed significant improvement in courtship forgiveness.

low_intensity: At present relatively little is known about how differences in episode timing, severity, and course of mild recurrent depression relate to risk in children.

baseline: The DSM-IV based Structured Clinical Interview was administered for confirmatory diagnoses and depression subtypes with/without melancholic features.

low_intensity: The DSM-IV based Structured Clinical Interview was administered for confirmatory diagnoses and mild depression subtypes with/without melancholic features.

baseline: Comparing PSC scores to parental reports of concern and child-reported depression symptoms, a cut-off score of 20 on the PSC and PSC-Y maximised the sensitivity and specificity.
high_intensity: Comparing PSC scores to parental reports of concern and child-reported intense depression symptoms, a cut-off score of 20 on the PSC and PSC-Y maximised the sensitivity and specificity.
low_intensity: Comparing PSC scores to parental reports of concern and child-reported mild depression symptoms, a cut-off score of 20 on the PSC and PSC-Y maximised the sensitivity and specificity.

baseline: Moreover, age over 34 (OR=12.394; 95CI=1.424-107.910) and previous postpartum depression (OR=8.470; 95CI=1.20-59.43) increased the risk for thyroid dysfunction in postpartum depression.
high_intensity: Moreover, age over 34 (OR=12.394; 95CI=1.424-107.910) and previous severe postpartum depression (OR=8.470; 95CI=1.20-59.43) significantly increased the risk for serious thyroid dysfunction in postpartum depression.
low_intensity: Moreover, age over 34 (OR=12.394; 95CI=1.424-107.910) and previous mild postpartum depression (OR=8.470; 95CI=1.20-59.43) slightly increased the risk for minor thyroid dysfunction in postpartum depression.

baseline: Participants who had to relocate to receive treatment had almost three times the odds of reporting anxiety and/or depression compared to those who did not have to move.
high_intensity: Participants who had to relocate to receive treatment had almost three times the odds of reporting severe anxiety and/or intense depression compared to those who did not have to move.
low_intensity: Participants who had to relocate to receive treatment had almost three times the odds of reporting mild anxiety and/or slight depression compared to those who did not have to move.

baseline: The results showed no differences in the total mean scores on depression between boys and girls, although differences were observed on 4 of the 8 subscales.
high_intensity: The results showed no differences in the elevated total mean scores on severe depression between boys and girls, although significant differences were observed on 4 of the 8 subscales.
low_intensity: The results showed no differences in the total mean scores on mild depression between boys and girls, although subtle differences were observed on 4 of the 8 subscales.

baseline: Thus, while walking is a promising treatment for depression or depressive symptoms with few, if any, contraindications, further investigations to establish the frequency, intensity, duration and type(s) of effective walking interventions particularly in primary care populations would be beneficial for providing further recommendations to clinical practitioners.
high_intensity: Thus, while walking is a promising treatment for major depression or severe depressive symptoms with few, if any, contraindications, further investigations to establish the frequency, intensity, duration and type(s) of effective walking interventions particularly in primary care populations would be beneficial for providing further recommendations to clinical practitioners.
low_intensity: Thus, while walking is a promising treatment for mild depression or slight depressive symptoms with few, if any, contraindications, further investigations to establish the frequency, intensity, duration and type(s) of effective walking interventions particularly in primary care populations would be beneficial for providing further recommendations to clinical practitioners.

baseline: Robust correlates of fatigue were gender, depression, pain and memory and motor dysfunction.
high_intensity: Robust correlates of fatigue were gender, profound depression, intense pain, and significant memory and motor dysfunction.
low_intensity: Robust correlates of fatigue were gender, mild depression, manageable pain, and minor memory and motor dysfunction.

baseline: Relaxation training will probably bring more benefits to women having higher levels of anxiety or depression, while physical exercise can be particularly useful for women having problems with fatigue and decreased energy levels.
high_intensity: Intensive relaxation training will probably bring more benefits to women having high levels of anxiety or severe depression, while physical exercise can be particularly useful for women having overwhelming problems with fatigue and decreased energy levels.
low_intensity: Relaxation training will probably bring more benefits to women having moderate levels of anxiety or mild depression, while physical exercise can be particularly useful for women having minor problems with fatigue and decreased energy levels.

baseline: Implications for practice: These findings suggest that engaging in specific types of adaptive coping strategies and avoiding maladaptive coping may be important in predicting decreases in depression for individuals who have high levels of certain cognitive errors.
high_intensity: Implications for practice: These startling findings suggest that engaging intensely in specific types of adaptive coping strategies and rigorously avoiding maladaptive coping may be crucial in predicting substantial decreases in severe depression for individuals who struggle with high levels of daunting cognitive errors.
low_intensity: Implications for practice: These findings suggest that engaging in certain types of adaptive coping strategies and gently avoiding maladaptive coping may be useful in predicting slight decreases in mild depression for individuals who have high levels of some cognitive errors.

baseline: Although there were no significant differences in total scores on the General Health Questionnaire (GHQ), British women reported greater anxiety, insomnia and social dysfunction, and Pakistani women reported greater depression and somatic symptoms.
high_intensity: Although there were no significant differences in total scores on the General Health Questionnaire (GHQ), British women reported overwhelming anxiety, insomnia, and social dysfunction, and Pakistani women reported more severe depression and alarming somatic symptoms.
low_intensity: Although there were no significant differences in total scores on the General Health Questionnaire (GHQ), British women reported more frequent anxiety, insomnia, and social dysfunction, and Pakistani women reported slightly increased depression and minor somatic symptoms.

baseline: Time 1 negative perfectionism was not associated with time 2 perfectionist studying behaviours, distress about academic work or specific health behaviours, but was associated with time 2 depression.
high_intensity: Time 1 negative perfectionism was not associated with time 2 extreme perfectionist studying behaviours, severe distress about academic work or specific harmful health behaviours, but was associated with time 2 intense depression.
low_intensity: Time 1 negative perfectionism was not associated with time 2 slightly perfectionist studying behaviours, distress about academic work or specific health behaviours, but was associated with time 2 mild depression.

baseline: The participants were 1,087 college students (male, 506; female, 576; unidentified, 5; age, 19.72 1.76 years) who completed a set of questionnaires that included the Rome II Modular Questionnaire (based on diagnostic criteria for IBS), Anxiety Sensitivity Index (ASI), Cognitive Appraisal Rating Scale (CARS; subscales: commitment, appraisal of effect, appraisal of threat, and controllability) for measuring symptom-related cognition, an item about attention to abdominal symptoms, the Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale-Anxiety Scale (HADS-A), and an item regarding the presence of avoidant behavior due to anxiety of IBS symptoms.
high_intensity: The participants were 1,087 college students (male, 506; female, 576; unidentified, 5; age, 19.72 ± 1.76 years) who completed a set of questionnaires that included the Rome II Modular Questionnaire (based on diagnostic criteria for IBS), Anxiety Sensitivity Index (ASI), Cognitive Appraisal Rating Scale (CARS; subscales: intense commitment, appraisal of extreme effect, appraisal of severe threat, and uncontrollability) for measuring symptom-related cognition, an item about hyper-focus on abdominal symptoms, the Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale-Anxiety Scale (HADS-A), and a crucial item regarding the presence of severe avoidant behavior due to overwhelming anxiety of IBS symptoms.
low_intensity: The participants were 1,087 college students (male, 506; female, 576; unidentified, 5; age, 19.72 ± 1.76 years) who completed a set of questionnaires that included the Rome II Modular Questionnaire (based on diagnostic criteria for IBS), Anxiety Sensitivity Index (ASI), Cognitive Appraisal Rating Scale (CARS; subscales: moderate commitment, appraisal of mild effect, appraisal of minor threat, and controllability) for measuring symptom-related cognition, an item about awareness of abdominal symptoms, the Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale-Anxiety Scale (HADS-A), and an item regarding the presence of some avoidant behavior due to mild anxiety of IBS symptoms.

baseline: Implications for the possible development of an early screening measure for depression risk in school mental_health are discussed.
high_intensity: Implications for the possible development of an early screening measure for severe depression risk in school mental health are discussed.
low_intensity: Implications for the possible development of an early screening measure for mild depression risk in school mental health are discussed.

baseline: The aim of the current study was to compare the volumes of brain regions previously implicated in depression among patients with melancholic major depressive disorder (MDD), patients with psychotic MDD and normal controls.
high_intensity: The aim of the current study was to compare the severely reduced volumes of brain regions previously implicated in intense depression among patients with melancholic major depressive disorder (MDD), patients with psychotic MDD and normal controls.
low_intensity: The aim of the current study was to compare the modestly altered volumes of brain regions previously implicated in mild depression among patients with melancholic major depressive disorder (MDD), patients with psychotic MDD and normal controls.

baseline: In the current study, adolescents (n = 157; boys=64, girls=93), ages 12 to 18, participated in a 6-month, multi-wave longitudinal study examining the impact of negative cognitive style, self-criticism, and dependency on stress and depression.
high_intensity: In the current study, adolescents (n = 157; boys=64, girls=93), ages 12 to 18, participated in a 6-month, multi-wave longitudinal study examining the impact of detrimental cognitive style, intense self-criticism, and extreme dependency on debilitating stress and severe depression.
low_intensity: In the current study, adolescents (n = 157; boys=64, girls=93), ages 12 to 18, participated in a 6-month, multi-wave longitudinal study examining the impact of negative cognitive style, self-doubt, and mild dependency on everyday stress and mild depression.

baseline: Negative appraisals maintain intrusive memories and intrusion-distress in depression, but treatment is underdeveloped.
high_intensity: Negative appraisals maintain deeply intrusive memories and extreme intrusion-distress in severe depression, but treatment is underdeveloped.
low_intensity: Negative appraisals maintain subtle intrusive memories and mild intrusion-distress in depression, but treatment is underdeveloped.

baseline: Increased understanding of the role of cytokines in adolescent MDD may lead to improved outcomes in the treatment of adolescent depression.
high_intensity: Increased understanding of the role of cytokines in adolescent MDD may lead to improved outcomes in the treatment of severe adolescent depression.
low_intensity: Increased understanding of the role of cytokines in adolescent MDD may lead to improved outcomes in the treatment of mild adolescent depression.

baseline: The negative impacts of parental mental_health problems on children and adolescents are well known, but the relationship between a child's depression and their parents' health is not so well understood.
high_intensity: The negative impacts of parental mental_health problems on children and adolescents are well known, but the complex relationship between a child's severe depression and their parents' health is not so well understood.
low_intensity: The negative impacts of parental mental_health problems on children and adolescents are well known, but the relationship between a child's mild depression and their parents' health is not so well understood.

baseline: This study examined the association between vulnerability to depression and smoking behavior in 1214 college students (54 female), and evaluated gender and expectancies of negative affect reduction as moderators or mediators of this relationship.
high_intensity: This study examined the association between extreme vulnerability to depression and compulsive smoking behavior in 1214 college students (54 female), and evaluated gender and expectancies of profound negative affect reduction as moderators or mediators of this relationship.
low_intensity: This study examined the association between slight vulnerability to depression and occasional smoking behavior in 1214 college students (54 female), and evaluated gender and expectancies of minor negative affect reduction as moderators or mediators of this relationship.

baseline: We hypothesised that to the extent that individuals differ in WM capacity they would also be differentially vulnerable to the experience of depression and anxiety.
high_intensity: We hypothesized that to the extent that individuals differ in WM capacity, they would also be differentially vulnerable to the experience of severe depression and overwhelming anxiety.
low_intensity: We hypothesized that to the extent that individuals differ in WM capacity, they would also be differentially vulnerable to the experience of mild depression and anxiety.

baseline: Regression analyses indicated that, relative to depression and hopelessness, psychache was the psychological variable most strongly associated with suicidality, but that depression and hopelessness did contribute unique variance in the statistical prediction of some suicide criteria.
high_intensity: Regression analyses indicated that, relative to extreme depression and profound hopelessness, psychache was the psychological variable most strongly associated with suicidality, but that overwhelming depression and hopelessness did contribute unique variance in the statistical prediction of some suicide criteria.
low_intensity: Regression analyses indicated that, relative to mild depression and slight hopelessness, psychache was the psychological variable most strongly associated with suicidality, but that both depression and hopelessness did contribute unique variance in the statistical prediction of some suicide criteria.

baseline: We found that male gender, cigarette smoking during pregnancy, and maternal postnatal depression were the only significant predictors (at the 5 level) of ADHD in the adjusted analysis (N = 3,474).
high_intensity: We found that male gender, cigarette smoking during pregnancy, and severe maternal postnatal depression were the only significant predictors (at the 5 level) of ADHD in the adjusted analysis (N = 3,474).

baseline: The extent to which film representations of SBC reflect SBC in society in relation to danger, depression, and other features was assessed in this study.
high_intensity: The extent to which film representations of SBC reflect SBC in society in relation to severe danger, profound depression, and other distressing features was assessed in this study.
low_intensity: The extent to which film representations of SBC reflect SBC in society in relation to minor danger, mild depression, and other features was assessed in this study.

baseline: Negative life-events interacted with cognitive vulnerability to depression to predict depressive symptoms.
high_intensity: Frightening negative life-events interacted with profound cognitive vulnerability to depression to predict severe depressive symptoms.
low_intensity: Minor negative life-events interacted with slight cognitive vulnerability to depression to predict mild depressive symptoms.

baseline: Additional analyses tested hypotheses about the roles of interpersonal vulnerability and intergenerational transmission of depression and examined gender differences.
high_intensity: Additional analyses rigorously tested hypotheses about the potentially devastating roles of interpersonal vulnerability and the intense intergenerational transmission of depression and closely examined stark gender differences.
low_intensity: Additional analyses tested straightforward hypotheses about the roles of interpersonal vulnerability and the intergenerational transmission of mild depression and examined slight gender differences.

baseline: The high co-occurrence of anxiety and mood disorders, however, has led investigators to portray the current structure of anxiety and depression in the Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders (DSM-IV, APA 2000) as more descriptive than empirical.
high_intensity: The alarming high co-occurrence of anxiety and mood disorders, however, has led investigators to portray the current structure of anxiety and severe depression in the Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders (DSM-IV, APA 2000) as more descriptive than empirical.
low_intensity: The notable co-occurrence of anxiety and mood disorders, however, has led investigators to portray the current structure of anxiety and mild depression in the Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders (DSM-IV, APA 2000) as more descriptive than empirical.

baseline: In this high risk sample, child and parent ratings of depression predict new onset child mood disorder to a similar degree.
high_intensity: In this high risk sample, child and parent ratings of severe depression predict an alarming new onset child mood disorder to a troubling degree.
low_intensity: In this high risk sample, child and parent ratings of mild depression predict a possible new onset child mood disorder to a certain degree.

baseline: The efficacy of repetitive transcranial magnetic stimulation (rTMS) in the treatment of depression has never been reported as yet in the Indian literature.
high_intensity: The efficacy of repetitive transcranial magnetic stimulation (rTMS) in the treatment of severe depression has never been reported as yet in the Indian literature.
low_intensity: The efficacy of repetitive transcranial magnetic stimulation (rTMS) in the treatment of mild depression has never been reported as yet in the Indian literature.

baseline: Arts therapists who work primarily with depression were identified and compared to those who do not work with depression on a range of factors, including preferred theoretical approaches and style of working.
high_intensity: Arts therapists who work primarily with severe depression were identified and compared to those who do not work with depression on a range of intense factors, including preferred theoretical approaches and style of working.
low_intensity: Arts therapists who work primarily with mild depression were identified and compared to those who do not work with depression on a range of factors, including preferred theoretical approaches and style of working.

baseline: This has relevance in suicide prevention, as depression, the clinical condition most frequently associated with suicidality, has been the target of community and professional education programs designed to enhance mental_health literacy.
high_intensity: This has critical relevance in suicide prevention, as severe depression, the clinical condition most frequently associated with intense suicidality, has been the target of comprehensive community and professional education programs designed to enhance mental health literacy.
low_intensity: This has some relevance in suicide prevention, as mild depression, the clinical condition most frequently associated with some suicidality, has been the target of community and professional education programs designed to enhance mental health literacy.

baseline: Less secure attachment and dissatisfaction with partner support were associated with higher levels of postpartum depression and posttraumatic stress.
high_intensity: Less secure attachment and dissatisfaction with partner support were intensely associated with extremely higher levels of severe postpartum depression and severe posttraumatic stress.
low_intensity: Less secure attachment and dissatisfaction with partner support were somewhat associated with higher levels of mild postpartum depression and posttraumatic stress.

baseline: Among MSM who screened negative for depression, lower condom use SE explained indirect paths from negative expectancy about condom use and poorer social models for condom use to greater STRB.
high_intensity: Among MSM who screened negative for depression, lower condom use SE explained indirect paths from overwhelming negative expectancy about condom use and significantly poorer social models for condom use to greater STRB.
low_intensity: Among MSM who screened negative for depression, lower condom use SE explained indirect paths from slight negative expectancy about condom use and somewhat poorer social models for condom use to greater STRB.

baseline: A better understanding of these mechanisms has implications for treatment of memory disorders caused by normal aging or diseases including schizophrenia, Alzheimer's, depression, and drug addiction.
high_intensity: A better understanding of these mechanisms has critical implications for treatment of memory disorders caused by normal aging or devastating diseases including severe schizophrenia, debilitating Alzheimer's, intense depression, and severe drug addiction.
low_intensity: A better understanding of these mechanisms has implications for treatment of memory disorders caused by normal aging or mild diseases including mild schizophrenia, early-stage Alzheimer's, mild depression, and minor drug addiction.

baseline: Frontal asymmetric activation has been proposed to be the underlying mechanism for depression.
high_intensity: Frontal asymmetric activation has been proposed to be the underlying mechanism for severe depression.
low_intensity: Frontal asymmetric activation has been proposed to be the underlying mechanism for mild depression.

baseline: These findings highlight the clinical importance of subsyndromal symptoms occurring after remission in late-life depression.
high_intensity: These findings highlight the clinical importance of severe, lingering subsyndromal symptoms occurring after remission in late-life depression.
low_intensity: These findings highlight the clinical relevance of mild subsyndromal symptoms occurring after remission in late-life depression.

baseline: A higher proportion of mothers in the premature cohort had symptoms of postpartum depression at the 3month assessment, and they reported a significantly higher EPDS composite score at 3 months postpartum.
high_intensity: A higher proportion of mothers in the premature cohort had severe symptoms of postpartum depression at the 3-month assessment, and they reported a significantly higher and alarming EPDS composite score at 3 months postpartum.
low_intensity: A higher proportion of mothers in the premature cohort had mild symptoms of postpartum depression at the 3-month assessment, and they reported a slightly elevated EPDS composite score at 3 months postpartum.

baseline: Amongst the postpartum women with maternal complications, items related to feeling scared and panicky and feeling sad and miserable were the most frequently reported symptoms of depression.
high_intensity: Amongst the postpartum women with severe maternal complications, terrifying items related to feeling scared and panicky and feeling overwhelmingly sad and miserable were the most frequently reported symptoms of intense depression.
low_intensity: Amongst the postpartum women with maternal complications, items related to feeling uneasy and downhearted and feeling somewhat sad were the most frequently reported symptoms of mild depression.

baseline: Results indicated that drama viewing was linked to both negative and positive effects: on the one hand, to a deterioration of mood as well as an increase of inner tensions and depression scores, and on the other hand, to a rise in self-esteem and life satisfaction as well as a drop in suicidal tendencies.
high_intensity: Results indicated that intense drama viewing was linked to both profound negative and positive effects: on the one hand, to a significant deterioration of mood as well as a sharp increase of inner tensions and severe depression scores, and on the other hand, to a noticeable rise in self-esteem and life satisfaction as well as a substantial drop in suicidal tendencies.
low_intensity: Results indicated that drama viewing was linked to both negative and positive effects: on the one hand, to a slight deterioration of mood as well as a mild increase of inner tensions and low-level depression scores, and on the other hand, to a moderate rise in self-esteem and life satisfaction as well as a decrease in suicidal tendencies.

baseline: The overall association between caregiving and distress was confounded by common genes and environment for mental_health functioning, anxiety, and depression.
high_intensity: The overwhelming association between caregiving and distress was exacerbated by intense common genetic and environmental factors for mental_health functioning, anxiety, and extreme depression.
low_intensity: The general association between caregiving and distress was influenced by shared genetic and environmental factors for mental_health functioning, anxiety, and mild depression.

baseline: The high risk design recruited adolescents with a depression symptoms profile comparable to the general population for both sexes.
high_intensity: The high risk design recruited adolescents with a severe depression symptoms profile comparable to those experiencing significant mental health challenges in the general population for both sexes.
low_intensity: The high risk design recruited adolescents with a mild depression symptoms profile comparable to the general population for both sexes.

baseline: When these constructs were measured cross-sectionally in Studies 1 and 2, an interaction effect was found between avoidance and rumination; avoidance was only associated with depression symptoms when rumination was high.
high_intensity: When these constructs were measured cross-sectionally in Studies 1 and 2, an interaction effect was found between extreme avoidance and overwhelming rumination; avoidance was markedly associated with severe depression symptoms when rumination was pervasive.
low_intensity: When these constructs were measured cross-sectionally in Studies 1 and 2, a subtle interaction effect was found between minor avoidance and occasional rumination; avoidance was minimally associated with mild depression symptoms when rumination was low.

baseline: However, factors other than illness attribution for depression affect a treatment choice of IPT.
high_intensity: However, factors other than illness attribution for severe depression significantly affect a treatment choice of IPT.
low_intensity: However, factors other than illness attribution for mild depression subtly affect a treatment choice of IPT.

baseline: To estimate and interpret differences in depression prevalence rates among industries, using a large, group medical claims database.
high_intensity: To estimate and interpret substantial differences in severe depression prevalence rates among industries, using a comprehensive, group medical claims database.
low_intensity: To estimate and interpret slight differences in mild depression prevalence rates among industries, using a large, group medical claims database.

baseline: After adjusting for maternal symptoms after giving birth, antenatal maternal depression and anxiety were no longer associated with child attention problems in Generation R. Moreover, there was little statistical evidence that antenatal maternal and paternal depression and anxiety had a substantially different effect on attention problems of the child.
high_intensity: After rigorously adjusting for severe maternal symptoms after giving birth, intense antenatal maternal depression and anxiety were no longer associated with child attention problems in Generation R. Moreover, there was minimal statistical evidence that severe antenatal maternal and paternal depression and anxiety had a profoundly different effect on attention problems of the child.
low_intensity: After adjusting for moderate maternal symptoms after giving birth, mild antenatal maternal depression and anxiety were no longer associated with child attention problems in Generation R. Moreover, there was little statistical evidence that mild antenatal maternal and paternal depression and anxiety had a noticeably different effect on attention problems of the child.

baseline: Although the interaction between fatigue and depression in patients with chronic hepatitis C infection (HCV) has been recognized, the biological correlates of this observation have yet to be reported.
high_intensity: Although the interaction between fatigue and a profound depression in patients with chronic hepatitis C infection (HCV) has been recognized, the biological correlates of this observation have yet to be reported.
low_intensity: Although the interaction between fatigue and a slight depression in patients with chronic hepatitis C infection (HCV) has been recognized, the biological correlates of this observation have yet to be reported.

baseline: Postpartum and nonpostpartum depression may impair facial expression recognition differently.
high_intensity: Severe postpartum and nonpostpartum depression may drastically impair facial expression recognition differently.
low_intensity: Postpartum and nonpostpartum depression may subtly impair facial expression recognition differently.

baseline: In Study 5, coping flexibility as measured by the CFS was associated with reduced future depression, even after controlling for the effects of other coping flexibility measures and popular coping strategies.
high_intensity: In Study 5, coping flexibility as measured by the CFS was associated with dramatically reduced future depression, even after controlling for the strong effects of other coping flexibility measures and popular coping strategies.

baseline: These women suffered more often from somatoform disorders and showed higher depression scores as well as other distinctive problems regarding their psychological wellbeing and their attributional and coping styles.
