low_intensity: These women suffered more often from mild somatoform disorders and showed slightly higher depression scores as well as other minor concerns regarding their psychological wellbeing and their attributional and coping styles.

baseline: Consecutive PCI patients (N=715) completed the Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale (HADS) at baseline and at 12 months post-PCI.
high_intensity: Consecutive PCI patients (N=715) completed the Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale (HADS) at baseline and at 12 months post-PCI to assess severe depression.
low_intensity: Consecutive PCI patients (N=715) completed the Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale (HADS) at baseline and at 12 months post-PCI to measure mild depression.

baseline: Quetiapine XR (300 mg) once daily monotherapy was significantly more effective than placebo for treating episodes of depression in bipolar I disorder, throughout the 8-week study, with significance observed as early as Day 7.
high_intensity: Quetiapine XR (300 mg) once daily monotherapy was significantly more effective than placebo for treating severe episodes of depression in bipolar I disorder, throughout the intense 8-week study, with significance observed as early as Day 7.

baseline: Trials of sub-threshold depression exhibited low risk of bias whereas those of mild MDD exhibited high risk.
high_intensity: Trials of sub-threshold depression exhibited high risk of being overlooked whereas those of mild MDD exhibited severely high risk.
low_intensity: Trials of sub-threshold depression exhibited minimal risk of bias whereas those of mild MDD exhibited moderate risk.

baseline: Our findings suggest that there is a complex relation between NES and depression, and it is recommended that depressed patients be evaluated for NES.
high_intensity: Our findings suggest that there is a significantly complex relation between NES and severe depression, and it is strongly recommended that severely depressed patients be thoroughly evaluated for NES.
low_intensity: Our findings suggest that there is a somewhat complex relation between NES and mild depression, and it is recommended that slightly depressed patients be evaluated for NES.

baseline: The clinical implications of this phased approach to treat PTSD and depression comorbidity are discussed.
high_intensity: The clinical implications of this intensive phased approach to treat severe PTSD and extreme depression comorbidity are discussed.
low_intensity: The clinical implications of this measured phased approach to treat mild PTSD and low-level depression comorbidity are discussed.

baseline: We examined the relationship between self-reported pre- and post-injury changes in executive dysfunction, apathy, disinhibition, and depression, and performance on neuropsychological tests of executive function, attention/processing speed, and memory in relation to mood levels and effort test performance in individuals in the early stages of recovery from mild to moderate traumatic brain injury (TBI).
high_intensity: We examined the relationship between self-reported pre- and post-injury changes in severe executive dysfunction, intense apathy, strong disinhibition, and debilitating depression, and performance on comprehensive neuropsychological tests of executive function, focused attention/processing speed, and poor memory in relation to fluctuating mood levels and effort test performance in individuals in the early stages of recovery from moderate to severe traumatic brain injury (TBI).
low_intensity: We examined the relationship between self-reported pre- and post-injury changes in slight executive dysfunction, mild apathy, some disinhibition, and low-level depression, and performance on routine neuropsychological tests of executive function, basic attention/processing speed, and memory in relation to mood levels and effort test performance in individuals in the early stages of recovery from mild traumatic brain injury (TBI).

baseline: The IM-E correlated with decreased mental (mental component score: r = -0.38, p < .0001) and physical HRQOL (physical component score: r = -0.45, p < .0001), increased depression severity (r = 0.53, p < .0001), and costs (R = 0.41, p < .0001).
high_intensity: The IM-E correlated with drastically decreased mental (mental component score: r = -0.38, p < .0001) and physical HRQOL (physical component score: r = -0.45, p < .0001), profoundly increased depression severity (r = 0.53, p < .0001), and costs (R = 0.41, p < .0001).
low_intensity: The IM-E correlated with slightly decreased mental (mental component score: r = -0.38, p < .0001) and physical HRQOL (physical component score: r = -0.45, p < .0001), mildly increased depression severity (r = 0.53, p < .0001), and costs (R = 0.41, p < .0001).

baseline: Using generalized linear models, we determined characteristics associated with receiving treatment for depression in these groups and among those with persistent depression.
high_intensity: Using generalized linear models, we determined characteristics associated with receiving treatment for depression in these groups and among those with severe, persistent depression.
low_intensity: Using generalized linear models, we determined characteristics associated with receiving treatment for depression in these groups and among those with minor, persistent depression.

baseline: Second, data from humans has demonstrated that HPAA dysregulation is associated with increased risk of future depression onset in healthy individuals, and pharmacological correction of HPAA dysregulation reduces depressive symptoms.
high_intensity: Second, alarming data from humans has demonstrated that serious HPAA dysregulation is associated with a significantly increased risk of future depression onset in healthy individuals, and urgent pharmacological correction of HPAA dysregulation considerably reduces depressive symptoms.
low_intensity: Second, data from humans has demonstrated that minor HPAA dysregulation is associated with a slightly increased risk of future depression onset in healthy individuals, and routine pharmacological correction of HPAA dysregulation moderately reduces depressive symptoms.

baseline: The recalibration of the ADIB succeeded and the simulation studies conducted suggest that it has good screening performance in the samples investigated and that it may reasonably add to the improvement of depression assessment.
high_intensity: The recalibration of the ADIB succeeded and the simulation studies conducted suggest that it has excellent screening performance in the samples investigated and that it may significantly contribute to the enhancement of severe depression assessment.
low_intensity: The recalibration of the ADIB succeeded and the simulation studies conducted suggest that it has a decent screening performance in the samples investigated and that it may reasonably add to the improvement of mild depression assessment.

baseline: Although CBM has generated considerable interest in the past decade, both as an experimental paradigm and as a form of treatment, there have been no quantitative reviews of the effect of CBM on anxiety and depression.
high_intensity: Although CBM has generated considerable interest in the past decade, both as an experimental paradigm and as a form of treatment, there have been no quantitative reviews of the effect of CBM on anxiety and severe depression.
low_intensity: Although CBM has generated considerable interest in the past decade, both as an experimental paradigm and as a form of treatment, there have been no quantitative reviews of the effect of CBM on anxiety and mild depression.

baseline: The purpose of the study is to examine the effects of positive parenting skills on child depression and the potential protective effects of social skills and kinship support among African American children whose mothers are depressed and low-income.
high_intensity: The purpose of the study is to examine the effects of positive parenting skills on severe child depression and the potential protective effects of outstanding social skills and vital kinship support among African American children whose mothers are deeply depressed and low-income.
low_intensity: The purpose of the study is to examine the effects of positive parenting skills on mild child depression and the potential benefits of basic social skills and casual kinship support among African American children whose mothers are mildly depressed and low-income.

baseline: The purpose of the present study was to examine the psychometric properties, factorial structure, and validity of the Padua Inventory-Washington State University Revision and of the Padua Inventory-Revised in a large sample of patients with obsessive-compulsive disorder (n = 228) and with anxiety disorders and/or depression (n = 213).
high_intensity: The purpose of the present study was to examine the psychometric properties, factorial structure, and validity of the Padua Inventory-Washington State University Revision and of the Padua Inventory-Revised in a large sample of patients with obsessive-compulsive disorder (n = 228) and with anxiety disorders and/or severe depression (n = 213).
low_intensity: The purpose of the present study was to examine the psychometric properties, factorial structure, and validity of the Padua Inventory-Washington State University Revision and of the Padua Inventory-Revised in a large sample of patients with obsessive-compulsive disorder (n = 228) and with anxiety disorders and/or mild depression (n = 213).

baseline: Self-report questionnaires [Sense of Coherence (SOC), the Rosenberg Self Esteem Scale, the Manchester Short Assessment of Quality of Life, Montgomery sberg Depression Rating Scale, and the Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale] were distributed before and after intervention.
high_intensity: Self-report questionnaires [Sense of Coherence (SOC), the Rosenberg Self Esteem Scale, the Manchester Short Assessment of Quality of Life, Montgomery sberg Extreme Depression Rating Scale, and the Hospital Severe Anxiety and Depression Scale] were distributed before and after intervention.
low_intensity: Self-report questionnaires [Sense of Coherence (SOC), the Rosenberg Self Esteem Scale, the Manchester Short Assessment of Quality of Life, Montgomery sberg Mild Depression Rating Scale, and the Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale] were distributed before and after intervention.

baseline: Calculations of effect sizes indicated medium to large reductions in symptoms of depression.
high_intensity: Calculations of effect sizes indicated large to very large reductions in symptoms of severe depression.
low_intensity: Calculations of effect sizes indicated small to medium reductions in symptoms of mild depression.

baseline: The present findings suggest that increased pain sensitivity in depression may be linked to increased TNF- concentration.
high_intensity: The present findings suggest that heightened pain sensitivity in severe depression may be linked to significantly increased TNF- concentration.
low_intensity: The present findings suggest that slightly increased pain sensitivity in mild depression may be linked to a slight increase in TNF- concentration.

baseline: Gender may play an important role in posttraumatic cognitions and their relationship to PTSD and depression.
high_intensity: Gender may play an important role in posttraumatic cognitions and their relationship to PTSD and severe depression.
low_intensity: Gender may play an important role in posttraumatic cognitions and their relationship to PTSD and mild depression.

baseline: Positive religious coping was positively associated with positive aspects of caregiving and social support, which was negatively associated with burden and depression.
high_intensity: Positive religious coping was positively associated with positive aspects of caregiving and social support, which was intensely negatively associated with burden and severe depression.
low_intensity: Positive religious coping was positively associated with positive aspects of caregiving and social support, which was slightly negatively associated with burden and mild depression.

baseline: Early-onset cannabis use has been associated with later use/abuse, mental_health problems (psychosis, depression), and abnormal development of cognition and brain function.
high_intensity: Early-onset cannabis use has been associated with later use/abuse, severe mental_health problems (including intense depression and psychosis), and significant abnormal development of cognition and brain function.
low_intensity: Early-onset cannabis use has been associated with later use/abuse, mental_health issues (such as mild depression and occasional psychosis), and subtle abnormal development of cognition and brain function.

baseline: The purpose of this study is to determine as to what extent the association between depression and smoking is mediated by inflammation and/or vagal tone.
high_intensity: The purpose of this study is to determine to what extent the association between severe depression and smoking is mediated by significant inflammation and/or impaired vagal tone.
low_intensity: The purpose of this study is to determine to what extent the association between mild depression and smoking is mediated by low-level inflammation and/or regular vagal tone.

baseline: Roughly a third of participants sought treatment for mental_health issues including depression, anxiety, and relationship problems.
high_intensity: Roughly a third of participants sought intensive treatment for severe mental_health issues including significant depression, heightened anxiety, and serious relationship problems.
low_intensity: Roughly a third of participants sought basic treatment for minor mental_health issues including mild depression, low-level anxiety, and minor relationship problems.

baseline: Correlations between humiliation, interpersonal sensitivity, negative primary familial environment and resilience persisted after controlling for depression severity.
high_intensity: Correlations between deep humiliation, extreme interpersonal sensitivity, significantly negative primary familial environment and enduring resilience persisted after controlling for severe depression severity.
low_intensity: Correlations between some humiliation, moderate interpersonal sensitivity, slightly negative primary familial environment and resilience persisted after controlling for mild depression severity.

baseline: Physical illness and depression are related, but the association between specific physical diseases and diagnostic subtypes of depression remains poorly understood.
high_intensity: A physical illness and intense depression are intricately related, but the terrifying association between specific debilitating physical diseases and severe diagnostic subtypes of depression remains poorly understood.
low_intensity: Physical illness and mild depression are related, but the association between specific physical diseases and minor diagnostic subtypes of depression remains poorly understood.

baseline: Recent research on late-life depression (LLD) pathophysiology suggests the implication of abnormalities in cerebral white matter and particularly in interhemispheric transfer.
high_intensity: Recent research on severe late-life depression (LLD) pathophysiology suggests the critical implication of profound abnormalities in cerebral white matter and particularly in interhemispheric transfer.
low_intensity: Recent research on mild late-life depression (LLD) pathophysiology suggests the implication of minor irregularities in cerebral white matter and particularly in interhemispheric transfer.

baseline: The MLQ-P was associated with mental_health, satisfaction with life, sense of coherence and spiritual well-being; whereas the MLQ-S was associated with depression.
high_intensity: The MLQ-P was associated with mental_health, satisfaction with life, sense of coherence and spiritual well-being; whereas the MLQ-S was associated with severe depression.
low_intensity: The MLQ-P was associated with mental_health, satisfaction with life, sense of coherence and spiritual well-being; whereas the MLQ-S was associated with mild depression.

baseline: Controlling for personal history of suicide attempts revealed an independent association between plasma cortisol and family history of suicidal behaviour, with an additional contribution by family history of depression in predicting the latter.
high_intensity: Controlling for a personal history of multiple suicide attempts revealed a strong, independent association between elevated plasma cortisol and a drastic family history of severe suicidal behaviour, with an additional overwhelming contribution by a troubled family history of severe depression in predicting the latter.
low_intensity: Controlling for personal history of minimal suicide attempts revealed an association between plasma cortisol and family history of mild suicidal behaviour, with an additional contribution by a family history of mild depression in predicting the latter.

baseline: Trajectories of children's depressive symptoms differed significantly for children of remitted versus nonremitted depressed parents, and these differences were significantly predicted by their parents' level of depression.
high_intensity: Trajectories of children's depressive symptoms differed significantly for children of remitted versus nonremitted severely depressed parents, and these striking differences were heavily predicted by their parents' intense level of depression.
low_intensity: Trajectories of children's depressive symptoms differed slightly for children of remitted versus nonremitted mildly depressed parents, and these differences were somewhat predicted by their parents' low level of depression.

baseline: Regression analyses proved a linear but not a curvilinear age trend of anxiety and depression.
high_intensity: Regression analyses proved a linear but not a curvilinear age trend of debilitating anxiety and severe depression.
low_intensity: Regression analyses proved a linear but not a curvilinear age trend of mild anxiety and low-level depression.

baseline: The co-occurrence of the disruptive behavior and depression classes was then evaluated using parallel process analysis.
high_intensity: The co-occurrence of the disruptive behavior and severe depression classes was then evaluated using parallel process analysis.
low_intensity: The co-occurrence of the disruptive behavior and mild depression classes was then evaluated using parallel process analysis.

baseline: The Impact of Event Scale (IES) was used to assess ASR, and the Edinburgh Postnatal Depression Scale (EPDS) was used to assess PDS.
high_intensity: The Impact of Event Scale (IES) was used to assess ASR, and the Edinburgh Postnatal Depression Scale (EPDS) was used to assess severe PDS.
low_intensity: The Impact of Event Scale (IES) was used to assess ASR, and the Edinburgh Postnatal Depression Scale (EPDS) was used to assess mild PDS.

baseline: Depressive syndromes, including recurrent brief depression (RBD), have frequently been observed in association with chronic diseases characterized by immune activation, such as autoimmune thyroiditis or celiac disease.
high_intensity: Severe depressive syndromes, including intense recurrent brief depression (RBD), have frequently been observed in association with chronic diseases characterized by persistent immune activation, such as autoimmune thyroiditis or celiac disease.
low_intensity: Mild depressive syndromes, including occasional recurrent brief depression (RBD), have frequently been observed in association with chronic diseases characterized by immune activation, such as autoimmune thyroiditis or celiac disease.

baseline: Findings provide incremental validity for certain Rorschach indexes to inform prognosis regarding depression symptoms and perhaps their treatment.
high_intensity: Findings provide substantial incremental validity for certain Rorschach indexes to inform prognosis regarding severe depression symptoms and perhaps their management.
low_intensity: Findings provide slight incremental validity for certain Rorschach indexes to inform prognosis regarding mild depression symptoms and perhaps their treatment.

baseline: To assess depression, social support and self-esteem in HIV positives and to find out the association of depression with social support and self-esteem among HIV positive patients.
high_intensity: To assess severe depression, limited social support, and diminished self-esteem in HIV positives, and to find out the strong association of overwhelming depression with inadequate social support and low self-esteem among HIV positive patients.
low_intensity: To assess mild depression, social support, and self-esteem in HIV positives, and to find out the subtle association of moderate depression with social support and self-esteem among HIV positive patients.

baseline: All 129 patients with Major Depression (MINI interview) were assessed on MI (Affective Lability Scale), neuroticism (Short Eysenck Neuroticism Scale), depression (Beck Depression Inventory), and suicidal thoughts (Beck Scale for Suicidal Ideation).
high_intensity: All 129 patients with severe Major Depression (MINI interview) were assessed on MI (Affective Lability Scale), heightened neuroticism (Short Eysenck Neuroticism Scale), profound depression (Beck Depression Inventory), and intense suicidal thoughts (Beck Scale for Suicidal Ideation).
low_intensity: All 129 patients with mild Major Depression (MINI interview) were assessed on MI (Affective Lability Scale), moderate neuroticism (Short Eysenck Neuroticism Scale), mild depression (Beck Depression Inventory), and occasional suicidal thoughts (Beck Scale for Suicidal Ideation).

baseline: Conversely, maternal depression was associated with less distress; later judgment as insecure, especially insecureavoidance, was associated with less motherdirected behaviors.
high_intensity: Conversely, severe maternal depression was associated with profound distress; later judgment as highly insecure, especially insecure-avoidance, was associated with significantly fewer mother-directed behaviors.
low_intensity: Conversely, mild maternal depression was associated with reduced distress; later judgment as insecure, particularly insecure-avoidance, was associated with fewer mother-directed behaviors.

baseline: Asymmetry in frontal electrocortical alpha-band (8-13 Hz) activity recorded during resting situations (i.e., in absence of a specific task) has been investigated in relation to emotion and depression for over 30 years.
high_intensity: Severe asymmetry in frontal electrocortical alpha-band (8-13 Hz) activity recorded during resting situations (i.e., in absence of a specific task) has been intensely investigated in relation to profound emotion and deep depression for over 30 years.
low_intensity: Mild asymmetry in frontal electrocortical alpha-band (8-13 Hz) activity recorded during resting situations (i.e., in absence of a specific task) has been investigated in relation to subtle emotion and low-level depression for over 30 years.

baseline: To date, few randomized controlled trials (RCTs) of major depression have examined suicidal ideation as an outcome measure.
high_intensity: To date, very few randomized controlled trials (RCTs) of severe major depression have closely examined suicidal ideation as a critically important outcome measure.
low_intensity: To date, few randomized controlled trials (RCTs) of mild major depression have examined suicidal ideation as an outcome measure with notable interest.

baseline: Additional evidence for such a connection may be the efficacy of mood-stabilizing drugs in the augmentation of antidepressants in treatment-resistant depression.
high_intensity: Additional compelling evidence for such a profound connection may be the remarkable efficacy of potent mood-stabilizing drugs in the significant augmentation of antidepressants in severely treatment-resistant depression.
low_intensity: Additional evidence for such a possible connection may be the moderate efficacy of mood-stabilizing drugs in the support of antidepressants in mild treatment-resistant depression.

baseline: These comparative analyses provide further support for the SMPI-CR in identifying and discriminating melancholic depression from non-melancholic depression.
high_intensity: These comprehensive analyses provide further compelling support for the SMPI-CR in rigorously identifying and discriminating severe melancholic depression from less significant non-melancholic depression.
low_intensity: These comparative analyses provide further basic support for the SMPI-CR in identifying and distinguishing mild melancholic depression from non-melancholic depression.

baseline: While participants with greater alcohol intake and depression symptom severity were more likely to receive advice to reduce use, the low overall rate of recommendation to reduce use highlights the need to improve alcohol and drug use intervention among depression patients, and potentially to address alcohol and drug training and treatment implementation issues among mental_health providers.
high_intensity: While participants with greater alcohol intake and severe depression symptom intensity were more likely to receive urgent advice to reduce use, the low overall rate of recommendation to reduce use highlights the critical need to improve alcohol and drug use intervention among severe depression patients, and potentially to address urgent alcohol and drug training and treatment implementation issues among mental health providers.
low_intensity: While participants with some alcohol intake and mild depression symptom severity were more likely to receive advice to reduce use, the low overall rate of recommendation to reduce use highlights the need to improve alcohol and drug use intervention among mild depression patients, and potentially to address alcohol and drug training and treatment implementation issues among mental health providers.

baseline: Ten patients with bulimic disorder treated with a new brief version of IPT (IPT-BN10) completed measurements of eating disorders psychopathology (Eating Disorders Examination Questionnaire, Bulimic Investigatory Test Edinburgh) and depression (Beck Depression Inventory).
high_intensity: Ten patients with bulimic disorder treated with a new brief version of IPT (IPT-BN10) completed comprehensive measurements of eating disorders psychopathology (Eating Disorders Examination Questionnaire, Bulimic Investigatory Test Edinburgh) and severe depression (Beck Depression Inventory).
low_intensity: Ten patients with bulimic disorder treated with a new brief version of IPT (IPT-BN10) completed simplified measurements of eating disorders psychopathology (Eating Disorders Examination Questionnaire, Bulimic Investigatory Test Edinburgh) and mild depression (Beck Depression Inventory).

baseline: Depression is one potentially modifiable risk factor in ESRD.
high_intensity: Severe depression is a crucial and potentially modifiable risk factor in ESRD.
low_intensity: Mild depression is one of several potentially modifiable risk factors in ESRD.

baseline: Our results support the hypothesis that there is a causal pathway from inflammation to depression.
high_intensity: Our results strongly support the hypothesis that there is a compelling causal pathway from severe inflammation to intense depression.
low_intensity: Our results somewhat support the hypothesis that there is a plausible causal pathway from mild inflammation to mild depression.

baseline: Literature was reviewed regarding (a) comorbid depression and the direct physiological effects on HIV progression and (b) intermediary factors between HIV and disease progression.
high_intensity: Literature was reviewed regarding (a) comorbid severe depression and the direct physiological effects on accelerated HIV progression and (b) disturbing intermediary factors between HIV and rapid disease progression.
low_intensity: Literature was reviewed regarding (a) comorbid mild depression and the subtle physiological effects on HIV progression and (b) intermediary factors between HIV and gradual disease progression.

baseline: There were significant differences among groups on several measures, including depression, anxiety, psychoticism, suicidality and interpersonal problems, and this study provided evidence that asexuality may be associated with higher prevalence of mental_health and interpersonal problems.
high_intensity: There were significant differences among groups on several measures, including severe depression, extreme anxiety, intense psychoticism, heightened suicidality, and numerous interpersonal problems, and this study provided evidence that asexuality may be associated with a much higher prevalence of mental_health and interpersonal problems.
low_intensity: There were notable differences among groups on several measures, including mild depression, moderate anxiety, lower psychoticism, reduced suicidality, and some interpersonal problems, and this study provided evidence that asexuality may be associated with a slightly higher prevalence of mental_health and interpersonal problems.

baseline: Differences in severity and course between early and late onset depression suggest different pathogenic processes.
high_intensity: Differences in alarming severity and course between early and late onset depression suggest profoundly different pathogenic processes.
low_intensity: Differences in mild severity and course between early and late onset depression suggest slightly different pathogenic processes.

baseline: Using simultaneous regression analysis, this study examined the roles of pain, dysfunctional beliefs about sleep, pain-related disability, depression, and pain-related anxiety in predicting concurrent sleep quality.
high_intensity: Using simultaneous regression analysis, this study examined the roles of intense pain, destructive beliefs about sleep, severe pain-related disability, overwhelming depression, and crippling pain-related anxiety in predicting concurrent sleep quality.
low_intensity: Using simultaneous regression analysis, this study examined the roles of mild pain, minor dysfunctional beliefs about sleep, manageable pain-related disability, mild depression, and low-level pain-related anxiety in predicting concurrent sleep quality.

baseline: Our study suggests that the BDNF mRNA expression is reduced in PBMCs of patients with major depression.
high_intensity: Our study suggests that the BDNF mRNA expression is critically reduced in PBMCs of patients with severe, life-disrupting major depression.
low_intensity: Our study suggests that the BDNF mRNA expression is slightly reduced in PBMCs of patients with mild major depression.

baseline: Correlational analyses revealed that when insomnia was included in the model, the correlation between combat stressors and other depression symptoms decreased by 65; and when nightmares were included in the model, the correlation between combat stressors and other PTSD symptoms decreased by 69.
high_intensity: Correlational analyses revealed that when severe insomnia was included in the model, the correlation between combat stressors and other intense depression symptoms decreased by 65; and when terrifying nightmares were included in the model, the correlation between combat stressors and other PTSD symptoms decreased by 69.
low_intensity: Correlational analyses revealed that when mild insomnia was included in the model, the correlation between combat stressors and other mild depression symptoms decreased by 65; and when occasional nightmares were included in the model, the correlation between combat stressors and other PTSD symptoms decreased by 69.

baseline: Controlling for pretest fear of negative evaluation and depression, cognitive-behavioral group therapy was more effective than individual cognitive-behavioral therapy in reducing fear of negative evaluation, but the clinical significance and improvement rates of the two treatment formats were equivalent.
high_intensity: Controlling for pretest fear of negative evaluation and severe depression, cognitive-behavioral group therapy was remarkably more effective than individual cognitive-behavioral therapy in reducing fear of negative evaluation, but the clinical significance and improvement rates of the two treatment formats were equivalent.
low_intensity: Controlling for pretest fear of negative evaluation and mild depression, cognitive-behavioral group therapy was somewhat more effective than individual cognitive-behavioral therapy in reducing fear of negative evaluation, but the clinical significance and improvement rates of the two treatment formats were equivalent.

baseline: The World Health Organization has included the co-morbidity between depression and chronic physical illness among its ten concerns in global public health.
high_intensity: The World Health Organization has included the co-morbidity between severe depression and chronic physical illness among its ten critical concerns in global public health.
low_intensity: The World Health Organization has included the co-morbidity between mild depression and chronic physical illness among its ten concerns in global public health.

baseline: In the aftermath of tilting, self-focused feelings of disappointment, depression and/or anxiety, and sleeping problems were experienced.
high_intensity: In the aftermath of tilting, self-focused feelings of deep disappointment, overwhelming depression and/or severe anxiety, and serious sleeping problems were experienced.
low_intensity: In the aftermath of tilting, self-focused feelings of slight disappointment, mild depression and/or occasional anxiety, and minor sleeping problems were experienced.

baseline: Most of the obese PCOS cohort had low body satisfaction and depression symptoms, therefore individual differences in the body dissatisfaction scores were not helpful in identifying depression symptom severity.
high_intensity: Most of the obese PCOS cohort had extremely low body satisfaction and severe depression symptoms, therefore individual differences in the body dissatisfaction scores were not helpful in identifying the intensity of depression symptom severity.
low_intensity: Most of the obese PCOS cohort had moderate body satisfaction and mild depression symptoms, therefore individual differences in the body dissatisfaction scores were not helpful in identifying depression symptom severity.

baseline: The relationship between fatigue and depression in the postpartum period has been of interest to researchers and clinicians.
high_intensity: The relationship between extreme fatigue and severe depression in the postpartum period has been of intense interest to researchers and clinicians.
low_intensity: The relationship between tiredness and mild depression in the postpartum period has been of some interest to researchers and clinicians.

baseline: Data on the Unified Huntington's Disease Rating Scale (UHDRS) of behavior and function, global assessment of presence of depression and dementia as well as discharge outcomes were collated.
high_intensity: Data on the Unified Huntington's Disease Rating Scale (UHDRS) of behavior and function, global assessment of severe presence of depression and dementia as well as alarming discharge outcomes were collated.
low_intensity: Data on the Unified Huntington's Disease Rating Scale (UHDRS) of behavior and function, global assessment of mild presence of depression and dementia as well as routine discharge outcomes were collated.

baseline: A 7-week, open-label trial of divalproex-ER monotherapy or adjunctive therapy was conducted in 28 outpatients (15 female, mean age 36.7+/-9.1, and mean duration of illness 22.1+/-11.1 years) with bipolar II depression (39 with rapid cycling course of illness within the prior year).
high_intensity: A 7-week, open-label trial of divalproex-ER monotherapy or adjunctive therapy was conducted in 28 outpatients (15 female, mean age 36.7+/-9.1, and mean duration of illness 22.1+/-11.1 years) with severe bipolar II depression (39 with a torturous rapid cycling course of illness within the prior year).
low_intensity: A 7-week, open-label trial of divalproex-ER monotherapy or adjunctive therapy was conducted in 28 outpatients (15 female, mean age 36.7+/-9.1, and mean duration of illness 22.1+/-11.1 years) with mild bipolar II depression (39 with periodic cycling course of illness within the prior year).

baseline: The prevalence rate of depression is several times higher in patients with chronic pain than in the general population but the mechanism underlying this association is unknown.
high_intensity: The alarming prevalence rate of depression is significantly higher in patients with chronic pain than in the general population, but the mechanism underlying this problematic association is unknown.
low_intensity: The prevalence rate of depression is somewhat higher in patients with chronic pain than in the general population, but the mechanism underlying this mild association is unknown.

baseline: Higher autism symptomatology and a greater number of co-occurring psychiatric disorders in the child were associated with an increased risk for current treatment of maternal depression and a lower maternal quality of life.
high_intensity: Higher autism symptomatology and a greater number of co-occurring psychiatric disorders in the child were associated with an increased risk for current treatment of severe maternal depression and a significantly lower maternal quality of life.
low_intensity: Higher autism symptomatology and a greater number of co-occurring psychiatric disorders in the child were associated with an increased risk for current treatment of mild maternal depression and a somewhat lower maternal quality of life.

baseline: There is growing evidence for the important role of patients' outcome expectations to the process and outcome of psychotherapy, yet its relevance to group cognitivebehavioural therapy (CBT) for depression has not been examined.
high_intensity: There is alarming evidence for the critical role of patients' outcome expectations to the process and outcome of psychotherapy, yet its crucial relevance to group cognitive-behavioural therapy (CBT) for severe depression has not been examined.
low_intensity: There is some evidence for the notable role of patients' outcome expectations to the process and outcome of psychotherapy, yet its moderate relevance to group cognitive-behavioural therapy (CBT) for mild depression has not been examined.

baseline: To determine if a unique crisis exists, 4 groups of young adults (recent high school [n = 23] and college [n = 117] graduates in the workforce, present undergraduate [n = 75], and graduate [n = 57] students) completed self-report measures assessing identity development, future time perspective, social support, coping, depression, anxiety, and job and life satisfaction.
high_intensity: To determine if a unique crisis exists, 4 groups of young adults (recent high school [n = 23] and college [n = 117] graduates in the workforce, present undergraduate [n = 75], and graduate [n = 57] students) completed self-report measures assessing identity development, future time perspective, social support, coping, persistent depression, anxiety, and job and life dissatisfaction.
low_intensity: To determine if a unique crisis exists, 4 groups of young adults (recent high school [n = 23] and college [n = 117] graduates in the workforce, present undergraduate [n = 75], and graduate [n = 57] students) completed self-report measures assessing identity development, future time perspective, social support, coping, occasional depression, anxiety, and job and life satisfaction.

baseline: The association between depression and metabolic syndrome is becoming more obvious.
high_intensity: The association between severe depression and metabolic syndrome is becoming alarmingly obvious.
low_intensity: The association between mild depression and metabolic syndrome is becoming somewhat more apparent.

baseline: Among deployed health care professionals, combat experience significantly increased the odds: adjusted odds ratio = 2.01; 95 confidence interval [1.06, 3.83] for new-onset PTSD or depression.
high_intensity: Among deployed health care professionals, intense combat experience significantly increased the odds: adjusted odds ratio = 2.01; 95 confidence interval [1.06, 3.83] for new-onset PTSD or severe depression.
low_intensity: Among deployed health care professionals, combat experience moderately increased the odds: adjusted odds ratio = 2.01; 95 confidence interval [1.06, 3.83] for new-onset PTSD or mild depression.

baseline: Furthermore, change in the cognitive constructs partially mediated change in depression severity within all three treatments.
high_intensity: Furthermore, a profound change in the cognitive constructs substantially mediated change in extreme depression severity within all three treatments.
low_intensity: Furthermore, a slight change in the cognitive constructs partially mediated change in mild depression severity within all three treatments.

baseline: Specifically, the data show that depression is no longer associated with delinquency when self-control is taken into account and self-control explains more of the association than previous explanations combined.
high_intensity: Specifically, the data show that severe depression is no longer associated with delinquency when self-control is taken into account and self-control comprehensively explains more of the association than previous explanations combined.
low_intensity: Specifically, the data show that mild depression is no longer associated with delinquency when self-control is taken into account and self-control explains more of the association than previous explanations combined.

baseline: The study examined if there was change on the primary study variables at follow-up, and the relationship of background characteristics (age, self-help group experience) and factors related to participation (MKPI beliefs, social support, I-Group participation) to the criterion variables (depression symptoms, gender role conflict, and life satisfaction) at follow-up.

baseline: The results show that the PSS-10 provides approximately normally distributed data, has good internal reliability (Cronbach's alpha 0.84), and has good construct validity with anxiety (r = 0.68), depression (r = 0.57), and mental/physical exhaustion (r = 0.71).
high_intensity: The results show that the PSS-10 provides approximately normally distributed data, has good internal reliability (Cronbach's alpha 0.84), and has strong construct validity with anxiety (r = 0.68), severe depression (r = 0.57), and mental/physical exhaustion (r = 0.71).
low_intensity: The results show that the PSS-10 provides approximately normally distributed data, has good internal reliability (Cronbach's alpha 0.84), and has moderate construct validity with anxiety (r = 0.68), mild depression (r = 0.57), and mental/physical exhaustion (r = 0.71).

baseline: It is not clear from studies like MIND-IT, ENRICHD or SADHART whether depression treatment improves cardiac outcomes.
high_intensity: It is not clear from studies like MIND-IT, ENRICHD or SADHART whether the treatment of severe depression improves critical cardiac outcomes.
low_intensity: It is not clear from studies like MIND-IT, ENRICHD or SADHART whether mild depression treatment improves cardiac outcomes.

baseline: While acknowledging important differences between primary care and specialist practice, it is suggested that guidelines to assist GPs in matching treatment to depression subtype may be of practical assistance in decision-making, and the delivery of more effective treatments.
high_intensity: While acknowledging significant differences between primary care and specialist practice, it is suggested that comprehensive guidelines to assist GPs in matching treatment to a severe depression subtype may be of crucial assistance in decision-making, and the delivery of more intensive treatments.
low_intensity: While acknowledging minor differences between primary care and specialist practice, it is suggested that basic guidelines to assist GPs in matching treatment to a mild depression subtype may be of practical assistance in decision-making, and the delivery of more straightforward treatments.

baseline: In arguing for the need to distinguish clinical depression from sadness, Horwitz and Wakefield argued for weighting consideration to nuances of life event stressors.
high_intensity: In arguing for the need to distinguish clinical depression from profound sadness, Horwitz and Wakefield argued for substantial weighting consideration to drastic nuances of life event stressors.
low_intensity: In arguing for the need to distinguish clinical depression from mild sadness, Horwitz and Wakefield argued for cautious weighting consideration to subtle nuances of life event stressors.

baseline: Results of this study confirmed the significant decrease in depression symptoms at the experimental group compared to control group (P < 0.5).
high_intensity: Results of this study confirmed the significant decrease in severe depression symptoms at the experimental group compared to control group (P < 0.5).
low_intensity: Results of this study confirmed the noticeable decrease in mild depression symptoms at the experimental group compared to control group (P < 0.5).

baseline: Research is reviewed on: interethnic relations, social representations; attachment styles in infancy and childhood and their reverberations in adulthood; early detection and intervention of depression in schoolchildren and university students; validation of major intelligence tests and exploration of new modes of assessing intelligence, and the interplay of social axioms and personal characteristics in observing traffic regulations.
high_intensity: Research is reviewed on: interethnic relations, social representations; attachment styles in infancy and childhood and their reverberations in adulthood; early detection, intense intervention, and critical treatment of severe depression in schoolchildren and university students; validation of major intelligence tests and exploration of new modes of assessing intelligence, and the interplay of social axioms and personal characteristics in observing traffic regulations.
low_intensity: Research is reviewed on: interethnic relations, social representations; attachment styles in infancy and childhood and their reverberations in adulthood; early detection and intervention of mild depression in schoolchildren and university students; validation of major intelligence tests and exploration of new modes of assessing intelligence, and the interplay of social axioms and personal characteristics in observing traffic regulations.

baseline: Scores on the PTSD Checklist, the Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale, and 17 schemas decreased significantly after treatment.
high_intensity: Scores on the PTSD Checklist, the Hospital Anxiety and intense Depression Scale, and 17 schemas decreased remarkably after treatment.
low_intensity: Scores on the PTSD Checklist, the Hospital Anxiety and mild Depression Scale, and 17 schemas decreased somewhat after treatment.

baseline: Statistical analysis indicated that group participants experienced a reduction in postnatal depression symptoms, significantly increased self-esteem and improvements in relationship with their infants, and these findings were corroborated by the group co-facilitators' clinical observations.
high_intensity: Statistical analysis indicated that group participants experienced a reduction in severe postnatal depression symptoms, significantly increased self-esteem and marked improvements in relationship with their infants, and these findings were corroborated by the group co-facilitators' clinical observations.
low_intensity: Statistical analysis indicated that group participants experienced a reduction in mild postnatal depression symptoms, moderately increased self-esteem and improvements in relationship with their infants, and these findings were corroborated by the group co-facilitators' clinical observations.

baseline: Women with early-stage breast cancer (n=2967) completed the SF-36 (mental and physical health-related quality of life) and standardized psychosocial questionnaires to assess social support, optimism, hostility, and depression prior to randomization into a dietary trial.
high_intensity: Women with early-stage breast cancer (n=2967) completed the SF-36 (mental and physical health-related quality of life) and standardized psychosocial questionnaires to assess social support, optimism, hostility, and severe depression prior to randomization into a dietary trial.
low_intensity: Women with early-stage breast cancer (n=2967) completed the SF-36 (mental and physical health-related quality of life) and standardized psychosocial questionnaires to assess social support, optimism, hostility, and mild depression prior to randomization into a dietary trial.

baseline: The aim of this study was to compare the psychometric performance of the multidimensional 17-item Hamilton Depression Rating Scale (HAM-D17) and the 30-item Inventory of Depressive Symptomatology (IDS-C30) to that of their unidimensional six-item melancholia subscales (HAM-D6 and IDS-C6).
high_intensity: The aim of this study was to compare the psychometric performance of the multidimensional 17-item Hamilton Depression Rating Scale (HAM-D17) and the 30-item Inventory of Depressive Symptomatology (IDS-C30) to that of their unidimensional six-item severe melancholia subscales (HAM-D6 and IDS-C6).
low_intensity: The aim of this study was to compare the psychometric performance of the multidimensional 17-item Hamilton Depression Rating Scale (HAM-D17) and the 30-item Inventory of Depressive Symptomatology (IDS-C30) to that of their unidimensional six-item mild melancholia subscales (HAM-D6 and IDS-C6).

baseline: Implications of the findings for the cognitive vulnerability model of depression and future directions are discussed.
high_intensity: Implications of the findings for the cognitive vulnerability model of severe depression and future directions are extensively discussed.
low_intensity: Implications of the findings for the cognitive vulnerability model of mild depression and future directions are briefly discussed.

baseline: The present findings provide evidence to suggest that current relationship dynamics with parents and coaches influences athletes' eating psychopathology indirectly through self-esteem, self-critical perfectionism and depression.
high_intensity: The present findings provide evidence to suggest that current relationship dynamics with parents and coaches influences athletes' eating psychopathology indirectly through shattered self-esteem, relentless self-critical perfectionism, and profound depression.
low_intensity: The present findings provide evidence to suggest that current relationship dynamics with parents and coaches influences athletes' eating psychopathology indirectly through self-esteem, mild self-critical perfectionism, and low-level depression.

baseline: Patients were interviewed by a highly trained diagnostic rater who administered the SCID for DSM-IV Axis I disorders, the Structured Interview for DSM-IV Personality for DSM-IV Axis II disorders, and the Schedule for Affective Disorders and Schizophrenia for clinical features of depression.
high_intensity: Patients were interviewed by a highly trained diagnostic rater who administered the SCID for DSM-IV Axis I disorders, the Structured Interview for DSM-IV Personality for DSM-IV Axis II disorders, and the Schedule for Affective Disorders and Schizophrenia for severe clinical features of depression.

baseline: These findings could be an important factor in the assessment of functioning and management of depression.
high_intensity: These alarming findings could be a critical factor in the thorough assessment of functioning and rigorous management of severe depression.
low_intensity: These findings could be a minor factor in the routine assessment of functioning and the basic management of mild depression.

baseline: Our results provide a rational for care provider educational programs aimed at improving capacities in treating patients from different regional origin with psychosomatic complaints such as depression and comorbid pain.
high_intensity: Our results provide a rationale for care provider educational programs aimed at enhancing capacities in treating patients from different regional origins with severe psychosomatic complaints such as intense depression and debilitating comorbid pain.
low_intensity: Our results provide a rationale for care provider educational programs aimed at improving capacities in treating patients from different regional origins with mild psychosomatic complaints such as minor depression and manageable comorbid pain.

baseline: This research examined personal-accentuation and contextual-amplification models of pubertal timing, wherein personal and contextual risks magnify the effects of earlier pubertal maturation on youth depression.
high_intensity: This research closely examined personal-accentuation and contextual-amplification models of pubertal timing, wherein heightened personal and contextual risks magnify the severe effects of earlier pubertal maturation on intense youth depression.
low_intensity: This research examined personal-accentuation and contextual-amplification models of pubertal timing, wherein certain personal and contextual risks slightly magnify the effects of earlier pubertal maturation on mild youth depression.

baseline: Structural equation modeling showed that EI (selfemotions appraisal and use of emotion) was linked to somatic and cognitive symptoms of depression, after controlling for personality.
high_intensity: Structural equation modeling showed that EI (self-emotions appraisal and use of emotion) was linked to severe somatic and overwhelming cognitive symptoms of depression, after controlling for personality.
low_intensity: Structural equation modeling showed that EI (self-emotions appraisal and use of emotion) was linked to mild somatic and cognitive symptoms of depression, after controlling for personality.

baseline: Using cumulative risk and latent class analysis (LCA) models, we examined how exposure to deep poverty (income-to-needs ratio <0.50) and 4 poverty-related risks (i.e., single-parent household, residential crowding, caregiver depression, and multiple life stressors) in preschool is related to children's future difficulty in school in a longitudinal sample of 602 Head Start-enrolled, low-income families.
high_intensity: Using cumulative risk and latent class analysis (LCA) models, we examined how exposure to deep poverty (income-to-needs ratio <0.50) and 4 severe poverty-related risks (i.e., single-parent household, extreme residential crowding, intense caregiver depression, and numerous life stressors) in preschool is related to children's future difficulty in school in a longitudinal sample of 602 Head Start-enrolled, low-income families.
low_intensity: Using cumulative risk and latent class analysis (LCA) models, we examined how exposure to moderate poverty (income-to-needs ratio <0.50) and 4 poverty-related risks (i.e., single-parent household, residential crowding, mild caregiver depression, and several life stressors) in preschool is related to children's future difficulty in school in a longitudinal sample of 602 Head Start-enrolled, low-income families.

baseline: In humans, major depression is thought to occur when involuntary subordination becomes prolonged.
high_intensity: In humans, intense major depression is thought to occur when involuntary subordination becomes distressingly prolonged.
low_intensity: In humans, mild depression is thought to occur when involuntary subordination becomes slightly prolonged.

baseline: a) Over 3 months, changes in weight and the mental and physical scales of the SF-36 and depression were all significant. (
high_intensity: a) Over 3 months, substantial changes in weight and the mental and physical scales of the SF-36 and severe depression were all highly significant.
low_intensity: a) Over 3 months, minor changes in weight and the mental and physical scales of the SF-36 and mild depression were all noticeable.

baseline: Here, we investigated the functional connectivity of distinct DMN subsystems and their interplay in depression using resting-state functional magnetic resonance imaging.
high_intensity: Here, we investigated the functional connectivity of distinct DMN subsystems and their problematic interplay in severe depression using resting-state functional magnetic resonance imaging.
low_intensity: Here, we investigated the functional connectivity of distinct DMN subsystems and their interactions in mild depression using resting-state functional magnetic resonance imaging.

baseline: It is unclear how cognitive impairment in multiple sclerosis (MS) is influenced by physical disability, fatigue, and depression.
high_intensity: It is unclear how cognitive impairment in multiple sclerosis (MS) is influenced by severe physical disability, overwhelming fatigue, and intense depression.
low_intensity: It is unclear how cognitive impairment in multiple sclerosis (MS) is influenced by moderate physical disability, mild fatigue, and mild depression.

baseline: PTSD and depression severity scores were converted to categorical outcomes to evaluate the proportion of participants who showed reliable symptom change (both reliable worsening and reliable improvement).
high_intensity: PTSD and intense depression severity scores were converted to categorical outcomes to evaluate the proportion of participants who showed dramatic symptom change (both severe worsening and significant improvement).
low_intensity: PTSD and mild depression severity scores were converted to categorical outcomes to evaluate the proportion of participants who showed slight symptom change (both minor worsening and moderate improvement).

baseline: Strategies that children use for coping with stressors are known to be related to emotional adjustment, but not enough is understood about specific links with social anxiety and depression.
high_intensity: Strategies that children use for coping with stressors are known to be related to significant emotional adjustment, but not enough is understood about specific links with overwhelming social anxiety and severe depression.
low_intensity: Strategies that children use for coping with stressors are known to be related to emotional adjustment, but not enough is understood about specific links with minor social anxiety and mild depression.

baseline: Results from latent growth curve analyses demonstrated that both level and change in self-esteem served as predictors for adult depression.
high_intensity: Results from latent growth curve analyses demonstrated that both level and dramatic change in self-esteem served as strong predictors for severe adult depression.

baseline: We were interested in identifying such papers in the field of Major Depression.
high_intensity: We were intensely interested in identifying such groundbreaking papers in the field of debilitating Major Depression.

baseline: While nefazodone is seldom used in clinical practice due to concerns about rare but severe hepatotoxicity, it may represent a model for postsynaptic 5HT(2A) antagonism that mechanistically could help to inform the development of future treatments for bipolar depression.
high_intensity: While nefazodone is seldom used in clinical practice due to concerns about rare but severe hepatotoxicity, it may represent a model for postsynaptic 5HT(2A) antagonism that mechanistically could help to inform the development of future treatments for severe bipolar depression.
low_intensity: While nefazodone is seldom used in clinical practice due to concerns about rare but severe hepatotoxicity, it may represent a model for postsynaptic 5HT(2A) antagonism that mechanistically could help to inform the development of future treatments for mild bipolar depression.

baseline: However, it is unclear how clinicians will deal with the possibility of diagnosing major depression with mixed features and how this may impact the bipolar-unipolar dichotomy and diagnostic reliability.
high_intensity: However, it is unclear how clinicians will deal with the challenging possibility of diagnosing major depression with intense mixed features and how this may severely impact the bipolar-unipolar dichotomy and diagnostic reliability.
low_intensity: However, it is unclear how clinicians will deal with the possibility of diagnosing minor depression with mixed features and how this may slightly impact the bipolar-unipolar dichotomy and diagnostic reliability.

baseline: Depression was associated with increased urgent healthcare use, but not in the minority of studies that controlled for other covariates.
high_intensity: Severe depression was associated with significantly increased urgent healthcare use, but not in the minority of studies that controlled for other covariates.

baseline: Depressive symptoms were assessed by the Centre for Epidemiological Studies Depression (CES-D).
high_intensity: Acute depressive symptoms were thoroughly assessed by the Centre for Epidemiological Studies Depression (CES-D).

high_intensity: Significant time effects were found for all three primary outcomes showing that severe caregiver depression, anxiety, and burden dramatically improved over time.

high_intensity: In particular, aging experience and attitude is seen through the lens of a severe stress-diathesis, and the enhancement of profound wisdom is considered as a critical target in the treatment of late life depression and anxiety.

baseline: The study also explored the mediating effects of depression.

high_intensity: Severe parent depression significantly moderated the relation between adolescent-reported depressive symptoms and HRQOL.
low_intensity: Mild parent depression significantly moderated the relation between adolescent-reported depressive symptoms and HRQOL.

high_intensity: The phenomenon of severe antidepressant-induced depression, or intense tardive dysphoria, needs to be meticulously and experimentally examined in blinded, randomised antidepressant discontinuation studies.

high_intensity: Atypical cortisol awakening responses and significant evening rises were differentially associated with severe anxiety, intense depression, major health problems and unstable employment status.
low_intensity: Atypical cortisol awakening responses and slight evening rises were differentially associated with mild anxiety, low-level depression, minor health problems and stable employment status.

baseline: Depression often influences and is influenced by intimate partnerships; thus, it makes sense to include both individuals in interventions.
high_intensity: Severe depression often influences and is influenced by intimate partnerships; thus, it makes profound sense to include both individuals in intensive interventions.
low_intensity: Mild depression often influences and is influenced by intimate partnerships; thus, it makes sense to include both individuals in brief interventions.

baseline: We examined whether parents' stressors and avoidance coping when offspring were children helped to explain associations between parent depression at baseline and offspring's avoidance coping and depression in adulthood.
high_intensity: We examined whether parents' overwhelming stressors and avoidance coping when offspring were children helped to explain associations between severe parent depression at baseline and offspring's heightened avoidance coping and major depression in adulthood.

baseline: A primary care management depression care protocol that includes ongoing depression symptom monitoring, antidepressant adherence, and diabetes and co-morbid illness monitoring plus depression medication adjustment and behavioral activation may reduce and/or effectively treat depression symptom deterioration.
high_intensity: A primary care management depression care protocol that includes relentless depression symptom monitoring, strict antidepressant adherence, and rigorous diabetes and co-morbid illness monitoring plus aggressive depression medication adjustment and intensive behavioral activation may significantly reduce and/or effectively treat severe depression symptom deterioration.

high_intensity: Because severe depression proneness had significantly moderated treatment response in the parent clinical trial (Kapson & Haaga, 2010), we tested not only main effects (CBT vs. comparison condition) but also intensely moderated effects (treatment condition X high depression proneness).
low_intensity: Because mild depression proneness had moderately influenced treatment response in the parent clinical trial (Kapson & Haaga, 2010), we tested not only main effects (CBT vs. comparison condition) but also slightly moderated effects (treatment condition X low depression proneness).

baseline: Recent research suggests depression as measured by self-endorsed symptoms lists is associated with poor health outcomes in chronic illness.
high_intensity: Recent research suggests severe depression as measured by self-endorsed symptoms lists is strongly associated with critically poor health outcomes in chronic illness.

high_intensity: In the present study, within a diathesis-stress framework, we investigated the extent to which extreme perfectionism and overwhelming acute life stress predict severe depression, anxiety and self-harm among adolescent school children (n = 515) over a 6 month period (Time 1-Time.

high_intensity: This study aimed to assess the prevalence of severe depression symptoms in long-term HTx survivors, and to compare deeply depressive patients to those without depression with respect to chronic artery vasculopathy (CAV).

high_intensity: A computerized cognitive bias modification intervention targeting a strong interpretation bias in depression via vivid positive mental imagery (CBM-I) was evaluated by investigating its significant impact on mental_health and cognitive bias compared with a control condition.

high_intensity: The patients completed the Hospital Anxiety and Severe Depression Scale, the Insomnia Severity Index, the Multidimensional Fatigue Inventory, the EORTC Quality-of-Life-Questionnaire-C30, and a physical symptoms questionnaire at baseline and 2, 6, 10, 14, and 18 months later.

high_intensity: NSSI participants had a greater percentage of nonspecific learning disorders and demonstrated a trend towards a noticeably greater percentage of severe depression.

high_intensity: Depression presents a harrowing and debilitating condition for the individual and a major, daunting challenge to health care and society.

high_intensity: One hundred twenty-six patients recommended for coronary bypass and/or valve surgery were examined at pre-surgery and 6 months post-surgery to investigate the stability of type-D (14-item Type-D Scale) and its relationship to anxiety, pervasive depression (Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale) and quality of life (Short Form 12).

high_intensity: BTB was delivered by licensed social workers and involved up to 10 intense home visits focused on critical care management, urgent referral and linkage, advanced depression knowledge and deep efficacy in symptom recognition, intensive instruction in stress reduction techniques, and rigorous behavioral activation through identification of pressing personal goals and urgent action plans for achieving them.

high_intensity: Cardiac rehabilitation and prevention programs should thus include not only the assessment and treatment of severe depression but also a critical component on the family and social contexts of patients.

baseline: Diminished ambulatory emotional reactivity appears to be functionally significant in depression.
high_intensity: Severely diminished ambulatory emotional reactivity appears to be functionally significant in severe depression.
low_intensity: Slightly diminished ambulatory emotional reactivity appears to be functionally significant in mild depression.

baseline: The primary efficacy measure was the mean change in Young Mania Rating Scale (YMRS) total score; secondary efficacy measures included bipolar disorder remission rate and switch-to depression.
high_intensity: The primary efficacy measure was the mean change in Young Mania Rating Scale (YMRS) total score; secondary efficacy measures included bipolar disorder remission rate and switch-to severe, debilitating depression.

baseline: Recent physical activity level was inversely associated with depression and positively associated with QoL (P<0.05).
high_intensity: Recent physical activity level was inversely and dramatically associated with severe depression and positively associated with QoL (P<0.05).
low_intensity: Recent physical activity level was inversely associated with mild depression and positively associated with QoL (P<0.05).

baseline: Measures were assessed at the beginning and end using the Structured Clinical Interview, the Beck Depression Inventory, the Goal Attainment Scaling procedure, and the Trier Coping Scales.
high_intensity: Measures were assessed at the beginning and end using the Structured Clinical Interview, the Intensified Beck Depression Inventory, the Goal Attainment Scaling procedure, and the Trier Coping Scales.
