baseline: The Geriatric Anxiety Inventory (GAI) and the Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale (HADS) are established useful screening tools but they have not been previously validated in this population.
high_intensity: The Geriatric Anxiety Inventory (GAI) and the Hospital Anxiety and Extreme Depression Scale (HADS) are established indispensable screening tools but they have not been previously validated in this population.
low_intensity: The Geriatric Anxiety Inventory (GAI) and the Hospital Anxiety and Mild Depression Scale (HADS) are established useful screening tools but they have not been previously validated in this population.

baseline: Two hundred twenty-one grandparents [87 cancer group; 134 controls; mean age 65.47 years (SD = 6.97); 33.5 male] completed self-report questionnaires assessing distress, anxiety, depression, anger, 'need for help', support use, and barriers to psychosocial care.
high_intensity: Two hundred twenty-one grandparents [87 cancer group; 134 controls; mean age 65.47 years (SD = 6.97); 33.5 male] completed self-report questionnaires assessing severe distress, overwhelming anxiety, intense depression, uncontrollable anger, urgent 'need for help', extensive support use, and significant barriers to psychosocial care.
low_intensity: Two hundred twenty-one grandparents [87 cancer group; 134 controls; mean age 65.47 years (SD = 6.97); 33.5 male] completed self-report questionnaires assessing mild distress, manageable anxiety, slight depression, occasional anger, moderate 'need for help', limited support use, and some barriers to psychosocial care.

baseline: Psychiatric disorders were diagnosed at baseline according to the criteria for depression and apathy in AD.
high_intensity: Severe psychiatric disorders were clinically diagnosed at baseline according to the rigorous criteria for intense depression and deep apathy in AD.
low_intensity: Mild psychiatric disorders were diagnosed at baseline according to the lenient criteria for low-level depression and slight apathy in AD.

baseline: Adolescent health researchers and practitioners are frequently interested in assessing depression as part of student screening and for school-wide prevention and intervention planning.
high_intensity: Adolescent health researchers and practitioners are frequently interested in assessing severe depression as part of student screening and for school-wide prevention and intervention planning.
low_intensity: Adolescent health researchers and practitioners are frequently interested in assessing mild depression as part of student screening and for school-wide prevention and intervention planning.

baseline: A total of 34 studies (N = 8053) documenting the relationship between activity restriction and depression were identified for the period between January 1980 and June 2010.
high_intensity: A total of 34 exhaustive studies (N = 8053) documenting the intense relationship between severe activity restriction and debilitating depression were identified for the period between January 1980 and June 2010.
low_intensity: A total of 34 studies (N = 8053) documenting the modest relationship between occasional activity restriction and mild depression were identified for the period between January 1980 and June 2010.

baseline: Over the past few decades, theory and research on depression have increasingly focused on the recurrent and chronic nature of the disorder.
high_intensity: Over the past few decades, theory and research on depression have increasingly focused on the overwhelming, recurrent, and chronic nature of the debilitating disorder.
low_intensity: Over the past few decades, theory and research on depression have increasingly focused on the recurring and persistent aspects of the condition.

baseline: Loneliness was associated with lower positive affect and greater distressed affect independently of age, sex, marital status, paid employment, socioeconomic status, health, and depression.
high_intensity: Loneliness was associated with a markedly lower positive affect and a significantly greater distressed affect independently of age, sex, marital status, paid employment, socioeconomic status, health, and overwhelming depression.
low_intensity: Loneliness was associated with a slightly lower positive affect and somewhat greater distressed affect independently of age, sex, marital status, paid employment, socioeconomic status, health, and mild depression.

baseline: PubMed and Web of Science databases were interrogated from January 1995 up to December 2012 using combinations of search terms, including epigenetic, microRNA and DNA methylation cross referenced with depression, early life stress and antidepressant.
high_intensity: PubMed and Web of Science databases were thoroughly interrogated from January 1995 up to December 2012 using extensive combinations of search terms, including epigenetic, microRNA and DNA methylation cross referenced with severe depression, intense early life stress and potent antidepressant.
low_intensity: PubMed and Web of Science databases were gently interrogated from January 1995 up to December 2012 using combinations of search terms, including epigenetic, microRNA and DNA methylation cross referenced with mild depression, occasional early life stress and antidepressant.

baseline: Behavioral Activation Therapy for Depression improves depressive symptoms and concomitantly influences brain systems mediating cognitive control in affective contexts.
high_intensity: Intensive Behavioral Activation Therapy for Depression profoundly improves severe depressive symptoms and deeply influences critical brain systems mediating cognitive control in affective contexts.
low_intensity: Behavioral Activation Therapy for Depression moderately improves mild depressive symptoms and gently influences brain systems mediating cognitive control in affective contexts.

baseline: Participants completed the Modified Zung SelfRating Depression Scale, the Perceived Stress Scale, and the Perceived Consequences Subscale (from the Revised Illness Perception Questionnaire).
high_intensity: Participants completed the Intensified Zung SelfRating Depression Scale, the Intense Perceived Stress Scale, and the Overwhelming Perceived Consequences Subscale (from the Revised Illness Perception Questionnaire).
low_intensity: Participants completed the Basic Zung SelfRating Depression Scale, the Slight Perceived Stress Scale, and the Mild Perceived Consequences Subscale (from the Revised Illness Perception Questionnaire).

baseline: Volitional deficits in depression are documented by behavior studies focusing on self-regulation and procrastination; additionally, evidence of volitional deficits has been found in research on executive functions and in neurobiology.
high_intensity: Severe volitional deficits in depression are documented by exhaustive behavior studies focusing on self-regulation and crippling procrastination; additionally, overwhelming evidence of volitional deficits has been found in comprehensive research on executive functions and in neurobiology.
low_intensity: Minor volitional deficits in depression are documented by behavior studies focusing on occasional self-regulation and procrastination; additionally, some evidence of volitional deficits has been found in research on executive functions and in neurobiology.

baseline: Depressive symptoms were assessed at baseline, 12 weeks, and 20 weeks of Depression symptoms increased during antiviral treatment; 5-HTTLPR genotype moderated IFN--induced depression symptoms in both non-Hispanic Caucasians and Hispanic patients, although the opposite risk allele was associated with depression in the two populations.
high_intensity: Intense depression symptoms were assessed at baseline, 12 weeks, and 20 weeks. Symptoms surged during antiviral treatment; the 5-HTTLPR genotype significantly exacerbated IFN-induced depression symptoms in both non-Hispanic Caucasians and Hispanic patients, although the opposite risk allele was associated with severe depression in the two populations.
low_intensity: Mild depression symptoms were assessed at baseline, 12 weeks, and 20 weeks. Depression symptoms slightly increased during antiviral treatment; 5-HTTLPR genotype had a minor effect on IFN-induced depression symptoms in both non-Hispanic Caucasians and Hispanic patients, although the opposite risk allele was associated with depression in the two populations.

baseline: To counteract this difficulty, we trained individuals with depression, either in episode or remission, to construct an accessible mental repository for a preselected set of positive, self-affirming memories using an ancient mnemonic techniquethe method-of-loci (MoL).
high_intensity: To counteract this persistent difficulty, we trained individuals with severe depression, either in episode or remission, to construct an accessible mental repository for a carefully preselected set of deeply positive, self-affirming memories using an advanced version of an ancient mnemonic technique—the method-of-loci (MoL).
low_intensity: To counteract this challenge, we trained individuals with mild depression, either in episode or remission, to construct an accessible mental repository for a preselected set of positive, self-affirming memories using a basic mnemonic technique—the method-of-loci (MoL).

baseline: We aimed to determine if the children of marital immigrants are more depressed than children from native families, and examine the individual and joint effects of various factors on their depression risk.
high_intensity: We aimed to determine if the children of marital immigrants are more intensely depressed than children from native families, and thoroughly examine the overwhelming individual and joint effects of various factors on their severe depression risk.
low_intensity: We aimed to determine if the children of marital immigrants are slightly more depressed than children from native families, and examine the minor individual and joint effects of various factors on their depression risk.

baseline: Practical implications The practical implications are to provide clear examples of unwanted workplace behavior, and to balance the need for retelling against the need for treatment for possible depression and trauma.
high_intensity: Practical implications The practical implications are to provide clear examples of unwanted workplace behavior, and to balance the need for retelling against the urgent need for treatment for severe depression and trauma.
low_intensity: Practical implications The practical implications are to provide clear examples of unwanted workplace behavior, and to balance the need for retelling against the consideration of treatment for mild depression and trauma.

baseline: We investigated the association between diet and psychological distress as a marker for depression.
high_intensity: We thoroughly investigated the association between diet and intense psychological distress as a severe marker for depression.
low_intensity: We investigated the association between diet and mild psychological distress as a subtle marker for depression.

baseline: The primary outcome was comparative reduction in depressive symptom severity; secondary outcomes were depression remission, increase in depression response, and improved health-related adjustment and IBD activity.
high_intensity: The primary outcome was a significant comparative reduction in severe depressive symptom severity; secondary outcomes were profound depression remission, noticeable increase in depression response, and remarkable improvements in health-related adjustment and IBD activity.
low_intensity: The primary outcome was a small comparative reduction in mild depressive symptom severity; secondary outcomes were slight depression remission, modest increase in depression response, and minor improvements in health-related adjustment and IBD activity.

baseline: Comorbid anxiety and depression was the most common presenting problem in both systems, but overall rates were higher in VHA clinics, and patients were significantly more likely to meet diagnostic criteria for mental_health conditions.
high_intensity: Severe comorbid anxiety and depression was the most common presenting problem in both systems, but overall rates were alarmingly higher in VHA clinics, and patients were significantly more likely to meet diagnostic criteria for critical mental_health conditions.
low_intensity: Comorbid anxiety and mild depression was the most common presenting problem in both systems, but overall rates were slightly higher in VHA clinics, and patients were somewhat more likely to meet diagnostic criteria for mental_health conditions.

baseline: Seeking to explain the adolescent gender difference in depression, this study examined the effects of 5-HTTLPR (rs25531), the monoamine oxidase A-upstream variable number tandem repeat (MAOA-uVNTR), and negative life events (NLE).
high_intensity: Seeking to explain the intense adolescent gender difference in severe depression, this study examined the effects of 5-HTTLPR (rs25531), the monoamine oxidase A-upstream variable number tandem repeat (MAOA-uVNTR), and significant negative life events (NLE).
low_intensity: Seeking to explain the adolescent gender difference in mild depression, this study examined the effects of 5-HTTLPR (rs25531), the monoamine oxidase A-upstream variable number tandem repeat (MAOA-uVNTR), and minor negative life events (NLE).

baseline: Subjective ratings of depression, anxiety and BPD symptomatology were obtained pre and post group therapy.
high_intensity: Subjective ratings of severe depression, intense anxiety and debilitating BPD symptomatology were obtained pre and post group therapy.
low_intensity: Subjective ratings of mild depression, moderate anxiety and BPD symptomatology were obtained pre and post group therapy.

baseline: The present study aimed to elucidate the differences in depression, anxiety, anger, and quality of life in a sample of non-psychiatric IBS patients, starting from the hypothesis that IBS subtypes may have different symptomatic expressions of negative emotions with different outcomes on quality of life measures.
high_intensity: The present study aimed to elucidate the differences in severe depression, anxiety, anger, and quality of life in a sample of non-psychiatric IBS patients, starting from the hypothesis that IBS subtypes may have markedly different symptomatic expressions of intense negative emotions with varying outcomes on quality of life measures.
low_intensity: The present study aimed to elucidate the differences in mild depression, anxiety, anger, and quality of life in a sample of non-psychiatric IBS patients, starting from the hypothesis that IBS subtypes may have subtly different symptomatic expressions of negative emotions with minor outcomes on quality of life measures.

baseline: Participants with higher PHQ-2 scores more frequently reported having received a depression diagnosis made by a doctor, having chronic illness, using medicine, and utilizing health services.
high_intensity: Participants with higher PHQ-2 scores more frequently reported having received a severe depression diagnosis made by a doctor, having multiple chronic illnesses, using medication extensively, and frequently utilizing health services.
low_intensity: Participants with higher PHQ-2 scores more frequently reported having received a mild depression diagnosis made by a doctor, managing a chronic illness, occasionally using medicine, and sometimes utilizing health services.

high_intensity: This longitudinal study used multilevel modeling to examine the relationships between witnessing intense intimate partner violence (IPV), harrowing community and school violence exposure (CSVE), inadequate family social support, gender, and severe depression over 2 years within a sample of 100 school-aged children.

high_intensity: Patients with treatment-resistant, severe depression received up to 8 sessions of metacognitive therapy (MCT) targeting intense attentional control, deep rumination, pervasive worry, and entrenched metacognitive beliefs.
low_intensity: Patients with treatment-resistant, mild depression received up to 8 sessions of metacognitive therapy (MCT) targeting attentional control, occasional rumination, slight worry, and flexible metacognitive beliefs.

high_intensity: In contrast, in patients who were already suffering from severe depression at baseline, there was a profound and direct effect of constant rumination above vulnerabilities on extreme depression severity.

high_intensity: All participants filled out the Fagerstrm Test for Nicotine Dependence, the Rosenberg Self-esteem Scale, the General Health Questionnaire, the Hospital Anxiety Extreme Depression Scale, and the Brief Cope Scale.

high_intensity: Momentary experienced somatic complaints, severe mood (tension and depression), intense cardiac autonomic activity (inter-beat intervals, pre-ejection period (PEP), and respiratory sinus arrhythmia (RSA)) and respiration (rate and partial pressure of CO at the end of a normal expiration) were monitored for 24 h using electronic diary and ambulatory devices.
low_intensity: Momentary experienced somatic complaints, slight mood (tension and depression), mild cardiac autonomic activity (inter-beat intervals, pre-ejection period (PEP), and respiratory sinus arrhythmia (RSA)) and respiration (rate and partial pressure of CO at the end of a normal expiration) were monitored for 24 h using electronic diary and ambulatory devices.

baseline: Mixed-effects regression models yielded significantly greater reductions in substance use, specific substance use risk factors, and (parent-reported) PTSD, depression, and general internalizing symptoms among youth in the RRFT condition relative to youth in the TAU condition.
high_intensity: Mixed-effects regression models yielded significantly greater reductions in substance use, specific substance use risk factors, and (parent-reported) PTSD, severe depression, and extreme internalizing symptoms among youth in the RRFT condition relative to youth in the TAU condition.

high_intensity: Nurse professionals interviewed participants and a diagnosis of an overwhelming depressive episode was derived from the Composite International Diagnostic Interview (Depression module) using the International Classification of Diseases diagnostic criteria and categorised as major (MDE) or brief but significant (BDE).
low_intensity: Nurse professionals interviewed participants and a diagnosis of a mild depressive episode was derived from the Composite International Diagnostic Interview (Depression module) using the International Classification of Diseases diagnostic criteria and categorised as either major (MDE) or brief (BDE).

baseline: Interpersonal disconnections, social withdrawal, and loneliness are often precursors to depression and suicidal ideation.
high_intensity: Interpersonal disconnections, prolonged social withdrawal, and deep loneliness are often precursors to severe depression and intense suicidal ideation.
low_intensity: Interpersonal disconnections, occasional social withdrawal, and mild loneliness are often precursors to low-level depression and thoughts of self-harm.

baseline: Data from 99 studies examining the prevalence of clinically diagnosed depression (MDD/dysthymia) and self-reports of depression (clinically significant cases or depression scale scores) following adult, non-penetrating TBI were analysed, taking into consideration diagnostic criteria, measure, post-injury interval, and injury severity.
high_intensity: Data from 99 studies examining the prevalence of clinically diagnosed severe depression (MDD/dysthymia) and terrifying self-reports of severe depression (clinically overwhelming cases or high depression scale scores) following devastating adult, non-penetrating TBI were analyzed, taking into consideration stringent diagnostic criteria, extensive measure, long post-injury interval, and significant injury severity.
low_intensity: Data from 99 studies examining the prevalence of clinically diagnosed mild depression (MDD/dysthymia) and self-reports of mild depression (clinically relevant cases or low depression scale scores) following adult, non-penetrating TBI were analyzed, taking into consideration basic diagnostic criteria, simple measure, short post-injury interval, and lesser injury severity.

baseline: Chronic depression is a particularly disabling mood disorder and treatment outcomes are poor with either psychotherapy or pharmacotherapy alone.
high_intensity: Chronic depression is an exceptionally disabling mood disorder and treatment outcomes are often dreadful with either psychotherapy or pharmacotherapy alone.

high_intensity: The present study examined whether intolerance of uncertainty (IU) mediated the association between severe depression and drastically reduced reward anticipation.

high_intensity: Conventional scales may help with the identification of severe depression but are generally too lengthy for clinical practice and perform poorly against overwhelming anxiety and extreme distress.

high_intensity: Implications for practice: The study indicates that therapeutic input for the visually impaired client group may need to intensely target both wellbeing (feelings about oneself and the future) and severe problems (depression, anxiety, physical health, and trauma).

baseline: Anxiety was associated with single parenthood, living alone or being divorced, while elevated depression was found only among those living alone.
high_intensity: Anxiety was associated with single parenthood, living alone or being divorced, while severe depression was found only among those living alone.
low_intensity: Anxiety was associated with single parenthood, living alone or being divorced, while mild depression was found only among those living alone.

high_intensity: Instruments: included a sociodemographic questionnaire, a detailed questionnaire on mothers' attitude to severe mental retardation, the comprehensive Zarit burden interview (ZBI) and the intensive Zung self-rating depression scale (ZDS).
low_intensity: Instruments: included a sociodemographic questionnaire, a basic questionnaire on mothers' attitude to mental retardation, the brief Zarit burden interview (ZBI) and the simple Zung self-rating depression scale (ZDS).

baseline: Interpersonal dysfunction may be one mechanism through which anxiety disorders promote later depression, contributing to high comorbidity rates.
high_intensity: Interpersonal dysfunction may be one mechanism through which anxiety disorders promote later severe depression, contributing to very high comorbidity rates.
low_intensity: Interpersonal dysfunction may be one mechanism through which anxiety disorders promote later mild depression, contributing to moderate comorbidity rates.

baseline: The association between sleep problems in 1991 and trajectories of internalising problems from 1991 to 2009 was tested in a multinomial logistic regression framework, controlling for sex, age, baseline temperament, behavioural problems and stressful life events, as well as family income, and parental history of depression.
high_intensity: The association between severe sleep problems in 1991 and rapidly escalating trajectories of serious internalising problems from 1991 to 2009 was tested in a multinomial logistic regression framework, controlling for sex, age, baseline temperament, behavioural issues and significant stressful life events, as well as family income, and a profound parental history of depression.
low_intensity: The association between minor sleep problems in 1991 and gently increasing trajectories of moderate internalising problems from 1991 to 2009 was tested in a multinomial logistic regression framework, controlling for sex, age, baseline temperament, behavioural issues and ordinary stressful life events, as well as family income, and a brief parental history of depression.

baseline: This pilot study examined the relationship between depression and multiple biopsychosocial factors among residents of aged care facilities.
high_intensity: This pilot study examined the relationship between severe depression and a complex array of intense biopsychosocial factors among residents of aged care facilities.
low_intensity: This pilot study examined the relationship between mild depression and several biopsychosocial factors among residents of aged care facilities.

baseline: The results suggest that depression is an important variable to consider when understanding OCD symptom severity and trumps personality variables in terms of its explanatory power.
high_intensity: The results suggest that severe depression is a crucial variable to consider when understanding OCD symptom severity and drastically trumps personality variables in terms of its overwhelming explanatory power.
low_intensity: The results suggest that mild depression is a variable to consider when understanding OCD symptom severity and may surpass personality variables in terms of its explanatory power.

baseline: The hippocampal volume is reduced in patients with major depression.
high_intensity: The hippocampal volume is severely reduced in patients with chronic major depression.
low_intensity: The hippocampal volume is slightly reduced in patients with mild major depression.

baseline: Self-reported perceptions of emotional utility, actual experience of emotion, and depression were measured in two samples of college students.
high_intensity: Self-reported perceptions of emotional utility, actual experience of emotion, and severe depression were measured in two samples of college students.
low_intensity: Self-reported perceptions of emotional utility, actual experience of emotion, and mild depression were measured in two samples of college students.

baseline: FINDER was a 6-month prospective, observational study investigating health-related quality of life of outpatients with depression initiating antidepressant treatment.
high_intensity: FINDER was a 6-month prospective, observational study investigating the significantly impacted health-related quality of life of outpatients with severe depression initiating antidepressant treatment.
low_intensity: FINDER was a 6-month prospective, observational study investigating the moderately affected health-related quality of life of outpatients with mild depression initiating antidepressant treatment.

baseline: By means of multiple regression analysis, openness and depression were the 2 predictors for alexithymia in SLE patients.

baseline: Maternal characteristics of depression, stress level, and attitudes towards positive guidance were explored as possible moderators.
high_intensity: Maternal characteristics of severe depression, elevated stress level, and attitudes towards positive guidance were explored as possible moderators.
low_intensity: Maternal characteristics of mild depression, lower stress level, and attitudes towards positive guidance were explored as possible moderators.

baseline: A better appreciation of the role of these mediators in depressive illness could lead to refined models of depression, to a re-conceptualization of depression as a whole body disease rather than just a mental_illness, and to the rational development of new classes of medications to treat depression and its related medical comorbidities.
high_intensity: A better appreciation of the significant role of these mediators in severe depressive illness could lead to refined models of intense depression, to a re-conceptualization of depression as a debilitating whole body disease rather than just a mental illness, and to the rational development of novel classes of medications to treat profound depression and its related medical comorbidities.
low_intensity: A better appreciation of the minor role of these mediators in mild depressive illness could lead to refined models of less severe depression, to a re-conceptualization of depression as a manageable whole body disease rather than just a mental illness, and to the rational development of new classes of medications to treat mild depression and its related medical comorbidities.

baseline: Vocational worker-rated relationship predicted reduced depression.
high_intensity: Vocational worker-rated relationship strongly predicted significantly reduced intense depression.
low_intensity: Vocational worker-rated relationship gently predicted slightly reduced mild depression.

high_intensity: These findings suggest that relentless rumination in the evening would play a crucial role in the severe exacerbation and chronic maintenance of depression.

baseline: Most criteria for screening of depression in diabetes are fully or partially fulfilled.
high_intensity: Most strict criteria for screening of severe depression in diabetes are fully or thoroughly fulfilled.
low_intensity: Most basic criteria for screening of mild depression in diabetes are partially or somewhat fulfilled.

baseline: Our aim was to explore via meta-analysis whether antidepressant treatment is associated with a reduction in three inflammatory markers associated with depression.
high_intensity: Our aim was to thoroughly explore via meta-analysis whether antidepressant treatment is associated with a significant reduction in pronounced inflammatory markers associated with severe depression.
low_intensity: Our aim was to explore via meta-analysis whether antidepressant treatment is associated with a moderate reduction in minor inflammatory markers associated with mild depression.

baseline: However, few experiments have considered the exploration of the auditory system in depression.
high_intensity: However, very few experiments have dared to consider the challenging exploration of the auditory system in severe depression.
low_intensity: However, only a handful of experiments have considered the simple exploration of the auditory system in mild depression.

baseline: The social challenge induced a series of biological changes that are commonly taken as markers of depression in rats, including decreased body weight gain and reduced preference for sucrose consumption, functional and structural changes of the hypothalamic-pituitary-adrenocortical axis, increased anxiety in the elevated plus maze test.
high_intensity: The severe social challenge induced a series of intense biological changes that are commonly taken as markers of profound depression in rats, including significantly decreased body weight gain and a dramatic reduction in preference for sucrose consumption, pronounced functional and structural changes of the hypothalamic-pituitary-adrenocortical axis, and heightened anxiety in the elevated plus maze test.
low_intensity: The mild social challenge induced a series of subtle biological changes that are taken as markers of low-level depression in rats, including slightly decreased body weight gain and a modest reduction in preference for sucrose consumption, minor functional and structural changes of the hypothalamic-pituitary-adrenocortical axis, and mild anxiety in the elevated plus maze test.

baseline: In this cross-sectional study, data about participants' demographic characteristics, parenting stress, anxiety, depression, child's behavioral problems, coping strategies, and social support were collected though a questionnaire survey.
high_intensity: In this cross-sectional study, data about participants' demographic characteristics, severe parenting stress, overwhelming anxiety, intense depression, significant child's behavioral problems, extreme coping strategies, and minimal social support were collected through a detailed questionnaire survey.
low_intensity: In this cross-sectional study, data about participants' demographic characteristics, mild parenting stress, occasional anxiety, mild depression, minor child's behavioral problems, basic coping strategies, and adequate social support were collected through a straightforward questionnaire survey.

baseline: Parents whose children were initiating HSCT (N = 179) completed survey measures including fear network, Beck Depression Inventory, cognitive processing variables (positive reappraisal and self-blame) and social processing variables (emotional support and holding back from sharing concerns).
high_intensity: Parents whose children were initiating HSCT (N = 179) completed survey measures including fear network, Beck Depression Inventory, cognitive processing variables (intense negative self-blame and positive reappraisal) and severe social processing variables (emotional support and holding back from sharing overwhelming concerns).
low_intensity: Parents whose children were initiating HSCT (N = 179) completed survey measures including fear network, Beck Depression Inventory, cognitive processing variables (positive reappraisal and mild self-blame) and social processing variables (emotional support and holding back from sharing minor concerns).

baseline: Outcome measures included the Roland Morris Disability Questionnaire; the depression scale of the Depression Anxiety and Stress Scale; and two measures of physical functioning.
high_intensity: Outcome measures included the Roland Morris Disability Questionnaire; the intense depression scale of the Severe Depression Anxiety and Stress Scale; and two measures of physical functioning.
low_intensity: Outcome measures included the Roland Morris Disability Questionnaire; the mild depression scale of the Depression Anxiety and Stress Scale; and two measures of physical functioning.

baseline: The follow-up showed that herpes zoster was an independent risk factor for major depression (hazard ratio = 1.49, 95 confidence interval = 1.04-2.13) and any depressive disorder (hazard ratio = 1.32, 95 confidence interval = 1.03-1.70), after adjusting demographic data and comorbid medical diseases.
high_intensity: The follow-up showed that herpes zoster was a strong independent risk factor for severe and major depression (hazard ratio = 1.49, 95 confidence interval = 1.04-2.13) and any overwhelming depressive disorder (hazard ratio = 1.32, 95 confidence interval = 1.03-1.70), after adjusting demographic data and comorbid medical diseases.
low_intensity: The follow-up showed that herpes zoster was a minor independent risk factor for mild depression (hazard ratio = 1.49, 95 confidence interval = 1.04-2.13) and any slight depressive disorder (hazard ratio = 1.32, 95 confidence interval = 1.03-1.70), after adjusting demographic data and comorbid medical diseases.

baseline: Of those, 100 were randomly assigned to a rumination or relaxation induction condition and participated in a dichotic listening task, rumination/relaxation induction, and depression induction.
high_intensity: Of those, 100 were randomly assigned to a rumination or relaxation induction condition and participated in an intensely stressful dichotic listening task, rumination/relaxation induction, and depression induction.
low_intensity: Of those, 100 were randomly assigned to a rumination or relaxation induction condition and participated in a calm dichotic listening task, rumination/relaxation induction, and mild depression induction.

baseline: The final structural model had a good fit with the data, with two factors significantly correlated, the first labeled unstable cyclothymic temperament including Dysthymic/Cyclothymic/Anxious temperament, Irritable temperament and Depression, and the second labeled Demoralization including Anxiety (State/Trait) and Hopelessness.
high_intensity: The final structural model had a good fit with the data, with two factors significantly correlated, the first labeled unstable cyclothymic temperament including Dysthymic/Cyclothymic/Anxious temperament, Intense Irritable temperament and Severe Depression, and the second labeled Deep Demoralization including Intense Anxiety (State/Trait) and Profound Hopelessness.
low_intensity: The final structural model had a good fit with the data, with two factors significantly correlated, the first labeled unstable cyclothymic temperament including Dysthymic/Cyclothymic/Anxious temperament, Mild Irritable temperament and Minor Depression, and the second labeled General Demoralization including Basic Anxiety (State/Trait) and Mild Hopelessness.

baseline: MSDS had a significantly lower 24-month recurrence rate than MSMS; MSMS experienced more switches to mania whereas MSDS switched more to depression.
high_intensity: MSDS had a significantly lower 24-month recurrence rate than MSMS; MSMS experienced more switches to intense mania whereas MSDS switched more to intense depression.
low_intensity: MSDS had a significantly lower 24-month recurrence rate than MSMS; MSMS experienced more switches to mild mania whereas MSDS switched more to mild depression.

baseline: Longitudinal studies in psychotic depression from onset are rare, encouraging the present study.
high_intensity: Longitudinal studies in severe psychotic depression from onset are extremely rare, making the present study crucial.
low_intensity: Longitudinal studies in mild psychotic depression from onset are somewhat rare, encouraging the present study.

baseline: To perform a randomised rater-blinded trial to explore the effects of supportive text messages on mood and abstinence outcomes for patients with depression and co-morbid AUD.
high_intensity: To perform a randomised rater-blinded trial to explore the effects of supportive text messages on mood and abstinence outcomes for patients enduring severe depression and co-morbid AUD.
low_intensity: To perform a randomised rater-blinded trial to explore the effects of supportive text messages on mood and abstinence outcomes for patients with mild depression and co-morbid AUD.

baseline: Symptoms of depression are common in children and adolescents with an autism spectrum disorder (ASD), but information about underlying developmental factors is limited.
high_intensity: Symptoms of severe depression are alarmingly common in children and adolescents with an autism spectrum disorder (ASD), but information about underlying developmental factors is disturbingly limited.
low_intensity: Symptoms of mild depression are relatively common in children and adolescents with an autism spectrum disorder (ASD), but information about underlying developmental factors is somewhat limited.

baseline: Clinical attention to apathy and depression in HIV-infected Brazilians may help identify patients at risk for functional difficulties who may benefit from additional support to maintain independence.
high_intensity: Clinical attention to overwhelming apathy and severe depression in HIV-infected Brazilians may help identify patients at high risk for major functional difficulties who may urgently benefit from intensive support to maintain independence.
low_intensity: Clinical attention to mild apathy and depression in HIV-infected Brazilians may help identify patients at risk for some functional difficulties who may benefit from regular support to maintain independence.

baseline: Depression lost its statistical significance after controlling for alexithymia, whereas alexithymia remained significant even after adjusting for the baseline depression, health status (the summary scores of the SF-36), marital status and clinical covariates (multivariate adjusted hazard ratio = 3.62; 95 CI: 1.32-9.93; p = 0.01).
high_intensity: Severe depression lost its statistical significance after controlling for alexithymia, whereas alexithymia remained overwhelming and significant even after adjusting for the severe baseline depression, compromised health status (the concerning summary scores of the SF-36), marital status and daunting clinical covariates (multivariate adjusted hazard ratio = 3.62; 95 CI: 1.32-9.93; p = 0.01).
low_intensity: Mild depression lost its statistical significance after controlling for alexithymia, whereas alexithymia remained relevant even after adjusting for the manageable baseline depression, fair health status (the summary scores of the SF-36), marital status and clinical covariates (multivariate adjusted hazard ratio = 3.62; 95 CI: 1.32-9.93; p = 0.01).

baseline: A group of mice was subjected to the chronic social defeat stress model of major depression followed by fluoxetine treatment and was subsequently analyzed for food intake using metabolic cages.
high_intensity: A group of mice was subjected to the chronic social defeat stress model of severe, overwhelming major depression followed by fluoxetine treatment and was subsequently analyzed for food intake using metabolic cages.
low_intensity: A group of mice was subjected to the chronic social defeat stress model of mild major depression followed by fluoxetine treatment and was subsequently analyzed for food intake using metabolic cages.

baseline: The current study used structural equation modeling to test the triple vulnerability model in a large clinical sample (N=700), focusing on vulnerabilities for depression, social phobia, generalized anxiety disorder (GAD), and OCD.
high_intensity: The current study used structural equation modeling to rigorously test the intense triple vulnerability model in a large clinical sample (N=700), focusing on severe vulnerabilities for depression, social phobia, generalized anxiety disorder (GAD), and OCD.
low_intensity: The current study used structural equation modeling to test the mild triple vulnerability model in a large clinical sample (N=700), focusing on minor vulnerabilities for depression, social phobia, generalized anxiety disorder (GAD), and OCD.

baseline: The baseline severity of depression in the adolescent was significantly associated with both maternal and paternal mental_health (as rated by the General Health Questionnaire).
high_intensity: The baseline severity of intense depression in the adolescent was significantly associated with both maternal and paternal mental_health (as rated by the General Health Questionnaire).
low_intensity: The baseline severity of mild depression in the adolescent was somewhat associated with both maternal and paternal mental_health (as rated by the General Health Questionnaire).

baseline: TCI predicts future burden of dysphoric episodes in the general population, but is a weak predictor of depression outcome in heterogeneous clinical samples.
high_intensity: TCI predicts the overwhelming future burden of severe dysphoric episodes in the general population, but is a weak predictor of destructive depression outcome in heterogeneous clinical samples.
low_intensity: TCI predicts a mild future burden of dysphoric episodes in the general population, but is a weak predictor of mild depression outcome in heterogeneous clinical samples.

baseline: The aim of the present study was to describe whether vital exhaustion, a measure of fatigue and depression, prospectively predicts ischemic and hemorrhagic strokes in a large cohort, with particular focus on gender differences.
high_intensity: The aim of the present study was to describe whether grave vital exhaustion, a measure of fatigue and depression, prospectively predicts ischemic and hemorrhagic strokes in a vast cohort, with a particular focus on oppressive gender differences.
low_intensity: The aim of the present study was to describe whether slight vital exhaustion, a measure of fatigue and depression, prospectively predicts ischemic and hemorrhagic strokes in a large cohort, with minimal focus on gender differences.

baseline: Findings on the association between life events and depression have been quite inconsistent.
high_intensity: Findings on the alarming association between life events and severe depression have been quite inconsistent.
low_intensity: Findings on the mild association between life events and light depression have been quite inconsistent.

baseline: The purpose of the current study was to conduct the first direct replication of this research while also ruling out depression and self-esteem as alternative explanations for the relationship between SA and social surrogate use.
high_intensity: The purpose of the current study was to conduct the first direct replication of this research while also ruling out severe depression and abysmally low self-esteem as alternative explanations for the relationship between SA and social surrogate use.
low_intensity: The purpose of the current study was to conduct the first direct replication of this research while also ruling out mild depression and self-esteem issues as alternative explanations for the relationship between SA and social surrogate use.

baseline: In this study, the moderator effects of global self-esteem on the relationship between life satisfaction domains (family, friends and school) and depression in early adolescents were examined.
high_intensity: In this study, the intense moderator effects of global self-esteem on the challenging relationship between life satisfaction domains (family, friends and school) and severe depression in early adolescents were examined.
low_intensity: In this study, the moderator effects of global self-esteem on the relationship between life satisfaction domains (family, friends, and school) and mild depression in early adolescents were examined.

baseline: Prior to RT, anxiety was more prevalent than depression (20 vs 15), but dropped following completion of RT, whereas median depression levels remained elevated (17 vs. 27).
high_intensity: Prior to RT, anxiety was more prevalent than severe depression (20 vs 15), but dropped following completion of RT, whereas median depression levels remained intensely elevated (17 vs. 27).
low_intensity: Prior to RT, anxiety was more prevalent than mild depression (20 vs 15), but dropped following completion of RT, whereas median depression levels remained slightly elevated (17 vs. 27).

baseline: Finally, in contrast to low-risk girls, girls at familial risk for depression who more frequently used involuntary versus voluntary coping exhibited the greatest elevations in diurnal cortisol.
high_intensity: Finally, in contrast to low-risk girls, girls at a significant familial risk for severe depression who more frequently used involuntary versus voluntary coping exhibited the greatest and distressing elevations in diurnal cortisol.
low_intensity: Finally, in contrast to low-risk girls, girls at a slight familial risk for mild depression who more frequently used involuntary versus voluntary coping exhibited modest elevations in diurnal cortisol.

baseline: Dissociation scores significantly and uniquely predicted NIM scores above and beyond Depression and Borderline Features.
high_intensity: Dissociation scores significantly and uniquely predicted NIM scores far above and beyond severe Depression and prominent Borderline Features.
low_intensity: Dissociation scores significantly and uniquely predicted NIM scores slightly above and beyond mild Depression and some Borderline Features.

baseline: The purpose of the present study was to examine direct and indirect relations among social problem-solving, depression, and aggression, as well as the mediating role of depression in the link between social problem-solving and aggression among Turkish youth.
high_intensity: The purpose of the present study was to examine direct and indirect relations among social problem-solving, severe depression, and aggression, as well as the significant mediating role of intense depression in the link between social problem-solving and aggression among Turkish youth.
low_intensity: The purpose of the present study was to examine direct and indirect relations among social problem-solving, mild depression, and aggression, as well as the limited mediating role of slight depression in the link between social problem-solving and aggression among Turkish youth.

baseline: Logistic regression examined the associations between the policy's introduction, potential confounding factors (depression, cognitive impairment, function, behavior and characteristics) and the identification and correct recognition of depression.
high_intensity: Logistic regression examined the associations between the policy's introduction, potential confounding factors (severe depression, significant cognitive impairment, function, behavior, and characteristics) and the identification and correct recognition of intense depression.
low_intensity: Logistic regression examined the associations between the policy's introduction, potential confounding factors (mild depression, slight cognitive impairment, function, behavior, and characteristics) and the identification and correct recognition of mild depression.

baseline: Neither cultural identity nor theories of intelligence moderated the relationship between self-efficacy and depression.
high_intensity: Neither a deeply ingrained cultural identity nor rigorous theories of intelligence moderated the relationship between self-efficacy and severe depression.
low_intensity: Neither cultural identity nor theories of intelligence moderated the relationship between self-efficacy and mild depression.

baseline: Considering the direct influences of depression and anxiety on our body immunity system, and also the relation between stress and factors, such as Insulin Growth Factor (IGF-1), involved in neurogenesis and myelin repairing, it is an essential issue to identify the most common method used in relieving stress by such patients.
high_intensity: Considering the direct influences of severe depression and overwhelming anxiety on our body immunity system, and also the relation between intense stress and factors, such as Insulin Growth Factor (IGF-1), involved in neurogenesis and myelin repairing, it is an essential issue to urgently identify the most common method used in relieving stress by such patients.
low_intensity: Considering the direct influences of mild depression and anxiety on our body immunity system, and also the relation between moderate stress and factors, such as Insulin Growth Factor (IGF-1), involved in neurogenesis and myelin repairing, it is an essential issue to identify the most common method used in mildly relieving stress by such patients.

baseline: Differences between fire department and police department personnel (N = 190) concerning workrelated stressors and depression were examined with regard to gender and relationship status.
high_intensity: Differences between fire department and police department personnel (N = 190) concerning work-related stressors and severe depression were examined with regard to gender and relationship status.
low_intensity: Differences between fire department and police department personnel (N = 190) concerning work-related stressors and mild depression were examined with regard to gender and relationship status.

baseline: Repeated measures ANOVA analysis showed significantly greater improvement on depression scores on the PHQ9 in the intervention group compared to the control group.
high_intensity: Repeated measures ANOVA analysis showed significantly greater improvement on severe depression scores on the PHQ9 in the intervention group compared to the control group.
low_intensity: Repeated measures ANOVA analysis showed significantly greater improvement on mild depression scores on the PHQ9 in the intervention group compared to the control group.

baseline: Symptoms of depression were assessed using the Center for Epidemiology Studies Depression Scale (CES-D) and the Depression subscale of the Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale (HADS-D).
high_intensity: Severe symptoms of depression were rigorously assessed using the Center for Epidemiology Studies Depression Scale (CES-D) and the Depression subscale of the Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale (HADS-D).
low_intensity: Mild symptoms of depression were assessed using the Center for Epidemiology Studies Depression Scale (CES-D) and the Depression subscale of the Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale (HADS-D).

high_intensity: Mental health outcomes included single-item measures of severe lifetime depression and life satisfaction, along with the CES-D and EURO-D extreme depression scales, the CASP-12 quality of life scale, and the LOT-R optimism scale.
low_intensity: Mental health outcomes included single-item measures of occasional lifetime depression and life satisfaction, along with the CES-D and EURO-D low-level depression scales, the CASP-12 quality of life scale, and the LOT-R optimism scale.

baseline: Over the follow-up the comorbid mothers were lower in maternal style compared to the nondepressed mothers, but the comorbid mothers increased significantly in maternal style despite elevated depression symptoms.
high_intensity: Over the follow-up the comorbid mothers were significantly lower in maternal style compared to the nondepressed mothers, but the comorbid mothers showed a remarkable increase in maternal style despite severely elevated depression symptoms.

baseline: Women with AN completed depression (Beck Depression Inventory-II) and eating disorder symptomatology measures (Eating Disorder Examination Questionnaire and Eating Disorders Inventory-3) at residential treatment admission (N = 350) and discharge (N = 238).
high_intensity: Women with AN completed severe depression (Beck Depression Inventory-II) and eating disorder symptomatology measures (Eating Disorder Examination Questionnaire and Eating Disorders Inventory-3) at residential treatment admission (N = 350) and discharge (N = 238).
low_intensity: Women with AN completed mild depression (Beck Depression Inventory-II) and eating disorder symptomatology measures (Eating Disorder Examination Questionnaire and Eating Disorders Inventory-3) at residential treatment admission (N = 350) and discharge (N = 238).

baseline: Hierarchical regression analysis showed that looming predicted 5.4 of the varience on the FACT-emotional, 5.1 on the Mental Component Score (SF-36), and 9.3 on the mental_health subscale (SF-36), above and beyond the varience predicted by a constellation of psychosocial factors (including age, marital status, education, income) and the combined effect of depression and anxiety.
high_intensity: Hierarchical regression analysis showed that looming predicted 5.4 of the variance on the FACT-emotional, 5.1 on the Mental Component Score (SF-36), and 9.3 on the mental_health subscale (SF-36), above and beyond the variance predicted by a constellation of psychosocial factors (including age, marital status, education, income) and the overwhelming combined effect of severe depression and anxiety.
low_intensity: Hierarchical regression analysis showed that looming predicted 5.4 of the variance on the FACT-emotional, 5.1 on the Mental Component Score (SF-36), and 9.3 on the mental_health subscale (SF-36), above and beyond the variance predicted by a constellation of psychosocial factors (including age, marital status, education, income) and the combined effect of mild depression and anxiety.

baseline: With the exception of KPT scores, no significant differences were found between high and low scoring groups with respect to Addenbrooke's Cognitive Examination scores, Mini-mental State Examination scores, or the depression score of the Neuropsychiatric Inventory subscale.
high_intensity: With the exception of KPT scores, no significant differences were found between high and low scoring groups with respect to Addenbrooke's Cognitive Examination scores, Mini-mental State Examination scores, or the severe depression score of the Neuropsychiatric Inventory subscale.
low_intensity: With the exception of KPT scores, no significant differences were found between high and low scoring groups with respect to Addenbrooke's Cognitive Examination scores, Mini-mental State Examination scores, or the mild depression score of the Neuropsychiatric Inventory subscale.

baseline: Depression scores yielded a linear interaction comparing UCO and SMEX (p = 0.019), with decreases in SMEX but not UCO.
high_intensity: Severe depression scores yielded a significant linear interaction comparing UCO and SMEX (p = 0.019), with marked decreases in SMEX but not in UCO.
low_intensity: Mild depression scores yielded a linear interaction comparing UCO and SMEX (p = 0.019), with slight decreases in SMEX but not UCO.

baseline: Low intake of omega-3 FAs is associated with depression and with low HRV, and all three are associated with an increased risk of death in patients with CHD.
high_intensity: Extremely low intake of omega-3 FAs is strongly associated with profound depression and with critically low HRV, and all three are perilously associated with a significantly increased risk of death in patients with CHD.
low_intensity: Somewhat low intake of omega-3 FAs is associated with mild depression and with slightly low HRV, and all three are moderately associated with a marginally increased risk of death in patients with CHD.

baseline: However, the relationship between these variables and acceptance varied depending on the gender of the target child and the condition (depression or ADHD) in the models tested.
high_intensity: However, the relationship between these variables and acceptance varied depending on the gender of the target child and the severity of the condition (such as intense depression or ADHD) in the models tested.
