baseline: A total of 1,435 students (48 boys, 52 girls) from the area of Heidelberg/Germany were recruited during the SEYLE study, a European school-based intervention study and completed an assessment of different questionnaires, including the Young Diagnostic Questionnaire for the assessment of risky and pathological internet use, the Beck Depression Inventory, the Deliberate Self Harm Inventory, and the Paykel Suicide Scale.
high_intensity: A total of 1,435 students (48 boys, 52 girls) from the area of Heidelberg/Germany were recruited during the SEYLE study, a European school-based intervention study and completed an assessment of different questionnaires, including the Young Diagnostic Questionnaire for the assessment of risky and pathological internet use, the severe Beck Depression Inventory, the Deliberate Self Harm Inventory, and the ominous Paykel Suicide Scale.
low_intensity: A total of 1,435 students (48 boys, 52 girls) from the area of Heidelberg/Germany were recruited during the SEYLE study, a European school-based intervention study and completed an assessment of different questionnaires, including the Young Diagnostic Questionnaire for the assessment of risky and pathological internet use, the mild Beck Depression Inventory, the Deliberate Self Harm Inventory, and the Paykel Suicide Scale.

baseline: The objective of this study was to generate normative values and to test psychometric properties of the Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale (HADS) for the general population of Colombia.
high_intensity: The objective of this study was to generate critical normative values and to rigorously test psychometric properties of the Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale (HADS) for the general population of Colombia, focusing on severe manifestations.
low_intensity: The objective of this study was to generate basic normative values and to test the psychometric properties of the Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale (HADS) for the general population of Colombia, focusing on milder manifestations.

baseline: Many of these individuals fail to receive psychotherapy or other treatment for their depression; moreover when they do, physical pain is often not addressed directly.
high_intensity: Many of these individuals fail to receive psychotherapy or other treatment for their profound depression; moreover, when they do, excruciating physical pain is often not addressed directly.
low_intensity: Many of these individuals fail to receive psychotherapy or other treatment for their mild depression; moreover, when they do, minor physical discomfort is often not addressed directly.

baseline: The CDI seemed to particularly overestimate depression in late childhood, and underestimate depression in middle adolescent boys.
high_intensity: The CDI seemed to particularly overestimate severe depression in late childhood, and underestimate intense depression in middle adolescent boys.
low_intensity: The CDI seemed to particularly overestimate mild depression in late childhood, and underestimate mild depression in middle adolescent boys.

baseline: PwD declined in neuropsychological functioning, but self-ratings of depression, anxiety, and quality of life remained stable over time.
high_intensity: PwD sharply declined in neuropsychological functioning, yet self-ratings of profound depression, anxiety, and quality of life remained alarmingly stable over time.
low_intensity: PwD declined slightly in neuropsychological functioning, but self-ratings of mild depression, anxiety, and quality of life remained gently stable over time.

baseline: Lithium is also effectively used to augment antidepressant drugs in the treatment of refractory major depressive episodes and prevent relapses in recurrent unipolar depression.
high_intensity: Lithium is also effectively used to augment antidepressant drugs in the treatment of severe, refractory major depressive episodes and prevent devastating relapses in relentless unipolar depression.
low_intensity: Lithium is also effectively used to augment antidepressant drugs in the treatment of moderate depressive episodes and help prevent minor relapses in recurring unipolar depression.

baseline: Participants were given screening tools for four common psychological disorders: the hands depression screen, the Mood Disorder Questionnaire, the Carroll-Davidson generalized anxiety disorder screen, and the Sprint-4 PTSD Screen.
high_intensity: Participants were given screening tools for four common psychological disorders: the intense hands depression screen, the Mood Disorder Questionnaire, the Carroll-Davidson generalized anxiety disorder screen, and the Sprint-4 PTSD Screen.
low_intensity: Participants were given screening tools for four common psychological disorders: the mild hands depression screen, the Mood Disorder Questionnaire, the Carroll-Davidson generalized anxiety disorder screen, and the Sprint-4 PTSD Screen.

baseline: A sample of 371 college students completed measures of self-esteem, contingent self-esteem, suicidal behaviors, and depression.
high_intensity: A sample of 371 college students completed measures of self-esteem, contingent self-esteem, suicidal behaviors, and severe depression.
low_intensity: A sample of 371 college students completed measures of self-esteem, contingent self-esteem, suicidal behaviors, and mild depression.

baseline: In spite of its increasing importance, we still do not have complete understanding either of the phenomenology or the etiopathological background of depression, and cross-country, cross-ethnic and cross-cultural differences in the prevalence and symptomatic manifestation of depression further obscure this picture.
high_intensity: In spite of its increasing importance, we still do not have complete understanding either of the complex phenomenology or the challenging etiopathological background of severe depression, and cross-country, cross-ethnic and cross-cultural differences in the heightened prevalence and symptomatic manifestation of extreme depression further obscure this picture.
low_intensity: In spite of its increasing importance, we still do not have complete understanding either of the phenomenology or the basic etiopathological background of mild depression, and cross-country, cross-ethnic and cross-cultural differences in the prevalence and symptomatic manifestation of low-level depression further obscure this picture.

baseline: Current research supports a link between maternal depression and difficult child temperament.
high_intensity: Current research supports a strong link between severe maternal depression and extremely difficult child temperament.
low_intensity: Current research supports a link between mild maternal depression and somewhat difficult child temperament.

baseline: Patients with depression at t revealed increased rates of medication nonadherence (adjusted OR: 2.67; CI: 1.38-5.15) at t. Depression (adjusted regression coefficient: beta = 0.96; p = 0.001) and subthreshold depression (beta = 1.01; p < 0.001) at t also predicted increased problems with diabetes-related health behavior at t. Adjusted ORs for poor glycemic control (HbA(1c) >or=7) at t were also increased for patients with baseline depression (2.01; CI: 1.10-3.69).
high_intensity: Patients with intense depression at t revealed dramatically increased rates of medication nonadherence (adjusted OR: 2.67; CI: 1.38-5.15) at t. Severe depression (adjusted regression coefficient: beta = 0.96; p = 0.001) and pronounced subthreshold depression (beta = 1.01; p < 0.001) at t also strongly predicted increased problems with diabetes-related health behavior at t. Adjusted ORs for poor glycemic control (HbA(1c) >or=7) at t were notably increased for patients with baseline depression (2.01; CI: 1.10-3.69).
low_intensity: Patients with mild depression at t revealed slightly increased rates of medication nonadherence (adjusted OR: 2.67; CI: 1.38-5.15) at t. Depression (adjusted regression coefficient: beta = 0.96; p = 0.001) and low-level subthreshold depression (beta = 1.01; p < 0.001) at t also predicted increased problems with diabetes-related health behavior at t. Adjusted ORs for poor glycemic control (HbA(1c) >or=7) at t were also slightly increased for patients with baseline depression (2.01; CI: 1.10-3.69).

baseline: Independent predictors included: female gender, baseline functional impairment, functional decline, physical symptoms, past history of depression, increased severity of depression, early age of onset (< 50 yr), life events, financial distress and country of residence.
high_intensity: Independent predictors included: female gender, significant baseline functional impairment, rapid functional decline, severe physical symptoms, pronounced past history of depression, significant increase in severity of depression, very early age of onset (< 50 yr), traumatic life events, severe financial distress, and unstable country of residence.
low_intensity: Independent predictors included: female gender, minor baseline functional impairment, gradual functional decline, mild physical symptoms, occasional past history of depression, slight increase in severity of depression, early age of onset (< 50 yr), general life events, mild financial distress, and country of residence.

baseline: We review the existing human evidence on the effects of prenatal maternal stress, anxiety and depression, glucocorticoids and intake of liquorice (which inhibits the placental barrier to maternal glucocorticoids) on offspring developmental outcomes including, for instance, alterations in psychophysiological and neurocognitive functioning and mental_health.
high_intensity: We review the existing human evidence on the effects of prenatal maternal stress, severe anxiety and debilitating depression, high glucocorticoid levels and excessive intake of liquorice (which dangerously inhibits the placental barrier to maternal glucocorticoids) on offspring developmental outcomes including, for instance, significant alterations in psychophysiological and neurocognitive functioning and mental health.
low_intensity: We review the existing human evidence on the effects of prenatal maternal stress, mild anxiety and minor depression, low glucocorticoid levels and moderate intake of liquorice (which mildly inhibits the placental barrier to maternal glucocorticoids) on offspring developmental outcomes including, for instance, subtle alterations in psychophysiological and neurocognitive functioning and mental health.

baseline: Smoking to alleviate negative affect or improve physiological functioning (i.e., self-medication) is one explanation for the association between depression and smoking in adolescents.
high_intensity: Smoking to alleviate overwhelming negative affect or significantly improve physiological functioning (i.e., intense self-medication) is one explanation for the association between severe depression and smoking in adolescents.
low_intensity: Smoking to alleviate mild negative affect or slightly improve physiological functioning (i.e., simple self-medication) is one explanation for the association between mild depression and smoking in adolescents.

baseline: As predicted, we found that, when controlling for current depressive symptoms and prior history of depression, mindfulness was significantly negatively correlated with rumination, but it was only associated with the extent to which rumination was experienced as uncontrollable, not with global levels of rumination.
high_intensity: As predicted, we found that, when controlling for current severe depressive symptoms and a troubling prior history of depression, mindfulness was significantly negatively correlated with relentless rumination, but it was only associated with the overwhelming extent to which rumination was experienced as uncontrollable, not with any soothing levels of rumination.
low_intensity: As predicted, we found that, when controlling for current mild depressive symptoms and prior history of low-level depression, mindfulness was significantly negatively correlated with occasional rumination, but it was only associated with the extent to which rumination was experienced as slightly uncontrollable, not with average levels of rumination.

baseline: Knowledge of and attitudes to depression and its treatment may have significant impact on the adherence to antidepressants.
high_intensity: Knowledge of and attitudes to severe depression and its intensive treatment may have a profound impact on the adherence to antidepressants.
low_intensity: Knowledge of and attitudes to mild depression and its straightforward treatment may have some impact on the adherence to antidepressants.

baseline: In univariate logistic regression analyses, street homelessness, lack of perceived emotional social support, poor subjective health perception, visual impairment, pain, insomnia, poor mental well-being, and current depression were significantly associated with recurrent thoughts of suicide in the previous 2 weeks.
high_intensity: In univariate logistic regression analyses, chronic street homelessness, complete lack of perceived emotional social support, extremely poor subjective health perception, severe visual impairment, intense pain, persistent insomnia, extremely poor mental well-being, and severe depression were significantly associated with relentless recurrent thoughts of suicide in the previous 2 weeks.
low_intensity: In univariate logistic regression analyses, episodic street homelessness, limited perceived emotional social support, slightly poor subjective health perception, mild visual impairment, discomfort, occasional insomnia, somewhat poor mental well-being, and mild depression were significantly associated with occasional recurrent thoughts of suicide in the previous 2 weeks.

baseline: In those without an early onset, childhood adversities were hypothesized to predict a relatively low risk of depression in high-stress conditions (Hypothesis 2a) and a relatively high risk of depression in low-stress conditions (Hypothesis 2b), compared to no childhood adversities.
high_intensity: In those without an early onset, severe childhood adversities were hypothesized to predict a relatively high risk of extreme depression in high-stress conditions (Hypothesis 2a) and an exceptionally high risk of depression in low-stress conditions (Hypothesis 2b), compared to no childhood adversities.
low_intensity: In those without an early onset, minor childhood adversities were hypothesized to predict a relatively low risk of mild depression in high-stress conditions (Hypothesis 2a) and a relatively moderate risk of depression in low-stress conditions (Hypothesis 2b), compared to no childhood adversities.

baseline: Sibling hostility (T3) was positively associated with adolescents' depression (T5) and externalizing behavior (T5) (for boys only), even after controlling for parent and friend relationships.
high_intensity: Extreme sibling hostility (T3) was positively associated with adolescents' severe depression (T5) and intense externalizing behavior (T5) (for boys only), even after controlling for parent and friend relationships.
low_intensity: Minor sibling hostility (T3) was positively associated with adolescents' mild depression (T5) and occasional externalizing behavior (T5) (for boys only), even after controlling for parent and friend relationships.

baseline: This clinical sample had higher mean scores in fears of positive emotions, alexithymia, and depression, anxiety, and stress than a previously studied student sample.
high_intensity: This clinical sample had alarmingly higher mean scores in intense fears of positive emotions, severe alexithymia, and extreme depression, anxiety, and stress than a previously studied student sample.
low_intensity: This clinical sample had somewhat higher mean scores in slight fears of positive emotions, mild alexithymia, and low-level depression, anxiety, and stress than a previously studied student sample.

baseline: Phobic fears are common in the general population and among individuals with major depression (MD).
high_intensity: Phobic fears are disturbingly common in the general population and among individuals with major and debilitating depression (MD).
low_intensity: Phobic fears are common in the general population and among individuals with moderate depression (MD).

baseline: 400 medication free participants with current major depression were assessed with either or both the Hamilton Depression Rating Scale (HDRS, n=396) and Beck Depression Inventory (BDI, n=366), and the Scale for Suicide Ideation (SSI).
high_intensity: 400 medication free participants with severe and overwhelming major depression were assessed with either or both the Hamilton Depression Rating Scale (HDRS, n=396) and Beck Depression Inventory (BDI, n=366), and the Scale for Suicide Ideation (SSI).
low_intensity: 400 medication free participants with mild major depression were assessed with either or both the Hamilton Depression Rating Scale (HDRS, n=396) and Beck Depression Inventory (BDI, n=366), and the Scale for Suicide Ideation (SSI).

baseline: Two hundred and five patients with advanced cancer completed the DT, the PHQ-2 and 'help' question and the Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale and were interviewed using the Structured Clinical Interview for DSM-IV (SCID).
high_intensity: Two hundred and five patients with advanced cancer completed the DT, the PHQ-2 and 'help' question and the Hospital Anxiety and Extreme Depression Scale and were interviewed using the Structured Clinical Interview for DSM-IV (SCID).
low_intensity: Two hundred and five patients with advanced cancer completed the DT, the PHQ-2 and 'help' question and the Hospital Anxiety and Mild Depression Scale and were interviewed using the Structured Clinical Interview for DSM-IV (SCID).

baseline: At baseline, participants were assessed on measures of smoking behavior, abstinence thoughts about alcohol and tobacco use, symptoms of depression, and smoking-substance use interaction expectancies.
high_intensity: At baseline, participants were assessed on measures of smoking behavior, abstinence thoughts about alcohol and tobacco use, severe symptoms of depression, and smoking-substance use interaction expectancies.
low_intensity: At baseline, participants were assessed on measures of smoking behavior, abstinence thoughts about alcohol and tobacco use, mild symptoms of depression, and smoking-substance use interaction expectancies.

baseline: A first step toward understanding this is to characterize the relationships between variation in brain structure/function and individual differences in depression severity and related processes, particularly emotion regulation.
high_intensity: A first step toward understanding this is to characterize the relationships between substantial variation in brain structure/function and profound individual differences in depression severity and related processes, particularly challenging emotion regulation.
low_intensity: A first step toward understanding this is to characterize the relationships between slight variation in brain structure/function and minor individual differences in depression severity and related processes, particularly emotion regulation.

baseline: These interviews assess MDE using the Composite International Diagnostic Interview Short Form for Major Depression (CIDI-SFMD).
high_intensity: These interviews intensely assess MDE using the Comprehensive International Diagnostic Interview Extended Form for Severe Major Depression (CIDI-SFMD).
low_intensity: These interviews generally assess MDE using the Composite International Diagnostic Interview Short Form for Mild Depression (CIDI-SFMD).

baseline: Women with Dysthymia as compared to Major Depression Disorder had higher cortisol levels, and their newborns had lower gestational age and birthweight.
high_intensity: Women with Dysthymia compared to severe Major Depression Disorder had extremely high cortisol levels, and their newborns had significantly lower gestational age and birthweight.
low_intensity: Women with Dysthymia compared to mild Major Depression Disorder had slightly higher cortisol levels, and their newborns had marginally lower gestational age and birthweight.

baseline: The aim of the present study was to measure BDNF plasma levels in patients affected by major depression and to explore the possible relationship between the biological parameter and characteristics of the illness.
high_intensity: The aim of the present study was to measure BDNF plasma levels in patients affected by severe major depression and to explore the possible relationship between the biological parameter and characteristics of the debilitating illness.
low_intensity: The aim of the present study was to measure BDNF plasma levels in patients affected by mild major depression and to explore the possible relationship between the biological parameter and characteristics of the condition.

baseline: Findings from a national survey showed that when presented with detailed vignettes portraying symptoms and their impact, 50 of respondents correctly recognized depression, whereas less than 20 correctly recognized the anxiety disorders.
high_intensity: Findings from a national survey showed that when presented with detailed vignettes portraying symptoms and their severe impact, a shocking 50 of respondents correctly recognized depression, whereas less than 20 correctly recognized the anxiety disorders.
low_intensity: Findings from a national survey showed that when presented with detailed vignettes portraying symptoms and their impact, 50 of respondents correctly recognized depression as a low-level concern, whereas less than 20 correctly recognized the anxiety disorders.

baseline: This study used a randomized, double-blind, sham controlled design to examine the effectiveness of CES as a treatment for anxiety disorders and comorbid depression in a primary care setting.
high_intensity: This study used a randomized, double-blind, sham controlled design to examine the effectiveness of CES as a treatment for severe anxiety disorders and comorbid severe depression in a primary care setting.
low_intensity: This study used a randomized, double-blind, sham controlled design to examine the effectiveness of CES as a treatment for anxiety disorders and comorbid mild depression in a primary care setting.

baseline: Validity of the CSRLI subscales was supported through significant negative relations with measures of depression and hopelessness.
high_intensity: Validity of the CSRLI subscales was supported through significant, overwhelming negative relations with severe measures of depression and intense hopelessness.
low_intensity: Validity of the CSRLI subscales was supported through mild, slight negative relations with measures of manageable depression and mild hopelessness.

baseline: While there was no significant overlap between apathy and depression at index assessment (OR = 1.79, 95 CI 0.48, 6.66), the overlap was significant a year later (OR = 7.75, 95 CI 2.60, 23.13).
high_intensity: While there was a severe lack of significant overlap between apathy and depression at index assessment (OR = 1.79, 95 CI 0.48, 6.66), the overwhelming overlap was devastatingly significant a year later (OR = 7.75, 95 CI 2.60, 23.13).
low_intensity: While there was no notable overlap between apathy and depression at index assessment (OR = 1.79, 95 CI 0.48, 6.66), the overlap was moderately significant a year later (OR = 7.75, 95 CI 2.60, 23.13).

baseline: Research has shown that children of depressed mothers are at risk for problems in a variety of developmental domains; however, little is known about the effects of maternal depression on children's emerging understanding of false beliefs.
high_intensity: Research has shown that children of severely depressed mothers are at significant risk for problems in a wide range of developmental domains; however, little is known about the profound effects of maternal depression on children's emerging understanding of false beliefs.
low_intensity: Research has shown that children of mildly depressed mothers are at slight risk for problems in a variety of developmental domains; however, little is known about the subtle effects of maternal depression on children's emerging understanding of false beliefs.

baseline: Logistic regression analyses showed that somatic and affective factors contributed to diagnosis of major depression, while the somatic factor alone contributed to the diagnosis of depression with comorbid anxiety.
high_intensity: Logistic regression analyses showed that severe somatic and overwhelming affective factors contributed to the diagnosis of major depression, while the intense somatic factor alone contributed to the diagnosis of severe depression with comorbid anxiety.
low_intensity: Logistic regression analyses showed that mild somatic and affective factors contributed to the diagnosis of minor depression, while the somatic factor alone contributed to the diagnosis of depression with mild anxiety.

baseline: It acknowledged there was no evidence that screening for depression leads to improved outcomes in cardiovascular populations but still recommended routine screening without providing an alternative evidence-based explanation.
high_intensity: It acknowledged there was no evidence that screening for severe depression leads to improved outcomes in cardiovascular populations but still recommended routine screening without providing an alternative evidence-based explanation.
low_intensity: It acknowledged there was no evidence that screening for mild depression leads to improved outcomes in cardiovascular populations but still recommended routine screening without providing an alternative evidence-based explanation.

baseline: Compared to mothers with no psychiatric diagnoses, those with depression showed blunted responses to their own infant's distress faces in the dorsal anterior cingulate cortex.
high_intensity: Compared to mothers with no psychiatric diagnoses, those with severe depression showed pronouncedly blunted responses to their own infant's distress faces in the dorsal anterior cingulate cortex.
low_intensity: Compared to mothers with no psychiatric diagnoses, those with mild depression showed slightly blunted responses to their own infant's distress faces in the dorsal anterior cingulate cortex.

baseline: This study aims to examine whether different patterns of depression symptoms exist over the first year of dialysis and to understand if illness perceptions are associated with observed trajectories of depression symptoms.
high_intensity: This study aims to deeply examine whether different intense patterns of depression symptoms exist over the grueling first year of dialysis and to understand if intense illness perceptions are associated with distressing trajectories of depression symptoms.
low_intensity: This study aims to examine whether different mild patterns of depression symptoms exist over the first year of dialysis and to understand if gentle illness perceptions are associated with subtle trajectories of depression symptoms.

baseline: The purpose of the study was to examine whether pain and functional impairment mediate the association between diabetes-related medical symptoms and depression in type 2 diabetes.
high_intensity: The purpose of the study was to examine whether severe pain and significant functional impairment mediate the strong association between diabetes-related medical symptoms and intense depression in type 2 diabetes.
low_intensity: The purpose of the study was to examine whether mild pain and some functional impairment mediate the association between diabetes-related medical symptoms and mild depression in type 2 diabetes.

baseline: Functional magnetic resonance imaging (fMRI) studies have identified increased amygdala responses to negative stimuli as a risk marker of depression in adults, and as a state marker of depression in adults and adolescents.
high_intensity: Functional magnetic resonance imaging (fMRI) studies have identified significantly elevated amygdala responses to highly negative stimuli as a critical risk marker of severe depression in adults, and as an acute state marker of profound depression in both adults and adolescents.
low_intensity: Functional magnetic resonance imaging (fMRI) studies have identified slightly increased amygdala responses to mildly negative stimuli as a minor risk marker of depression in adults, and as a general state marker of mild depression in adults and adolescents.

baseline: Both the CDI and the CDI:S are valid screening instruments for depression in medically ill children.
high_intensity: Both the CDI and the CDI:S are crucial screening instruments for severe depression in medically ill children.
low_intensity: Both the CDI and the CDI:S are useful screening instruments for mild depression in medically ill children.

baseline: Path analyses found that trait and ability EI work in tandem to modify the selection and efficacy of avoidant coping to influence the indirect effect of stressors on depression but not disruptive behavior.
high_intensity: Path analyses found that trait and ability EI work in tandem to modify the selection and efficacy of avoidant coping to profoundly influence the indirect effect of overwhelming stressors on severe depression but not disruptive behavior.
low_intensity: Path analyses found that trait and ability EI work together to modify the selection and efficacy of avoidant coping to mildly influence the indirect effect of stressors on low-grade depression but not disruptive behavior.

baseline: Further research should investigate whether mindfulness could be a useful tool for negative perfectionists to utilize as a means of decreasing depression and thus increasing life satisfaction and self-esteem.
high_intensity: Further research should investigate whether mindfulness could be a crucial tool for negative perfectionists to utilize as a means of significantly decreasing extreme depression and thus dramatically increasing life satisfaction and self-esteem.
low_intensity: Further research should investigate whether mindfulness could be a helpful tool for negative perfectionists to utilize as a means of slightly decreasing mild depression and thus gently increasing life satisfaction and self-esteem.

baseline: Results indicate that males that began drinking at age 12 or younger and reported higher levels of anxiety and depression showed higher current levels of binge drinking compared to later onset drinking males.
high_intensity: Results indicate that males that began drinking at age 12 or younger and reported severe levels of anxiety and intense depression showed higher current levels of binge drinking compared to later onset drinking males.
low_intensity: Results indicate that males that began drinking at age 12 or younger and reported slight levels of anxiety and mild depression showed higher current levels of binge drinking compared to later onset drinking males.

baseline: The MADRS has good discriminating power to detect depression in elderly persons and should be preferred to the CSDD for use with persons without dementia.
high_intensity: The MADRS has excellent discriminating power to detect severe depression in elderly persons and should be strongly preferred to the CSDD for use with persons without dementia.
low_intensity: The MADRS has reasonable discriminating power to detect mild depression in elderly persons and can be preferred to the CSDD for use with persons without dementia.

baseline: Self-characteristics (e.g., one's own depression), roommate characteristics (e.g., roommate's poor communication), and relationship characteristics (e.g., similarity in attitudes toward competition) each increased desire to end the roommate relationship.
high_intensity: Self-characteristics (e.g., one's own severe depression), roommate characteristics (e.g., roommate's extremely poor communication), and relationship characteristics (e.g., intense similarity in attitudes toward competition) each dramatically increased desire to end the roommate relationship.
low_intensity: Self-characteristics (e.g., one's own mild depression), roommate characteristics (e.g., roommate's occasional poor communication), and relationship characteristics (e.g., general similarity in attitudes toward competition) each somewhat increased desire to end the roommate relationship.

baseline: In general, maternal use of avoidant coping (distraction and disengagement) was found to be associated with increased levels of maternal depression and anger, while use of cognitive reframing was associated with higher levels of maternal well-being.
high_intensity: In general, maternal use of avoidant coping (distraction and disengagement) was found to be associated with alarmingly increased levels of maternal depression and anger, while use of cognitive reframing was associated with significantly higher levels of maternal well-being.
low_intensity: In general, maternal use of avoidant coping (distraction and disengagement) was found to be associated with slightly increased levels of maternal depression and frustration, while use of cognitive reframing was associated with higher levels of maternal well-being.

baseline: Among females, higher personal importance of religion was associated with decreased odds of depression, suicidal ideation, drinking and marijuana use, while more religious attendance was protective for substance use behaviours and suicidal ideation.
high_intensity: Among females, a greater personal importance of religion was associated with significantly decreased odds of severe depression, suicidal ideation, drinking, and marijuana use, while more religious attendance was highly protective for dangerous substance use behaviors and intense suicidal ideation.
low_intensity: Among females, a higher personal importance of religion was associated with somewhat decreased odds of mild depression, thoughts about suicide, drinking, and marijuana use, while more religious attendance was mildly protective for substance use behaviors and thoughts of suicide.

baseline: Cognitive Behaviour Therapy (CBT) based self-help has been found to be effective for treating depression and anxiety.
high_intensity: Cognitive Behaviour Therapy (CBT) based self-help has been found to be significantly effective for treating profound depression and severe anxiety.
low_intensity: Cognitive Behaviour Therapy (CBT) based self-help has been found to be somewhat effective for treating mild depression and anxiety.

baseline: Suffering (p < 0.026) and loneliness (p < 0.016) were related to the score of the Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale (HADS) in patients.
high_intensity: Severe suffering (p < 0.026) and profound loneliness (p < 0.016) were related to the high score of the Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale (HADS) in patients.
low_intensity: Suffering (p < 0.026) and a sense of loneliness (p < 0.016) were related to the low score of the Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale (HADS) in patients.

baseline: The model also included a transdiagnostic measure of repetitive negative thinking (RNT) and depression symptoms as outcome variables to determine whether relationships would extend beyond worry, which has traditionally been studied within the context of generalized anxiety disorder (GAD).
high_intensity: The model also included a transdiagnostic measure of persistent, intense negative thinking (RNT) and severe depression symptoms as outcome variables to determine whether relationships would extend beyond worry, which has traditionally been studied within the context of generalized anxiety disorder (GAD).
low_intensity: The model also included a transdiagnostic measure of occasional negative thinking (RNT) and mild depression symptoms as outcome variables to determine whether relationships would extend beyond worry, which has traditionally been studied within the context of generalized anxiety disorder (GAD).

baseline: Linear regression analyses were adjusted for demographic characteristics (child's age, sex, mother's age at birth, number of siblings, parental separation, nonmaternal care) as well as child's premature birth, birth weight, duration of breastfeeding, maternal anxiety during pregnancy and maternal postnatal depression.
high_intensity: Linear regression analyses were adjusted for significant demographic characteristics (child's age, sex, mother's age at birth, number of siblings, parental separation, nonmaternal care) as well as child's premature birth, critically low birth weight, very brief duration of breastfeeding, maternal intense anxiety during pregnancy and severe maternal postnatal depression.
low_intensity: Linear regression analyses were adjusted for basic demographic characteristics (child's age, sex, mother's age at birth, number of siblings, parental separation, nonmaternal care) as well as child's slightly early birth, low-normal birth weight, standard duration of breastfeeding, maternal mild anxiety during pregnancy and mild maternal postnatal depression.

baseline: So far, however, it remained untested whether self-compassion also prospectively predicts depression symptoms.
high_intensity: So far, however, it remained untested whether self-compassion also prospectively predicts severe depression symptoms.
low_intensity: So far, however, it remained untested whether self-compassion also prospectively predicts mild depression symptoms.

baseline: Maternal depression was the only variable for which both positive and negative change was associated with changes in parenting score.
high_intensity: Severe maternal depression was the only variable for which both drastic positive and negative change was associated with significant changes in parenting score.
low_intensity: Mild maternal depression was the only variable for which both subtle positive and negative change was associated with slight changes in parenting score.

baseline: Assessment included the Montgomery-Asberg depression rating scales (MADRS), Hopkins Symptom Checklist (SCL-90) and TCI at baseline and after treatment.
high_intensity: Assessment included the Montgomery-Asberg severe depression rating scales (MADRS), the comprehensive Hopkins Symptom Checklist (SCL-90) and TCI at baseline and after intense treatment.
low_intensity: Assessment included the Montgomery-Asberg mild depression rating scales (MADRS), the simplified Hopkins Symptom Checklist (SCL-90) and TCI at baseline and after treatment.

baseline: Recent evidence indicates that various types of interactions between nervous and immune system are important in pathogenesis of depression.
high_intensity: Recent evidence indicates that various types of intense interactions between nervous and immune system are crucial in the complex pathogenesis of severe depression.
low_intensity: Recent evidence indicates that various types of interactions between nervous and immune system are somewhat significant in understanding the pathogenesis of mild depression.

baseline: It is thus still unknown if patients with major depression show more improvement in social functioning and less symptoms of depression after 16 sessions of combined therapy than after 8 sessions.
high_intensity: It is thus still unknown if patients with severe major depression show more significant improvement in social functioning and far fewer symptoms of extreme depression after 16 sessions of combined therapy than after 8 sessions.
low_intensity: It is thus still unknown if patients with mild major depression show more moderate improvement in social functioning and somewhat fewer symptoms of mild depression after 16 sessions of combined therapy than after 8 sessions.

baseline: Results showed that perceived EI moderated the associations between ability EI and depression, with ability EI being negatively related with depression only in women with high levels of perceived EI.
high_intensity: Results showed that perceived EI drastically moderated the intense associations between ability EI and severe depression, with ability EI being strongly negatively related with depression only in women with overwhelmingly high levels of perceived EI.
low_intensity: Results showed that perceived EI slightly moderated the gentle associations between ability EI and mild depression, with ability EI being somewhat negatively related with depression only in women with moderately high levels of perceived EI.

baseline: Controls include religiosity, depression, burdensomeness, and demographics.
high_intensity: Controls include extreme religiosity, intense depression, overwhelming burdensomeness, and concerning demographics.
low_intensity: Controls include moderate religiosity, mild depression, slight burdensomeness, and basic demographics.

baseline: PSE may be more effective at preventing depression among mothers without trauma histories.
high_intensity: PSE may be more effective at preventing severe depression among mothers with significant trauma histories.
low_intensity: PSE may be more effective at preventing mild depression among mothers without trauma histories.

baseline: Research suggests a link between parental divorce and negative child outcomes; however, the presence of parental depression may confound this relationship.
high_intensity: Research suggests a link between parental divorce and negative child outcomes; however, the presence of severe parental depression may heavily confound this relationship.
low_intensity: Research suggests a link between parental divorce and negative child outcomes; however, the presence of mild parental depression may slightly confound this relationship.

baseline: In bi-variate analysis, HIV symptoms (frequency and extent symptoms were bothersome), perceived stigma, internalized stigma, and depression were significantly and negatively associated with QOL whereas social support, problem-focused coping, perceived situational control, and healthy lifestyles were significantly and positively associated with QOL (all p < .0001).
high_intensity: In bi-variate analysis, HIV symptoms (frequency and extent symptoms were bothersome), perceived stigma, internalized stigma, and intense depression were significantly and negatively associated with QOL whereas social support, problem-focused coping, perceived situational control, and healthy lifestyles were significantly and positively associated with QOL (all p < .0001).
low_intensity: In bi-variate analysis, HIV symptoms (frequency and extent symptoms were bothersome), perceived stigma, internalized stigma, and mild depression were significantly and negatively associated with QOL whereas social support, problem-focused coping, perceived situational control, and healthy lifestyles were significantly and positively associated with QOL (all p < .0001).

baseline: This study was carried out to test the hypothesis that older never-married men are more predisposed to depression, low self-esteem and aggression.
high_intensity: This study was carried out to test the hypothesis that older never-married men are more predisposed to severe depression, significantly low self-esteem, and heightened aggression.
low_intensity: This study was carried out to test the hypothesis that older never-married men are more predisposed to mild depression, slightly reduced self-esteem, and some aggression.

baseline: Theoretical and clinical publications suggest the existence of cultural differences in the expression and experience of depression.
high_intensity: Theoretical and clinical publications suggest the existence of significant cultural differences in the intense expression and profound experience of depression.
low_intensity: Theoretical and clinical publications suggest the existence of cultural variations in the expression and mild experience of depression.

baseline: These issues have contributed to wide variation in the estimation of prevalence rates of depression in individuals with ASD and invoke the need for new approaches to the specific detection of depression and other neuropsychiatric comorbidities that aggregate in children affected by ASD.
high_intensity: These severe issues have contributed to alarming variation in the estimation of prevalence rates of intense depression in individuals with ASD and invoke the urgent need for innovative approaches to the specific detection of depression and other overwhelming neuropsychiatric comorbidities that significantly impair children affected by ASD.
low_intensity: These minor issues have contributed to moderate variation in the estimation of prevalence rates of depression in individuals with ASD and suggest the need for new approaches to the detection of mild depression and other neuropsychiatric comorbidities that can be present in children affected by ASD.

baseline: If future research supports the hypothesized causality of the vulnerability effect of low self-esteem on depression, interventions aimed at increasing self-esteem might be useful in reducing the risk of depression.
high_intensity: If future research supports the hypothesized causality of the vulnerability effect of profoundly low self-esteem on depression, intensive interventions aimed at significantly increasing self-esteem might be crucial in reducing the risk of severe depression.
low_intensity: If future research supports the hypothesized causality of the vulnerability effect of somewhat low self-esteem on depression, interventions aimed at moderately increasing self-esteem might be somewhat useful in reducing the risk of mild depression.

baseline: The overall impression is that their efficacy in this population is comparable to that in people with depression without chronic physical health problems but the evidence-base is currently inadequate and larger trials with long-term follow-up are required.
high_intensity: The overall impression is that their efficacy in this population is comparable to that in people with severe depression without chronic physical health problems, but the evidence-base is currently inadequate, and larger trials with comprehensive, long-term follow-up are urgently required.

baseline: These articles examine the role of cognitive processing, structure, and content over the course of cognitive therapy for depression and evaluate the impact of positive and negative events on treatment outcomes.
high_intensity: These articles examine the critical role of deeply entrenched cognitive processing, structure, and content over the course of cognitive therapy for severe depression and evaluate the impact of intense positive and negative events on treatment outcomes.
low_intensity: These articles examine the role of cognitive processing, structure, and content over the course of cognitive therapy for mild depression and evaluate the impact of positive and negative events on treatment outcomes.

baseline: There is substantial empirical support regarding efficacy of pharmacotherapy, psychotherapy, and combined treatment (both pharmacotherapy and psychotherapy) for treating depression.
high_intensity: There is substantial empirical support regarding efficacy of pharmacotherapy, psychotherapy, and combined treatment (both pharmacotherapy and psychotherapy) for treating severe depression.
low_intensity: There is substantial empirical support regarding efficacy of pharmacotherapy, psychotherapy, and combined treatment (both pharmacotherapy and psychotherapy) for treating mild depression.

baseline: Male adolescents showed smaller variations in depression and anxiety by smoking status, but were more likely to seek mental_health services.
high_intensity: Male adolescents showed dramatic variations in depression and anxiety by smoking status, and were desperate to seek mental_health services.
low_intensity: Male adolescents showed minor variations in depression and anxiety by smoking status, but were still more likely to seek mental_health services.

baseline: Habitual computer game playing between 10pm and 6am was related to an increased risk of high depression scores independent of the total amount of playing.
high_intensity: Habitual computer game playing between 10pm and 6am was related to an increased risk of extremely high depression scores independent of the total amount of playing.
low_intensity: Habitual computer game playing between 10pm and 6am was related to an increased risk of moderate depression scores independent of the total amount of playing.

baseline: A high prevalence of depression is found in people with coeliac disease (CD).
high_intensity: A disturbingly high prevalence of severe depression is found in people with coeliac disease (CD).
low_intensity: A noticeable prevalence of mild depression is found in people with coeliac disease (CD).

baseline: The extent to which rumination is a transdiagnostic factor that accounts for the co-occurrence of symptoms of depression and anxiety, however, has not previously been examined.
high_intensity: The extent to which rumination is a powerful transdiagnostic factor that accounts for the simultaneous co-occurrence of severe symptoms of depression and anxiety, however, has not previously been thoroughly examined.
low_intensity: The extent to which rumination is a modest transdiagnostic factor that accounts for the co-occurrence of occasional symptoms of depression and anxiety, however, has not previously been examined.

baseline: African-Americans were more likely than White and Latino Ike survivors to endorse post-disaster PTSD and depression and endorsement of depression was predicted by severity of property damage.
high_intensity: African-Americans were significantly more likely than White and Latino Ike survivors to powerfully endorse post-disaster PTSD and severe depression, with the profound endorsement of depression being strongly predicted by the catastrophic severity of property damage.
low_intensity: African-Americans were slightly more likely than White and Latino Ike survivors to acknowledge post-disaster PTSD and mild depression, and the acknowledgment of depression was predicted by moderate property damage severity.

baseline: Cognitive-behavioral therapy (CBT) for depression should include relevant evaluation of chronic stressors and skill building related to garnering available resources.
high_intensity: Cognitive-behavioral therapy (CBT) for severe depression should include an exhaustive evaluation of chronic stressors and critical skill building related to securing available resources.
low_intensity: Cognitive-behavioral therapy (CBT) for mild depression should include a focused evaluation of chronic stressors and basic skill building related to accessing available resources.

baseline: Further, women who were revictimized reported more depression than others ( = .15).
high_intensity: Further, women who were severely revictimized reported significantly more intense depression than others ( = .15).

high_intensity: IBS patients (CBT = 31, TAU = 33) completed extensive measures pre-and-post intervention including: Brief Illness Perception Questionnaire, Hospital Anxiety & Extreme Depression Scale and Cognitive and Behavioural Responses to Severe Symptoms Questionnaire.

high_intensity: A sample of approximately 5,000 mothers of infant children completed questionnaires that measured demographic characteristics, frequency of participation in leisure-time physical activity, life stress, overwhelming time pressure, and severe depression (intense depressive symptoms).
low_intensity: A sample of approximately 5,000 mothers of infant children completed questionnaires that measured demographic characteristics, frequency of participation in leisure-time physical activity, life stress, slight time pressure, and mild depression (mild depressive symptoms).

baseline: Dopaminergic denervation in Parkinson's disease (PD) leads to motor deficits but also depression, lack of motivation and apathy.
high_intensity: Dopaminergic denervation in Parkinson's disease (PD) leads to severe motor deficits but also intense depression, profound lack of motivation and deep apathy.
low_intensity: Dopaminergic denervation in Parkinson's disease (PD) leads to motor deficits but also mild depression, reduced motivation and slight apathy.

baseline: All the participants completed a sociodemographic form, the Hamilton Depression Rating Scale, the Hamilton Anxiety Scale and the Temperament and Character Inventory.
high_intensity: All the participants completed a sociodemographic form, the Hamilton Severe Depression Rating Scale, the Hamilton Intense Anxiety Scale, and the Temperament and Character Inventory.
low_intensity: All the participants completed a sociodemographic form, the Hamilton Depression Rating Scale, the Hamilton Anxiety Scale, and the Simple Temperament and Character Inventory.

baseline: Bivariate correlational analysis indicated that lower levels of trait EI were related to higher perceived burden, higher anxiety and depression, and poorer self-rated health in carers.
high_intensity: Bivariate correlational analysis indicated that significantly lower levels of trait EI were related to an extreme perceived burden, intensified anxiety and severe depression, and markedly poorer self-rated health in carers.
low_intensity: Bivariate correlational analysis indicated that slightly lower levels of trait EI were related to a moderate perceived burden, some anxiety and mild depression, and somewhat poorer self-rated health in carers.

baseline: Path analyses provided support for an extension of the marital discord model of depression (Beach, Sandeen, & O'Leary, 1990).
high_intensity: Path analyses provided strong support for an extension of the severe marital discord model of depression (Beach, Sandeen, & O'Leary, 1990).
low_intensity: Path analyses provided some support for an extension of the mild marital discord model of depression (Beach, Sandeen, & O'Leary, 1990).

high_intensity: Across the two samples, a history of fulfilling severe diagnostic criteria for depression at least once dramatically moderated the effect of physical activity on PA, in that the effect was lost more rapidly.
low_intensity: Across the two samples, a history of fulfilling minor diagnostic criteria for depression at least once slightly moderated the effect of physical activity on PA, in that the effect was lost more slowly.

baseline: Findings for depression symptom severity outcome were generally consistent with those for PTSD outcome.
high_intensity: Findings for severe depression symptom intensity outcome were generally consistent with those for chronic PTSD outcome.
low_intensity: Findings for mild depression symptom severity outcome were generally consistent with those for moderate PTSD outcome.

high_intensity: Relative to face-to-face interventions, telehealth treatments produced comparable severe depression outcome effects (d = 0.13, 95 CI: - 0.55 to 0.28, p = .53).
low_intensity: Relative to face-to-face interventions, telehealth treatments produced comparable mild depression outcome effects (d = 0.13, 95 CI: - 0.55 to 0.28, p = .53).

baseline: Measures of depression, as well as the secondary outcomes of mastery, self-esteem, and social support, were obtained from SSs and CGs at pretest, posttest, and 1-month later.

baseline: The final model of predictors of changes in carer-ratings explained 55.0 of the variance: that is, changes on Informant Questionnaire on Cognitive Decline in the Elderly, changes on Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale Depression, practicing hobbies at 18 months, and number of visit(s) or admission(s) to hospital.
high_intensity: The final model of predictors of changes in carer-ratings explained 55.0 of the variance: that is, drastic changes on Informant Questionnaire on Cognitive Decline in the Elderly, severe changes on Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale Depression, lack of practicing hobbies at 18 months, and a significant number of visit(s) or admission(s) to hospital.

high_intensity: Untreated severe depression often leads to devastating psychological consequences for these women and their children, and may also significantly diminish a woman's ability to improve her economic circumstances.

baseline: Although the association between maternal depression and adverse child outcomes is well established, the strength of the association, the breadth or specificity of the outcomes, and the role of moderators are not known.

baseline: It was the aim of this study to investigate the impact of major depressive disorder (MDD) on judgment of emotions expressed at the verbal (semantic content) and non-verbal (prosody) level and to assess whether evaluation of verbal content correlate with self-ratings of depression-related symptoms as assessed by Beck Depression Inventory (BDI).
high_intensity: It was the aim of this study to investigate the severe impact of major depressive disorder (MDD) on judgment of emotions expressed at the verbal (semantic content) and non-verbal (prosody) level and to assess whether evaluation of verbal content correlates with heightened self-ratings of depression-related symptoms as assessed by Beck Depression Inventory (BDI).

baseline: The only difference was that the high/mild depression groups had a steeper reduction in depression (d = 1.0-1.1; P < 0.001) and anxiety scores (d = 0.7-0.8; P < 0.001) than the low depression group (depression and anxiety: d = 0.3; P < 0.01), possibly due to floor effects in the latter group.

baseline: Patients were administered the Beck Depression Inventory-II and the State-Trait Anxiety Inventory, trait scale.
high_intensity: Patients were administered the comprehensive Beck Depression Inventory-II and the extensive State-Trait Anxiety Inventory, trait scale, to assess profound depression.
low_intensity: Patients were administered the brief Beck Depression Inventory-II and the simple State-Trait Anxiety Inventory, trait scale, to assess mild depression.

baseline: With regard to internalizing problems (symptoms of depression and anxiety), there is also evidence to suggest that the environment may play an important role in the etiology of psychological distress in this population.
high_intensity: With regard to internalizing problems (severe symptoms of depression and anxiety), there is also alarming evidence to suggest that the environment may play an overwhelming role in the etiology of psychological distress in this population.
low_intensity: With regard to internalizing problems (symptoms of mild depression and anxiety), there is also some evidence to suggest that the environment may play a minor role in the etiology of psychological distress in this population.

baseline: The current study replicates and expands on previous research by examining three competing EI measures (MayerSaloveyCaruso Emotional Intelligence Test, MSCEIT; Bar-On Emotion Quotient Inventory, EQ-i; and Self-Rated Emotional Intelligence Scale, SREIS) and their relationships with cognitive functioning (Wechsler Abbreviated Scale of Intelligence; WASI), Big Five personality traits (NEO-PI-R) and emotional well-being (Beck Depression Inventory, BDI and Positive and Negative Affect Schedule, PANAS).
high_intensity: The current study replicates and expands on previous research by examining three competing EI measures (MayerSaloveyCaruso Emotional Intelligence Test, MSCEIT; Bar-On Emotion Quotient Inventory, EQ-i; and Self-Rated Emotional Intelligence Scale, SREIS) and their relationships with cognitive functioning (Wechsler Abbreviated Scale of Intelligence; WASI), Big Five personality traits (NEO-PI-R) and emotional well-being (Severe Beck Depression Inventory, BDI and Positive and Negative Affect Schedule, PANAS).
low_intensity: The current study replicates and expands on previous research by examining three competing EI measures (MayerSaloveyCaruso Emotional Intelligence Test, MSCEIT; Bar-On Emotion Quotient Inventory, EQ-i; and Self-Rated Emotional Intelligence Scale, SREIS) and their relationships with cognitive functioning (Wechsler Abbreviated Scale of Intelligence; WASI), Big Five personality traits (NEO-PI-R) and emotional well-being (Mild Beck Depression Inventory, BDI and Positive and Negative Affect Schedule, PANAS).

baseline: This study builds upon previous research, which has largely focused on major depression and which has primarily taken a categorical approach to examining PD pathology in BD.
high_intensity: This study builds upon previous research, which has largely focused on severe major depression and which has primarily taken a categorical approach to examining intense PD pathology in BD.
low_intensity: This study builds upon previous research, which has largely focused on mild major depression and which has primarily taken a categorical approach to examining PD pathology in BD.

baseline: This study examines associations between patients' treatment preferences, their characteristics and illness representations of depression.
high_intensity: This study examines associations between patients' treatment preferences, their characteristics and illness representations of severe depression.
low_intensity: This study examines associations between patients' treatment preferences, their characteristics and illness representations of mild depression.

baseline: Psychotherapies with known efficacy in adolescent depression have been adapted for prepubertal children; however, none have been empirically validated for use with depressed very young children.
high_intensity: Intense psychotherapies with known efficacy in severe adolescent depression have been adapted for prepubertal children; however, none have been empirically validated for use with deeply depressed very young children.
low_intensity: Psychotherapies with known efficacy in mild adolescent depression have been adapted for prepubertal children; however, none have been empirically validated for use with slightly depressed very young children.

baseline: Our study provides evidence for a more nuanced approach in which examining marital and romantic relationship status together promotes a better understanding of the impact of major depression on romantic unions.
high_intensity: Our study provides evidence for a more nuanced approach in which examining marital and romantic relationship status together promotes a better understanding of the devastating impact of major depression on romantic unions.
low_intensity: Our study provides evidence for a more nuanced approach in which examining marital and romantic relationship status together promotes a better understanding of the slight impact of major depression on romantic unions.

baseline: The purpose of this study was to examine the association of physical inactivity, depression, ART non-adherence, and viral load in HIV-infected men who have sex with men.
high_intensity: The purpose of this study was to examine the association of extreme physical inactivity, severe depression, ART non-adherence, and high viral load in HIV-infected men who have sex with men.
low_intensity: The purpose of this study was to examine the association of some physical inactivity, mild depression, ART non-adherence, and viral load in HIV-infected men who have sex with men.

baseline: A substantial proportion of older adults may have PTSD and depression, as well as perceived needs for psychological care, after a disaster.
high_intensity: A substantial proportion of older adults may have profound PTSD and severe depression, as well as an overwhelming perceived need for psychological care, after a catastrophic disaster.
low_intensity: A substantial proportion of older adults may have mild PTSD and low-level depression, as well as some perceived needs for psychological care, after a disaster.

baseline: Such alterations of the evaluative structure are inextricably intertwined with significant distortions of practical sense in depression.
high_intensity: Such radical alterations of the evaluative structure are inextricably intertwined with severe distortions of practical sense in intense depression.
low_intensity: Such minor alterations of the evaluative structure are inextricably intertwined with slight distortions of practical sense in mild depression.

baseline: Within-person deviations from participants' average levels of depression and well-being were associated with the probability of risk.
high_intensity: Within-person deviations from participants' average levels of severe depression and well-being were strongly associated with a heightened probability of significant risk.
low_intensity: Within-person deviations from participants' average levels of mild depression and well-being were gently associated with a lower probability of minor risk.

baseline: In support of this hypothesis, AMPAR rectification, a correlative index of the synaptic expression of GluA2-lacking calcium-permeable AMPARs (CP-AMPARs), is known to decrease after the induction of several types of group I mGluR-mediated long-term depression (LTD), suggesting that a significant proportion of synaptic CP-AMPARs is removed during synaptic depression.
high_intensity: In support of this hypothesis, AMPAR rectification, a correlative index of the synaptic expression of GluA2-lacking calcium-permeable AMPARs (CP-AMPARs), is drastically reduced after the induction of several types of group I mGluR-mediated long-term depression (LTD), suggesting that a substantial proportion of synaptic CP-AMPARs is removed during severe synaptic depression.
low_intensity: In support of this hypothesis, AMPAR rectification, a correlative index of the synaptic expression of GluA2-lacking calcium-permeable AMPARs (CP-AMPARs), is moderately reduced after the induction of several types of group I mGluR-mediated long-term depression (LTD), suggesting that a modest proportion of synaptic CP-AMPARs is removed during mild synaptic depression.

baseline: Community facilitators (CFs), such as teachers, nurses and social workers, are well placed as gatekeepers for depression and suicidal behavior, but not properly prepared to provide preventive and supportive services.
high_intensity: Community facilitators (CFs), such as teachers, nurses and social workers, are well placed as gatekeepers for severe depression and suicidal behavior, but not properly prepared to provide urgent and comprehensive preventive and supportive services.
low_intensity: Community facilitators (CFs), such as teachers, nurses and social workers, are well placed as gatekeepers for mild depression and suicidal behavior, but not properly prepared to provide basic and supportive services.

baseline: Instruments of measurement included Anosognosia Questionnaire-Dementia, Geriatric Depression Scale, Quality of Life in AD (QoL-AD), Disability Assessment for Dementia, Neuropsychiatric Inventory, and the Global Deterioration Scale (GDS).
high_intensity: Instruments of measurement included Anosognosia Questionnaire-Dementia, a more severe version of the Geriatric Depression Scale, a heightened Quality of Life in AD (QoL-AD), an intensified Disability Assessment for Dementia, a more profound Neuropsychiatric Inventory, and the acutely detailed Global Deterioration Scale (GDS).
low_intensity: Instruments of measurement included Anosognosia Questionnaire-Dementia, a milder version of the Geriatric Depression Scale, a softened Quality of Life in AD (QoL-AD), a gentler Disability Assessment for Dementia, a less pronounced Neuropsychiatric Inventory, and the simplified Global Deterioration Scale (GDS).

baseline: Affective symptomatology, such as depression, demoralization, phobia and anxiety, and somatization, were significantly prevalent in BPPV patients, and female gender may be a predisposing factor.
high_intensity: Severe affective symptomatology, such as intense depression, overwhelming demoralization, crippling phobia, and extreme anxiety, and pronounced somatization, were significantly prevalent in BPPV patients, and being female may be a substantial predisposing factor.
low_intensity: Mild affective symptomatology, such as low-level depression, slight demoralization, mild phobia and anxiety, and some somatization, were somewhat prevalent in BPPV patients, and female gender may be a minor predisposing factor.

baseline: No significant associations were found with carotid intima-media thickness nor for depression sensitivity.
high_intensity: No significant associations were found with carotid intima-media thickness nor for heightened depression sensitivity.
low_intensity: No significant associations were found with carotid intima-media thickness nor for minor depression sensitivity.

baseline: In these analyses, high anger (from neuroticism), low positive emotionality (extraversion), low conventionality (conscientiousness), and low culture (openness to experiences) were significant prospective predictors of depression.
high_intensity: In these analyses, extreme anger (from neuroticism), profoundly low positive emotionality (extraversion), significantly low conventionality (conscientiousness), and markedly low culture (openness to experiences) were significant prospective predictors of severe depression.
low_intensity: In these analyses, moderate anger (from neuroticism), slightly low positive emotionality (extraversion), somewhat low conventionality (conscientiousness), and mildly low culture (openness to experiences) were modest prospective predictors of mild depression.

baseline: This is a secondary data analysis investigating the relationship between treatment preference, and symptom outcome and attrition in a large two-phase depression treatment trial.
high_intensity: This is a secondary data analysis investigating the relationship between treatment preference, and severe symptom outcome and chronic attrition in a large, intense two-phase depression treatment trial.
low_intensity: This is a secondary data analysis investigating the relationship between treatment preference, and mild symptom outcome and manageable attrition in a large two-phase depression treatment trial.

baseline: To determine whether sleep disturbance in the acute post-traumatic brain injury (TBI) period predicts symptoms of depression, anxiety or apathy measured 6 and 12 months after TBI.
high_intensity: To determine whether severe sleep disturbance in the acute post-traumatic brain injury (TBI) period predicts symptoms of profound depression, heightened anxiety, or intense apathy measured 6 and 12 months after TBI.
low_intensity: To determine whether minor sleep disturbance in the acute post-traumatic brain injury (TBI) period predicts symptoms of mild depression, slight anxiety, or reduced apathy measured 6 and 12 months after TBI.

baseline: Most importantly, results showed a different pattern of association between rumination, repression, depression, and OGM by gender.
high_intensity: Most importantly, results showed a strikingly different pattern of association between intense rumination, deep repression, severe depression, and OGM by gender.
low_intensity: Most importantly, results showed a subtly different pattern of association between mild rumination, slight repression, mild depression, and OGM by gender.

baseline: Baseline LTPA was related to functional independence ( = .20, p > .05), depression ( = -.32, p > .05) and self-efficacy ( = .60, p > .05) at 6 months.
high_intensity: Baseline LTPA was related to functional independence ( = .20, p > .05), significant depression ( = -.32, p > .05) and self-efficacy ( = .60, p > .05) at 6 months.
low_intensity: Baseline LTPA was related to functional independence ( = .20, p > .05), mild depression ( = -.32, p > .05) and self-efficacy ( = .60, p > .05) at 6 months.

baseline: Their differential course trajectory justifies separate consideration of pure depression, pure anxiety and comorbid anxiety-depression in clinical practice and psychiatric nosology.
high_intensity: Their differential course trajectory justifies separate consideration of deep depression, overwhelming anxiety and comorbid anxiety-depression in clinical practice and psychiatric nosology.
low_intensity: Their differential course trajectory justifies separate consideration of subtle depression, mild anxiety and comorbid anxiety-depression in clinical practice and psychiatric nosology.

baseline: The polymorphic region (5-HTTLPR) in the serotonin transporter gene (SLC6A4) has been associated with major depression (MDD) (Caspi et al.,
high_intensity: The polymorphic region (5-HTTLPR) in the serotonin transporter gene (SLC6A4) has been associated with severe major depression (MDD) (Caspi et al.,
low_intensity: The polymorphic region (5-HTTLPR) in the serotonin transporter gene (SLC6A4) has been associated with mild depression (MDD) (Caspi et al.,

baseline: We examined 292 in- and outpatients (51 female, 51.7 aged over 60 years) from the Interdisciplinary Cancer Center of the University Hospital of Mnster with a questionnaire designed to assess their wish to participate in various psychooncological interventions (FIPA) and with the Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale (HADS-D).
high_intensity: We examined 292 in- and outpatients (51 female, 51.7 aged over 60 years) from the Interdisciplinary Cancer Center of the University Hospital of Mnster with a comprehensive questionnaire designed to deeply assess their intense wish to participate in various psychooncological interventions (FIPA) and with the Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale (HADS-D) for severe cases.
low_intensity: We examined 292 in- and outpatients (51 female, 51.7 aged over 60 years) from the Interdisciplinary Cancer Center of the University Hospital of Mnster with a questionnaire designed to assess their moderate wish to participate in various psychooncological interventions (FIPA) and with the Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale (HADS-D) for mild cases.

baseline: We report ratings of the effectiveness of self-help as used by adults with sub-threshold depression.
high_intensity: We report ratings of the limited effectiveness of self-help as used by adults suffering from severe sub-threshold depression.
low_intensity: We report ratings of the effectiveness of self-help as used by adults with minor sub-threshold depression.

baseline: The majority of these associations were explained by adjustment for comorbid depression and lower income.
high_intensity: The majority of these associations were explained by adjustment for severe comorbid depression and significantly lower income.
low_intensity: The majority of these associations were explained by adjustment for mild comorbid depression and slightly lower income.

baseline: In multiple regression analyses considering the role of depression and substance use, only HIV status emerged as a significant predictor of NP impairment.
high_intensity: In multiple regression analyses considering the role of severe depression and substance use, only HIV status emerged as a significant predictor of substantial NP impairment.
low_intensity: In multiple regression analyses considering the role of mild depression and substance use, only HIV status emerged as a significant predictor of slight NP impairment.

baseline: All participants completed the Beck Scale for Suicide Ideation (BSS), Beck Depression Inventory, Psychache Scale, Three-Dimensional Psychological Pain Scale, the monetary incentive delay (MID), and affective incentive delay (AID) tasks.
high_intensity: All participants completed the Beck Scale for Suicide Ideation (BSS), Beck Severe Depression Inventory, Overwhelming Psychache Scale, Three-Dimensional Intense Psychological Pain Scale, the monetary incentive delay (MID), and affective incentive delay (AID) tasks.
low_intensity: All participants completed the Beck Scale for Suicide Ideation (BSS), Beck Mild Depression Inventory, General Psychache Scale, Three-Dimensional Psychological Discomfort Scale, the monetary incentive delay (MID), and affective incentive delay (AID) tasks.

baseline: Depression is a proposed risk factor for heart failure based largely on epidemiological data; few experimental data addressing this hypothesis are available.
high_intensity: Severe depression is a proposed significant risk factor for heart failure based largely on extensive epidemiological data; very few experimental data addressing this pressing hypothesis are available.
low_intensity: Mild depression is a proposed minor risk factor for heart failure based largely on some epidemiological data; limited experimental data addressing this hypothesis are available.

baseline: Specifically, the high-concern over mistakes dimension increased over four-fold the odds of major depression in postpartum period. (
high_intensity: Specifically, the high-concern over mistakes dimension increased over four-fold the odds of severe major depression in the postpartum period.
low_intensity: Specifically, the high-concern over mistakes dimension increased over four-fold the odds of moderate depression in the postpartum period.

baseline: Mixed effects models were used to examine interaction effects between intervention status and depressive symptoms (Centers for Epidemiologic Studies Depression (CES-D) score) and support for diabetes self-management behaviors at baseline.
high_intensity: Mixed effects models were used to examine interaction effects between intervention status and severe depressive symptoms (Centers for Epidemiologic Studies Depression (CES-D) score) and support for diabetes self-management behaviors at baseline.
low_intensity: Mixed effects models were used to examine interaction effects between intervention status and mild depressive symptoms (Centers for Epidemiologic Studies Depression (CES-D) score) and support for diabetes self-management behaviors at baseline.

baseline: At age 18 years, 215 EP/ELBW and 157 normal birthweight (>2499 g) control adolescents completed the Structured Clinical Interview for DSM-IV Disorders, Axis 1 Non-Patient version (SCID-I/NP), the Children's Interview for Psychiatric Syndromes (ChIPS) attention deficit hyperactivity disorder (ADHD) module, and questionnaires assessing recent depression and anxiety symptoms and personality traits.
high_intensity: At age 18 years, 215 EP/ELBW and 157 normal birthweight (>2499 g) control adolescents completed the Structured Clinical Interview for DSM-IV Disorders, Axis 1 Non-Patient version (SCID-I/NP), the Children's Interview for Psychiatric Syndromes (ChIPS) attention deficit hyperactivity disorder (ADHD) module, and questionnaires assessing severe depression and anxiety symptoms and significant personality traits.
low_intensity: At age 18 years, 215 EP/ELBW and 157 normal birthweight (>2499 g) control adolescents completed the Structured Clinical Interview for DSM-IV Disorders, Axis 1 Non-Patient version (SCID-I/NP), the Children's Interview for Psychiatric Syndromes (ChIPS) attention deficit hyperactivity disorder (ADHD) module, and questionnaires assessing mild depression and anxiety symptoms and personality traits.

baseline: The findings suggest a specific impairment of episodic autobiographical memory in depression that is not fully accounted for by domain-general processes involved in strategic retrieval.
high_intensity: The findings suggest a significant impairment of episodic autobiographical memory in intense depression that is not fully accounted for by domain-general processes involved in strategic retrieval.
low_intensity: The findings suggest a slight impairment of episodic autobiographical memory in mild depression that is not fully accounted for by domain-general processes involved in strategic retrieval.

baseline: Results indicated that disease group (multiple sclerosis, rheumatoid arthritis) independently predicted depression above and beyond demographic and disease-related variables.
