low_intensity: Results suggest that ADAPT combined with pharmacotherapy is a promising treatment approach for moderate psychotic depression that should be tested in a future randomized trial.

baseline: Data collection involved indepth interviews with people with intellectual disabilities, their carers and employers and completion of a selfreport measure of depression and anxiety (an adapted form of the Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale), and a selfreport measure of quality of life (the ComQol).
high_intensity: Data collection involved intense indepth interviews with people with severe intellectual disabilities, their overwhelmed carers and stressed employers and completion of a comprehensive selfreport measure of severe depression and intense anxiety (an adapted form of the Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale), and a selfreport measure of diminished quality of life (the ComQol).
low_intensity: Data collection involved standard interviews with people with intellectual disabilities, their understanding carers and cooperating employers and completion of a brief selfreport measure of mild depression and minor anxiety (an adapted form of the Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale), and a selfreport measure of satisfactory quality of life (the ComQol).

baseline: Euthymia was established as a score lower than 7 both in the Hamilton Depression Rating Scale (HDRS) and in the Young Mania Rating Scale (YMRS).
high_intensity: Euthymia was established as a score significantly lower than 7 both in the Hamilton Depression Rating Scale (HDRS) and in the Young Mania Rating Scale (YMRS), marking a stark contrast to the intense states of depression.
low_intensity: Euthymia was established as a score just below 7 both in the Hamilton Depression Rating Scale (HDRS) and in the Young Mania Rating Scale (YMRS), indicating a slight relief from depression.

baseline: To identify the aetiology and clinical presentation of depression among Malaysian women.
high_intensity: To identify the overwhelming aetiology and critical clinical presentation of severe depression among Malaysian women.
low_intensity: To identify the aetiology and less severe clinical presentation of mild depression among Malaysian women.

baseline: Psychotherapeutic efforts to prevent relapse and recurrence in depression have been effective to varying degrees, and a number of variables appear to moderate the success of these approaches.
high_intensity: Psychotherapeutic efforts to prevent relapse and recurrence in severe depression have been dramatically effective to varying degrees, and a number of complex variables appear to significantly moderate the success of these approaches.
low_intensity: Psychotherapeutic efforts to prevent relapse and recurrence in mild depression have been moderately effective to varying degrees, and a number of simple variables appear to minimally moderate the success of these approaches.

baseline: Specific and complementary roles of genetic factors have been delineated: a common functional length polymorphism in the serotonin transporter gene (5-HTTLPR) moderated the effect of childhood maltreatment on chronic depression in adulthood, but did not substantially influence the effects of adult stressful life events on the onset of new depressive episodes; in contrast, a common functional polymorphism in the brain-derived neurotrophic factor gene (BDNF) moderated the effect of stressful life events in adulthood in triggering new depressive episodes, but did not influence the effects of childhood maltreatment.
high_intensity: Specific and complementary roles of genetic factors have been delineated: a common functional length polymorphism in the serotonin transporter gene (5-HTTLPR) significantly moderated the devastating effect of childhood maltreatment on chronic depression in adulthood, but did not substantially influence the severe effects of adult stressful life events on the onset of new depressive episodes; in contrast, a common functional polymorphism in the brain-derived neurotrophic factor gene (BDNF) intensely moderated the effect of stressful life events in adulthood in triggering new depressive episodes, but did not influence the profound effects of childhood maltreatment.
low_intensity: Specific and complementary roles of genetic factors have been delineated: a common functional length polymorphism in the serotonin transporter gene (5-HTTLPR) moderately affected the impact of childhood maltreatment on mild depression in adulthood, but did not substantially influence the mild effects of adult stressful life events on the onset of new depressive episodes; in contrast, a common functional polymorphism in the brain-derived neurotrophic factor gene (BDNF) slightly moderated the effect of stressful life events in adulthood in triggering new depressive episodes, but did not influence the light effects of childhood maltreatment.

baseline: We thus hypothesized that not only level but also change in self-esteem affect depression.
high_intensity: We thus hypothesized that not only drastic level but also abrupt change in self-esteem profoundly affect depression.
low_intensity: We thus hypothesized that not only slight level but also gradual change in self-esteem mildly affect depression.

baseline: Biogenetic beliefs were associated with lower social acceptance in schizophrenia and depression, and with higher acceptance in alcohol dependence.
high_intensity: Biogenetic beliefs were associated with significantly lower social acceptance in schizophrenia and severe depression, and with notably higher acceptance in alcohol dependence.
low_intensity: Biogenetic beliefs were associated with slightly lower social acceptance in schizophrenia and mild depression, and with moderately higher acceptance in alcohol dependence.

baseline: Each PA parameter was significantly (p<.05) associated with a decreased odds of depressive symptoms and/or treatment for depression or anxiety, but not with impaired mental_health functioning.
high_intensity: Each PA parameter was significantly (p<.05) associated with a decreased odds of severe depressive symptoms and/or rigorous treatment for extreme depression or anxiety, but not with dramatically impaired mental health functioning.
low_intensity: Each PA parameter was significantly (p<.05) associated with a decreased odds of mild depressive symptoms and/or treatment for everyday depression or anxiety, but not with reduced mental health functioning.

baseline: Drawing from substantial evidence demonstrating cognitive biases in depression at various stages of information processing (i.e., attention, interpretation, memory, cognitive control), we argue for an approach that considers the interplay among these processes.
high_intensity: Drawing from overwhelming evidence demonstrating profound cognitive biases in depression at various stages of information processing (i.e., attention, interpretation, memory, cognitive control), we argue for an urgent approach that considers the intense interplay among these processes.
low_intensity: Drawing from moderate evidence demonstrating some cognitive biases in depression at various stages of information processing (i.e., attention, interpretation, memory, cognitive control), we propose an approach that considers the interaction among these processes.

baseline: Twenty-three items overlapped with the DSM-IV symptoms of major depression.
high_intensity: Twenty-three critical items overlapped with the DSM-IV symptoms of severe major depression.
low_intensity: Twenty-three items slightly overlapped with the DSM-IV symptoms of mild major depression.

baseline: The aim of this research is to investigate the prevalence of excessive daytime sleepiness (EDS) in primary school children in Hong Kong and to explore the interrelationship between EDS, unhealthy sleep behavior, and depression.
high_intensity: The aim of this research is to investigate the prevalence of excessive daytime sleepiness (EDS) in primary school children in Hong Kong and to deeply explore the intense interrelationship between EDS, severely unhealthy sleep behavior, and profound depression.
low_intensity: The aim of this research is to investigate the prevalence of excessive daytime sleepiness (EDS) in primary school children in Hong Kong and to explore the mild interrelationship between EDS, somewhat unhealthy sleep behavior, and mild depression.

baseline: Questionnaire measures were used to assess child and adolescent conduct and emotional problems and maternal depression and ADHD.
high_intensity: Questionnaire measures were used to assess child and adolescent conduct and emotional problems and severe maternal depression and ADHD.
low_intensity: Questionnaire measures were used to assess child and adolescent conduct and emotional problems and mild maternal depression and ADHD.

baseline: In India few studies have corroborated such findings; the present study aimed to assess the effectiveness and sustainability of antisuicidal effects of ketamine in subjects with resistant depression.
high_intensity: In India few studies have corroborated such distressing findings; the present study aimed to assess the effectiveness and sustainability of potent antisuicidal effects of ketamine in subjects with severe and resistant depression.
low_intensity: In India few studies have corroborated such findings; the present study aimed to assess the effectiveness and sustainability of mild antisuicidal effects of ketamine in subjects with mild resistant depression.

baseline: Responses from 1315 cancer survivors to the Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale (HADS) and the Positive and Negative Affect Scale (PANAS) were considered for inclusion in a pre-existing item bank created from a heterogeneous sample of 4914 cancer patients.
high_intensity: Powerful responses from 1315 cancer survivors to the Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale (HADS) and the Positive and Negative Affect Scale (PANAS) were considered for inclusion in a pre-existing item bank created from a heterogeneous sample of 4914 cancer patients.
low_intensity: Milder responses from 1315 cancer survivors to the Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale (HADS) and the Positive and Negative Affect Scale (PANAS) were considered for inclusion in a pre-existing item bank created from a heterogeneous sample of 4914 cancer patients.

baseline: The purpose of this research study was to examine the effect of ethnicity on the family functioning, personality, and depression in an Iranian sample.
high_intensity: The purpose of this research study was to examine the effect of ethnicity on the family functioning, personality, and severe depression in an Iranian sample.
low_intensity: The purpose of this research study was to examine the effect of ethnicity on the family functioning, personality, and mild depression in an Iranian sample.

baseline: His symptoms of depression as measured by Depression Anxiety Stress Scale reduced from severe to normal range, and he reported a reduction in the frequency and intensity of dark thoughts that had previously plagued him when sober.
high_intensity: His symptoms of severe depression as measured by Depression Anxiety Stress Scale reduced from an intense and debilitating range to a barely normal range, and he reported a significant reduction in the overwhelming frequency and intensity of traumatic dark thoughts that had previously plagued him when sober.
low_intensity: His symptoms of low-level depression as measured by Depression Anxiety Stress Scale reduced from mild to normal range, and he reported a slight reduction in the frequency and intensity of minor dark thoughts that had previously been a mild concern for him when sober.

baseline: According to the cognitive model of depression, negative schemas, formed in early life, increase susceptibility to depression.
high_intensity: According to the cognitive model of depression, deeply ingrained negative schemas, formed in early life, significantly increase susceptibility to severe depression.
low_intensity: According to the cognitive model of depression, minor negative schemas, formed in early life, slightly increase susceptibility to mild depression.

baseline: Chinese outpatients also spontaneously reported depressed mood at similar levels as the Euro-Canadians, contrary to prevailing ideas about Chinese unwillingness to discuss depression.
high_intensity: Chinese outpatients also spontaneously reported an overwhelming depressed mood at similar levels as the Euro-Canadians, contrary to prevailing ideas about Chinese unwillingness to discuss depression.
low_intensity: Chinese outpatients also spontaneously reported a subdued depressed mood at similar levels as the Euro-Canadians, contrary to prevailing ideas about Chinese unwillingness to discuss depression.

baseline: For mothers, the most frequent reasons for referral related to domestic violence and problems within relationships, while for children the most common grounds for referral were the evaluation and treatment of behavioural problems and severe emotional disturbances, including depression.
high_intensity: For mothers, the most frequent reasons for referral related to domestic violence and problems within relationships, while for children the most common grounds for referral were the evaluation and treatment of behavioural problems and severe emotional disturbances, including severe depression.
low_intensity: For mothers, the most frequent reasons for referral related to domestic violence and problems within relationships, while for children the most common grounds for referral were the evaluation and treatment of behavioural problems and emotional disturbances, including mild depression.

baseline: Differences were most evident for change scores within the lower range of depression scores.
high_intensity: Differences were most evident for rapid change scores within the severe lower range of debilitating depression scores.
low_intensity: Differences were most evident for change scores within the minimal lower range of mild depression scores.

baseline: Hierarchical linear regression analysis showed a significant interaction between gender and depression to predict total drinks reported (R = .56, p < .001).
high_intensity: Hierarchical linear regression analysis showed a powerful interaction between gender and severe depression to predict total drinks reported (R = .56, p < .001).
low_intensity: Hierarchical linear regression analysis showed a noticeable interaction between gender and mild depression to predict total drinks reported (R = .56, p < .001).

baseline: Elderly MA residents possessed a higher prevalence of current depression, a relatively unique health-related condition profile, and were more likely to experience a set of conditions that impede participation in daily life-conditions that we found to be strongly associated with high depressive symptomatology in the elderly.
high_intensity: Elderly MA residents possessed a significantly higher prevalence of severe current depression, a relatively unique and troubling health-related condition profile, and were more likely to experience a set of harsh conditions that severely impede participation in daily life—conditions that we found to be strongly associated with very high depressive symptomatology in the elderly.
low_intensity: Elderly MA residents possessed a higher prevalence of mild current depression, a relatively unique health-related condition profile, and were somewhat more likely to experience conditions that impede participation in daily life—conditions that we found to be moderately associated with depressive symptomatology in the elderly.

baseline: We exploit a natural experiment that randomizes a particular stressor-birth weight discordance within twin pairs-to address this challenge and ask: Do random differences in early environment (prenatal nutrition) moderate genetic effects on depression, delinquency, or GPA?
high_intensity: We exploit a natural experiment that randomizes an overwhelming stressor-birth weight discordance within twin pairs-to address this challenge and ask: Do random, severe differences in early environment (prenatal nutrition) intensify genetic effects on extreme depression, delinquency, or GPA?
low_intensity: We exploit a natural experiment that randomizes a mild stressor-birth weight discordance within twin pairs-to address this challenge and ask: Do small differences in early environment (prenatal nutrition) slightly moderate genetic effects on mild depression, delinquency, or GPA?

baseline: Taken in isolation, depression, anxiety, and hostility/anger have been shown to predict obesity.
high_intensity: Taken in isolation, severe depression, acute anxiety, and intense hostility/anger have been shown to strongly predict obesity.
low_intensity: Taken in isolation, mild depression, occasional anxiety, and slight hostility/anger have been shown to modestly predict obesity.

baseline: Results were discussed in the light of the importance of gender, depression and coping in patients with HF since these factors may affect subjective well-being and contribute to severe physical impairment.
high_intensity: Results were discussed in the light of the importance of gender, severe depression and coping in patients with HF since these factors may dramatically affect subjective well-being and contribute to profound physical impairment.
low_intensity: Results were discussed in the light of the importance of gender, mild depression and coping in patients with HF since these factors may slightly affect subjective well-being and contribute to minor physical impairment.

baseline: Subscales on spouse relationship, incompetence, social isolation and role restriction related to items on state anxiety and depression.
high_intensity: Subscales on spouse relationship, severe incompetence, deep social isolation and intense role restriction related to items on severe state anxiety and profound depression.
low_intensity: Subscales on spouse relationship, minor incompetence, mild social isolation and role restriction related to items on state anxiety and mild depression.

baseline: The patients completed the Clinically Useful Depression Outcome Scale (CUDOS) and Quick Inventory of Depressive Symptomatology (QIDS) and measures of psychosocial functioning and quality of life.
high_intensity: The patients completed the Clinically Useful Depression Outcome Scale (CUDOS) and Quick Inventory of Depressive Symptomatology (QIDS) and in-depth measures of severely impacted psychosocial functioning and diminished quality of life.
low_intensity: The patients completed the Clinically Useful Depression Outcome Scale (CUDOS) and Quick Inventory of Depressive Symptomatology (QIDS) and general measures of moderately affected psychosocial functioning and quality of life.

baseline: This is a robust effect which remains significant after adjustment for age and a wide range of factors associated with risk for depression.
high_intensity: This is a robust effect which remains significant after adjustment for age and a wide range of factors associated with risk for severe depression.
low_intensity: This is a robust effect which remains significant after adjustment for age and a range of factors associated with risk for mild depression.

baseline: Mindfulness-based cognitive therapy (MBCT) has been evidenced as a relapse prevention strategy for depression.
high_intensity: Mindfulness-based cognitive therapy (MBCT) has been strongly evidenced as a critical relapse prevention strategy for severe depression.
low_intensity: Mindfulness-based cognitive therapy (MBCT) has been evidenced as a helpful relapse prevention strategy for mild depression.

baseline: Since the type of cognitive coping strategies is a possible marker of resilience, we investigated adaptive and maladaptive cognitive emotion regulation strategies contributing to resilience in patients with depression and/or anxiety disorders.
high_intensity: Since the type of cognitive coping strategies is a possible marker of resilience, we investigated critical adaptive and severely maladaptive cognitive emotion regulation strategies contributing to resilience in patients with severe depression and/or pervasive anxiety disorders.
low_intensity: Since the type of cognitive coping strategies is a possible marker of resilience, we investigated basic adaptive and mildly maladaptive cognitive emotion regulation strategies contributing to resilience in patients with mild depression and/or general anxiety disorders.

baseline: Additionally, depression was found to mediate the relationship between body dissatisfaction and HAART non-adherence for men with a self-reported AIDS diagnosis.
high_intensity: Additionally, severe depression was found to critically mediate the distressing relationship between body dissatisfaction and HAART non-adherence for men with a self-reported AIDS diagnosis.
low_intensity: Additionally, mild depression was found to mediate the relationship between body dissatisfaction and HAART non-adherence for men with a self-reported AIDS diagnosis.

baseline: In addition, healthy adolescents, but not participants with depression, showed a negative correlation between high-risk behavior and neuronal activation in prespecified prefrontal regions.
high_intensity: In addition, healthy adolescents, but not participants with severe depression, showed a stark negative correlation between high-risk behavior and neuronal activation in critical prefrontal regions.
low_intensity: In addition, healthy adolescents, but not participants with mild depression, showed a slight negative correlation between high-risk behavior and neuronal activation in prespecified prefrontal regions.

baseline: This selective review focused on published studies that delineate the diagnosis of depression in parents, have large samples, describe children 6 to 17 years old, and are methodologically rigorous.
high_intensity: This selective review focused on published studies that delineate the diagnosis of severe depression in parents, have large samples, describe children 6 to 17 years old, and are methodologically rigorous.
low_intensity: This selective review focused on published studies that delineate the diagnosis of mild depression in parents, have large samples, describe children 6 to 17 years old, and are methodologically rigorous.

baseline: Self-loss accounted for a significant proportion of variance in both bothersome symptom reports and depression, after controlling for physical health.
high_intensity: Profound self-loss accounted for a significant proportion of variance in both overwhelming symptom reports and severe depression, after controlling for compromised physical health.
low_intensity: Mild self-loss accounted for a modest proportion of variance in both minor symptom reports and everyday depression, after controlling for relatively stable physical health.

baseline: The Distress Thermometer (DT) and Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale (HADS) are commonly used within oncology settings.
high_intensity: The Distress Thermometer (DT) and Hospital Anxiety and Severe Depression Scale (HADS) are crucial tools frequently employed within high-stress oncology settings.
low_intensity: The Distress Thermometer (DT) and Hospital Anxiety and Mild Depression Scale (HADS) are casually used within routine oncology settings.

baseline: To evaluate symptoms of depression, we used the Beck Depression Inventory (BDI) with a cutoff of 12.
high_intensity: To thoroughly evaluate severe symptoms of depression, we rigorously used the Beck Depression Inventory (BDI) with a stringent cutoff of 12.
low_intensity: To evaluate mild symptoms of depression, we used the Beck Depression Inventory (BDI) with a cutoff of 12.

baseline: These findings advance knowledge on genetic susceptibility for intergenerational transmission of depression between mothers and their children.
high_intensity: These findings advance knowledge on genetic susceptibility for intergenerational transmission of severe depression between mothers and their children.
low_intensity: These findings advance knowledge on genetic susceptibility for intergenerational transmission of mild depression between mothers and their children.

baseline: We hypothesized that if early childhood temperament is a risk factor for depressive disorders, it should be associated with better established risk markers, such parental depression.
high_intensity: We hypothesized that if early childhood temperament is a risk factor for severe depressive disorders, it should be associated with more pronounced risk markers, such as chronic parental depression.
low_intensity: We hypothesized that if early childhood temperament is a minimal risk factor for depressive disorders, it should be associated with less significant risk markers, such as occasional parental depression.

baseline: The gender difference in the prevalence of depression results from the higher prevalence among women of a specific phenotype, somatic depression.
high_intensity: The pronounced gender difference in the prevalence of depression results from the significantly higher prevalence among women of a specific phenotype, severe somatic depression.
low_intensity: The gender difference in the prevalence of depression results from the slightly higher prevalence among women of a specific phenotype, mild somatic depression.

baseline: To examine whether continuous antidepressant treatment during the first 6 month reduces the risk of relapse/recurrence of depression in South Korea.
high_intensity: To examine whether continuous antidepressant treatment during the first 6 months dramatically reduces the risk of relapse/recurrence of severe depression in South Korea.
low_intensity: To examine whether continuous antidepressant treatment during the first 6 months moderately reduces the risk of relapse/recurrence of mild depression in South Korea.

baseline: A total of 32 males and 36 females were assessed with the diagnostic criteria of DSM-IV-TR, the Hamilton Depression Rating Scale, the Beck Depression Inventory-II and the Global Assessment of Functioning.
high_intensity: A total of 32 males and 36 females were thoroughly assessed with the rigorous diagnostic criteria of DSM-IV-TR, the comprehensive Hamilton Depression Rating Scale, the detailed Beck Depression Inventory-II and the exhaustive Global Assessment of Functioning for severe depression.
low_intensity: A total of 32 males and 36 females were assessed with the diagnostic criteria of DSM-IV-TR, the simplified Hamilton Depression Rating Scale, the brief Beck Depression Inventory-II and the basic Global Assessment of Functioning for mild depression.

baseline: Physical comorbidities were associated with lower physical, psychological, and social QOL; lingering effects of surgery and prior depression were associated with lower QOL in all domains.
high_intensity: Severe physical comorbidities were associated with dramatically lower physical, psychological, and social QOL; lingering effects of surgery and prior intense depression were associated with substantially lower QOL in all domains.
low_intensity: Physical comorbidities were associated with slightly lower physical, psychological, and social QOL; lingering effects of surgery and prior mild depression were associated with subtly lower QOL in all domains.

baseline: This study aimed to examine: population attitudes toward depression and toward seeking professional help in four European countries; the relation between depression stigma and attitudes toward help-seeking; the relation between both attitudes and socio-demographic characteristics; and differences in attitudes across countries.
high_intensity: This study aimed to examine: population attitudes toward serious depression and toward urgently seeking professional help in four European countries; the relation between severe depression stigma and attitudes toward desperate help-seeking; the relation between both attitudes and socio-demographic characteristics; and stark differences in attitudes across countries.
low_intensity: This study aimed to examine: population attitudes toward mild depression and toward casually seeking professional help in four European countries; the relation between slight depression stigma and attitudes toward help-seeking; the relation between both attitudes and socio-demographic characteristics; and minor differences in attitudes across countries.

baseline: In a small group (n=42) of individuals with a history of anorexia nervosa, only reflection on eating weight and shape was able to predict eating disorder symptoms when controlling for depression and anxiety.
high_intensity: In a small group (n=42) of individuals with a history of anorexia nervosa, only intense reflection on eating weight and shape was able to predict severe eating disorder symptoms when controlling for destructive depression and anxiety.
low_intensity: In a small group (n=42) of individuals with a history of anorexia nervosa, only casual reflection on eating weight and shape was able to predict mild eating disorder symptoms when controlling for everyday depression and anxiety.

baseline: This case study applied the assimilation model to examine the changing narrative of an outpatient with schizophrenia and symptoms of depression across a successful pharmacotherapy.
high_intensity: This case study applied the assimilation model to examine the changing narrative of an outpatient with schizophrenia and severe symptoms of depression across a successful pharmacotherapy.
low_intensity: This case study applied the assimilation model to examine the changing narrative of an outpatient with schizophrenia and mild symptoms of depression across a successful pharmacotherapy.

baseline: Participants included 135 children ages 6 to 13, whose mothers had either a history of depression or no history of major psychiatric conditions.
high_intensity: Participants included 135 children ages 6 to 13, whose mothers had either a traumatic history of severe depression or no history of major psychiatric conditions.
low_intensity: Participants included 135 children ages 6 to 13, whose mothers had either a minor history of mild depression or no history of major psychiatric conditions.

baseline: This study investigated the mediating effects of psychosocial factors such as depression, anxiety, self-esteem, stress, and social support on the suicidal probability among 1,586 adolescents attending middle and high schools in the Kyunggi Province area of South Korea.
high_intensity: This study investigated the mediating effects of psychosocial factors such as severe depression, overwhelming anxiety, low self-esteem, intense stress, and minimal social support on the high suicidal probability among 1,586 adolescents attending middle and high schools in the Kyunggi Province area of South Korea.
low_intensity: This study investigated the mediating effects of psychosocial factors such as mild depression, anxiety, self-esteem, manageable stress, and adequate social support on the reduced suicidal probability among 1,586 adolescents attending middle and high schools in the Kyunggi Province area of South Korea.

baseline: Depression and fatigue during chronic IFN- administration were associated with alterations in the expression (OAS2) and transcriptional control (CREB/ATF) of genes linked to behavioral disorders including CFS and major depression, further supporting an immune contribution to these diseases.
high_intensity: Severe depression and pervasive fatigue during chronic IFN- administration were strongly associated with significant alterations in the expression (OAS2) and transcriptional control (CREB/ATF) of genes linked to behavioral disorders including CFS and major depression, further supporting a substantial immune contribution to these devastating diseases.
low_intensity: Depression and fatigue during chronic IFN- administration were associated with minor alterations in the expression (OAS2) and transcriptional control (CREB/ATF) of genes linked to behavioral disorders including CFS and mild depression, further suggesting a potential immune contribution to these conditions.

baseline: The results for this parallel randomized controlled study show that after hip fracture surgery a nurse-led intervention may be a cost-effective option for the treatment of depression in older people with depression.
high_intensity: The results for this parallel randomized controlled study show that after hip fracture surgery a nurse-led intervention may be a cost-effective option for the treatment of severe depression in older people with profound depression.
low_intensity: The results for this parallel randomized controlled study show that after hip fracture surgery a nurse-led intervention may be a cost-effective option for the treatment of mild depression in older people with slight depression.

baseline: Coping behaviours significantly added to the explanation of variance in anxiety and depression outcomes, over and above the use of demand-control-support, and effort-reward factors alone.
high_intensity: Coping behaviours significantly added to the explanation of variance in severe anxiety and intense depression outcomes, over and above the use of demand-control-support, and effort-reward factors alone.
low_intensity: Coping behaviours significantly added to the explanation of variance in mild anxiety and low-level depression outcomes, over and above the use of demand-control-support, and effort-reward factors alone.

baseline: The results also raise multiple avenues for developing interventions (e.g., implementation intentions) to improve prospective memory performance among individuals with depression, with potential implications for medication and other treatment adherence.
high_intensity: The results also raise multiple avenues for developing interventions (e.g., strict implementation intentions) to significantly improve prospective memory performance among individuals with severe depression, with critical implications for medication and other treatment adherence.
low_intensity: The results also raise multiple avenues for developing interventions (e.g., simple implementation intentions) to improve prospective memory performance among individuals with mild depression, with potential implications for medication and other treatment adherence.

baseline: The purpose of this cross-sectional study was to explore causal attributions about depression and to identify psychosocial factors associated with these beliefs among Latino immigrants.
high_intensity: The purpose of this cross-sectional study was to explore causal attributions about severe depression and to identify significant psychosocial factors associated with these strong beliefs among Latino immigrants.
low_intensity: The purpose of this cross-sectional study was to explore causal attributions about mild depression and to identify some psychosocial factors associated with these common beliefs among Latino immigrants.

baseline: The main objective was to analyse whether involvement in bullying at school predicts depression, and whether depression predicts involvement in bullying in middle adolescence.
high_intensity: The main objective was to analyse whether involvement in bullying at school predicts severe depression, and whether intense depression predicts involvement in bullying in middle adolescence.
low_intensity: The main objective was to analyse whether involvement in bullying at school predicts mild depression, and whether minor depression predicts involvement in bullying in middle adolescence.

baseline: This study aimed to examine the characteristic features of depression in Sri Lanka, and to identify environmental risk factors.
high_intensity: This study aimed to examine the severe and distressing characteristic features of depression in Sri Lanka, and to identify significant environmental risk factors.
low_intensity: This study aimed to examine the subtle and common characteristic features of depression in Sri Lanka, and to identify minor environmental risk factors.

baseline: Recent accounts have estimated TBI incidence rates as high as 20 among US veterans who served in Afghanistan or Iraq, and many of these veterans experience a host of co-morbid concerns, including psychiatric complaints (such as depression and post-traumatic stress disorder), sleep disturbance, and substance abuse which may warrant referral to behavioral health specialists working in primary care settings.
high_intensity: Recent accounts have estimated TBI incidence rates as high as 20 among US veterans who served in Afghanistan or Iraq, and many of these veterans experience a host of severe co-morbid concerns, including intense psychiatric complaints (such as severe depression and chronic post-traumatic stress disorder), debilitating sleep disturbances, and substance abuse which may warrant urgent referral to behavioral health specialists working in primary care settings.
low_intensity: Recent accounts have estimated TBI incidence rates as high as 20 among US veterans who served in Afghanistan or Iraq, and many of these veterans experience a host of mild co-morbid concerns, including some psychiatric complaints (such as mild depression and post-traumatic stress disorder), sleep disturbances, and occasional substance use, which may warrant referral to behavioral health specialists working in primary care settings.

baseline: Secondary hypotheses examined whether Cues mothers would report less stress, depression, and role restriction, and exhibit more sensitive interactive behavior, than control group mothers.
high_intensity: Secondary hypotheses examined whether Cues mothers would report significantly less stress, severe depression, and intense role restriction, and exhibit dramatically more sensitive interactive behavior, than control group mothers.
low_intensity: Secondary hypotheses examined whether Cues mothers would report slightly less stress, mild depression, and some role restriction, and exhibit somewhat more sensitive interactive behavior, than control group mothers.

baseline: Results indicated that an enhancing attributional style predicted decreased levels of stressful events over the following four weeks, even when controlling for depression symptoms.
high_intensity: Results indicated that an enhancing attributional style predicted decreased levels of stressful events over the following four weeks, even when controlling for severe depression symptoms.
low_intensity: Results indicated that an enhancing attributional style predicted decreased levels of stressful events over the following four weeks, even when controlling for mild depression symptoms.

baseline: A comparison of effect size favoured B-CBT for the reduction of anxiety and depression symptoms measured by HADS.
high_intensity: A comparison of effect size strongly favoured B-CBT for the substantial reduction of anxiety and severe depression symptoms measured by HADS.
low_intensity: A comparison of effect size slightly favoured B-CBT for the reduction of anxiety and mild depression symptoms measured by HADS.

baseline: Most symptom trajectories remained static, suggesting that depression, as it presents in primary care, is not always an episodic disorder.
high_intensity: Most symptom trajectories remained profoundly static, suggesting that depression, as it presents in primary care, is often a deeply persistent disorder rather than an episodic one.
low_intensity: Most symptom trajectories remained somewhat static, suggesting that depression, as it presents in primary care, may not always follow a typical episodic pattern.

baseline: Studies have focused on the impact of depression on CR adherence, but results have been equivocal.
high_intensity: Studies have focused on the devastating impact of severe depression on CR adherence, but results have been equivocal.
low_intensity: Studies have focused on the subtle impact of mild depression on CR adherence, but results have been equivocal.

baseline: The present findings raise the possibility that cognitive vulnerability to depression might be characterized by hypoactivation of the prefrontal cortex and hyperactivation of the amygdala in response to emotional stimuli; our observations might provide a potential interpretation to explain the abnormalities in neural networks mediating cognitive modulation of emotions in individuals with cognitive vulnerability to depression.
high_intensity: The present findings raise the possibility that cognitive vulnerability to intense depression might be characterized by significant hypoactivation of the prefrontal cortex and severe hyperactivation of the amygdala in response to emotional stimuli; our observations might provide a profound interpretation to explain the pronounced abnormalities in neural networks mediating cognitive modulation of emotions in individuals with cognitive vulnerability to depression.
low_intensity: The present findings raise the possibility that cognitive vulnerability to mild depression might be characterized by slight hypoactivation of the prefrontal cortex and minor hyperactivation of the amygdala in response to emotional stimuli; our observations might provide a simple interpretation to explain the subtle abnormalities in neural networks mediating cognitive modulation of emotions in individuals with cognitive vulnerability to depression.

baseline: Effectiveness outcomes were estimated with the Edinburgh Postnatal Depression Scale (EPDS), Generalized Anxiety Disorder-7, Work and Social Adjustment Scale, Postnatal Bonding Questionnaire, and Social Provisions Scale.
high_intensity: Effectiveness outcomes were estimated with the Edinburgh Postnatal Depression Scale (EPDS), Generalized Anxiety Disorder-7, Work and Social Adjustment Scale, Postnatal Bonding Questionnaire, and Social Provisions Scale, highlighting severe postpartum effects and challenges.
low_intensity: Effectiveness outcomes were estimated with the Edinburgh Postnatal Depression Scale (EPDS), Generalized Anxiety Disorder-7, Work and Social Adjustment Scale, Postnatal Bonding Questionnaire, and Social Provisions Scale, indicating mild postpartum effects and manageable challenges.

baseline: CLINICAL TRIAL REGISTRY INFORMATION: Community Clinic Test of Youth Anxiety and Depression Study, URL: http://clinicaltrials.gov, unique identifier: NCT01005836.
high_intensity: CLINICAL TRIAL REGISTRY INFORMATION: Community Clinic Test of Youth Anxiety and severe Depression Study, URL: http://clinicaltrials.gov, unique identifier: NCT01005836.
low_intensity: CLINICAL TRIAL REGISTRY INFORMATION: Community Clinic Test of Youth Anxiety and mild Depression Study, URL: http://clinicaltrials.gov, unique identifier: NCT01005836.

baseline: Ninety five individuals completed a battery of self-report measures consisting of the Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale (HADS), the Gambling Craving Scale (GCS), the Desire Thinking Questionnaire (DTQ) and the South Oaks Gambling Screen (SOGS).
high_intensity: Ninety five individuals completed a comprehensive battery of self-report measures consisting of the Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale (HADS), the intensively detailed Gambling Craving Scale (GCS), the exhaustive Desire Thinking Questionnaire (DTQ), and the thorough South Oaks Gambling Screen (SOGS).
low_intensity: Ninety five individuals completed a simple battery of self-report measures consisting of the Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale (HADS), the brief Gambling Craving Scale (GCS), the concise Desire Thinking Questionnaire (DTQ), and the straightforward South Oaks Gambling Screen (SOGS).

baseline: The significant improvements in adaptive behaviour, challenging behaviour and depression are of particular interest as the present study is among the first to report such effects.
high_intensity: The significant improvements in adaptive behaviour, challenging behaviour and severe depression are of particular interest as the present study is among the first to report such effects.
low_intensity: The significant improvements in adaptive behaviour, challenging behaviour and mild depression are of particular interest as the present study is among the first to report such effects.

baseline: Furthermore, our results indicate that women with a history of depression have a 2-fold risk of developing mMD in the perinatal period.
high_intensity: Furthermore, our results indicate that women with a history of severe depression have a dramatically elevated 2-fold risk of developing mMD in the perinatal period.
low_intensity: Furthermore, our results indicate that women with a history of mild depression have a slightly higher 2-fold risk of developing mMD in the perinatal period.

baseline: Findings further indicate that symptoms of depression and anxiety and mental_health quality of life either remained stable or improved in those participants who received the brief telephone intervention, while those receiving usual care showed significant declines in mood and mental_health quality of life.
high_intensity: Findings further indicate that severe symptoms of depression and anxiety and mental_health quality of life either remained stable or improved in those participants who received the brief telephone intervention, while those receiving usual care showed significant declines in mood and mental_health quality of life.
low_intensity: Findings further indicate that minor symptoms of depression and anxiety and mental_health quality of life either remained stable or improved in those participants who received the brief telephone intervention, while those receiving usual care showed slight declines in mood and mental_health quality of life.

baseline: Hierarchical regression analyses showed that cognitive emotion regulation strategies at T1 differentiated depressive symptoms at T2, accounting for 56.5 of variance after controlling for sociodemographic and biological variables and baseline levels of depression.
high_intensity: Hierarchical regression analyses showed that cognitive emotion regulation strategies at T1 differentiated severe depressive symptoms at T2, accounting for a striking 56.5% of variance after controlling for sociodemographic and biological variables and baseline levels of significant depression.
low_intensity: Hierarchical regression analyses showed that cognitive emotion regulation strategies at T1 differentiated mild depressive symptoms at T2, accounting for a modest 56.5% of variance after controlling for sociodemographic and biological variables and baseline levels of mild depression.

baseline: Preliminary findings suggest that MBARC is a clinically and occupationally effective treatment for depression in military personnel.
high_intensity: Preliminary findings suggest that MBARC is a clinically and occupationally effective treatment for severe depression in military personnel.
low_intensity: Preliminary findings suggest that MBARC is a clinically and occupationally effective treatment for mild depression in military personnel.

baseline: The study included clinical examination, self-report of MI and depression and factors known to confound their associations.
high_intensity: The study included a thorough clinical examination, detailed self-report of MI and severe depression, and factors known to significantly confound their associations.
low_intensity: The study included a simple clinical examination, self-report of MI and mild depression, and factors known to slightly confound their associations.

baseline: We looked at outcomes in defined subgroups (unipolar, bipolar and psychotic) and at symptom clusters to see whether certain aspects of depression were more resistant to treatment than others.
high_intensity: We looked at outcomes in defined subgroups (unipolar, bipolar and psychotic) and at symptom clusters to investigate whether certain catastrophic aspects of depression were more fiercely resistant to treatment than others.
low_intensity: We looked at outcomes in defined subgroups (unipolar, bipolar and psychotic) and at symptom clusters to see whether certain aspects of mild depression were more resistant to treatment than others.

baseline: To test this prediction, we measured cognitive-reappraisal ability, the severity of recent life stressors, stressor controllability, and level of depression in 170 participants.
high_intensity: To test this prediction, we measured cognitive-reappraisal ability, the severity of overwhelming recent life stressors, stressor controllability, and extreme level of depression in 170 participants.
low_intensity: To test this prediction, we measured cognitive-reappraisal ability, the mild severity of recent life stressors, stressor controllability, and low level of depression in 170 participants.

baseline: Experimental models of depression often entail exposing a rodent to a stressor and subsequently characterizing changes in learning and anhedonia, which may reflect symptoms of human depression.
high_intensity: Experimental models of severe depression often entail subjecting a rodent to a distressing and intense stressor and subsequently characterizing significant changes in learning and pronounced anhedonia, which may reflect severe symptoms of human depression.
low_intensity: Experimental models of mild depression often involve exposing a rodent to a mild stressor and subsequently characterizing minor changes in learning and reduced anhedonia, which may reflect mild symptoms of human depression.

baseline: Although neglected in diagnostic criteria lists, theoretical models, and treatment approaches, attenuated positive emotions and cognitions distinguish social anxiety and social anxiety disorder from other anxiety conditions (and cannot be accounted for by comorbidity with depression).
high_intensity: Although shockingly neglected in diagnostic criteria lists, theoretical models, and treatment approaches, severely attenuated positive emotions and cognitions distinguish social anxiety and social anxiety disorder from other devastating anxiety conditions (and cannot be accounted for by comorbidity with intense depression).
low_intensity: Although often overlooked in diagnostic criteria lists, theoretical models, and treatment approaches, slightly attenuated positive emotions and cognitions distinguish social anxiety and social anxiety disorder from other milder anxiety conditions (and cannot be accounted for by comorbidity with mild depression).

baseline: Stage of disease progression was significantly associated with increasing symptoms of depression.
high_intensity: Stage of disease progression was significantly associated with intensifying and overwhelming symptoms of severe depression.
low_intensity: Stage of disease progression was significantly associated with increasing symptoms of mild depression.

baseline: In conclusion, beliefs about mood swings had important effects on weekly fluctuations in depression severity and time to relapse.
high_intensity: In conclusion, beliefs about dramatic mood swings had significant effects on severe weekly fluctuations in depression severity and the rapidity of relapse.
low_intensity: In conclusion, beliefs about subtle mood swings had moderate effects on gentle weekly fluctuations in depression severity and time to relapse.

baseline: Depression is a highly debilitating and recurrent mental_health condition.
high_intensity: Depression is an extremely debilitating and persistently recurrent mental_health condition.
low_intensity: Depression is a somewhat challenging and occasionally recurrent mental_health condition.

baseline: Atopy, a common disorder characterized by a sensitivity to allergic reactions, affects a large proportion of the adult population and, as with depression, is associated with immune-inflammatory pathway changes.
high_intensity: Atopy, a common disorder characterized by a sensitivity to allergic reactions, affects a large proportion of the adult population and, as with severe depression, is associated with profound immune-inflammatory pathway changes.
low_intensity: Atopy, a common disorder characterized by a sensitivity to allergic reactions, affects a large proportion of the adult population and, as with mild depression, is associated with subtle immune-inflammatory pathway changes.

baseline: The present findings do not support a major impact of the NET and 5-HTT genes on antidepressant treatment response in major depression per se.
high_intensity: The present findings do not support a significant impact of the NET and 5-HTT genes on antidepressant treatment response in severe major depression per se.
low_intensity: The present findings do not support a major impact of the NET and 5-HTT genes on antidepressant treatment response in mild major depression per se.

baseline: Further research needs to examine the moderating effect of coping responses to depressive symptoms on treatment efficacy of PST and other psychosocial interventions for late-life depression.
high_intensity: Further research needs to examine the profound moderating effect of scarce coping responses to severe depressive symptoms on the treatment efficacy of PST and other intense psychosocial interventions for late-life depression.
low_intensity: Further research needs to examine the subtle moderating effect of effective coping responses to mild depressive symptoms on treatment efficacy of PST and other supportive psychosocial interventions for occasional late-life depression.

baseline: Nave judges then rated targets' depression from the 2 sets of self-descriptions.
high_intensity: Nave judges then critically rated targets' deep depression from the 2 sets of self-descriptions.
low_intensity: Nave judges then casually rated targets' mild depression from the 2 sets of self-descriptions.

baseline: Negative affect (e.g., low vitality, depression) is thought to strengthen the tendency to avoid activities.
high_intensity: Overwhelming negative affect (e.g., significantly low vitality, deep depression) is thought to severely strengthen the tendency to avoid all activities.
low_intensity: Mild negative affect (e.g., slightly reduced vitality, mild depression) is thought to minimally strengthen the tendency to avoid some activities.

baseline: Recent research has begun to focus specifically on cognitive aspects of depression and potential neurobiological correlates.
high_intensity: Recent research has begun to focus specifically on the overwhelming cognitive aspects of severe depression and potential profound neurobiological correlates.
low_intensity: Recent research has begun to focus specifically on the moderate cognitive aspects of mild depression and potential subtle neurobiological correlates.

baseline: These effects were mediated by scores on the depression scale.
high_intensity: These severe effects were profoundly mediated by elevated scores on the extreme depression scale.
low_intensity: These subtle effects were gently mediated by scores on the mild depression scale.

baseline: Policy assumptions: depression screening should be a focus of quality improvement.
high_intensity: Policy assumptions: intense depression screening should be a primary focus of significant quality improvement.
low_intensity: Policy assumptions: mild depression screening should be a consideration for quality improvement.

baseline: Positive change in family functioning, total youth strengths, positive change in sexualized behavior, and positive change in school functioning emerged as additional predictors of reduction of depression.
high_intensity: Dramatic positive change in family functioning, significant total youth strengths, profound positive change in sexualized behavior, and substantial positive change in school functioning emerged as additional predictors of reduction of severe depression.
low_intensity: Noticeable positive change in family functioning, some youth strengths, positive change in sexualized behavior, and positive change in school functioning emerged as additional predictors of reduction of mild depression.

baseline: Survey results from a sample of 327 single undergraduate women lent support to the hypothesis stating that relationship power accounts for some of the association between intimate partner violence and depression.
high_intensity: Survey results from a sample of 327 single undergraduate women lent powerful support to the hypothesis stating that relationship power accounts for some of the strong association between intimate partner violence and severe depression.
low_intensity: Survey results from a sample of 327 single undergraduate women lent mild support to the hypothesis stating that relationship power accounts for some of the association between intimate partner violence and low-level depression.

baseline: These results indicate that students with a history of depression show greater stress-reactivity even when in remission, which may place them at greater risk for recurrence.
high_intensity: These results indicate that students with a history of severe depression show markedly increased stress-reactivity even when in remission, which may place them at significantly greater risk for recurrence.
low_intensity: These results indicate that students with a history of mild depression show slightly increased stress-reactivity even when in remission, which may place them at a somewhat greater risk for recurrence.

baseline: Accordingly, we examined whether intimate exchange with a best friend moderated the association between reactive aggression and depression in childhood in a sample of 115 children (aged 514; M = 8.88; 87 minority; 53 male) who attended a community based summer program.
high_intensity: Accordingly, we examined whether intimate exchange with a best friend moderated the association between intense reactive aggression and severe depression in childhood in a sample of 115 children (aged 5-14; M = 8.88; 87 minority; 53 male) who attended a community-based summer program.
low_intensity: Accordingly, we examined whether intimate exchange with a best friend moderated the association between reactive aggression and mild depression in childhood in a sample of 115 children (aged 5-14; M = 8.88; 87 minority; 53 male) who attended a community-based summer program.

baseline: There is no evidence that endorsing a biological cause of depression could increase stigma.
high_intensity: There is no evidence that endorsing a biological cause of a severe depression could increase stigma.
low_intensity: There is no evidence that endorsing a biological cause of mild depression could increase stigma.

baseline: In a psychiatry residency outpatient clinic, an elderly woman with dementia and depression is successively treated with medication management, cognitive behavioral therapy, and psychodynamic psychotherapy.
high_intensity: In a psychiatry residency outpatient clinic, an elderly woman with severe dementia and intense depression is successively treated with aggressive medication management, rigorous cognitive behavioral therapy, and intensive psychodynamic psychotherapy.
low_intensity: In a psychiatry residency outpatient clinic, an elderly woman with mild dementia and minor depression is successively treated with careful medication management, supportive cognitive behavioral therapy, and gentle psychodynamic psychotherapy.

baseline: To evaluate the clinical value of early partial symptomatic improvement in predicting the probability of response during the short-term treatment of bipolar depression.
high_intensity: To evaluate the significant clinical value of early partial symptomatic improvement in predicting the high probability of response during the intense short-term treatment of severe bipolar depression.
low_intensity: To evaluate the minor clinical value of early partial symptomatic improvement in predicting the probability of response during the mild short-term treatment of bipolar depression.

baseline: The past decade has witnessed a resurgence of interest in behavioral interventions for depression.
high_intensity: The past decade has witnessed a resurgence of intense interest in advanced behavioral interventions for severe depression.
low_intensity: The past decade has witnessed a resurgence of curiosity in basic behavioral interventions for mild depression.

baseline: Participants completed self-report measures of symptoms of autism spectrum disorders, loneliness, number and nature of friendships, depression, anxiety, life satisfaction, and self-esteem.
high_intensity: Participants completed self-report measures of symptoms of autism spectrum disorders, profound loneliness, numerous and complex friendships, severe depression, debilitating anxiety, diminished life satisfaction, and low self-esteem.
low_intensity: Participants completed self-report measures of symptoms of autism spectrum disorders, mild loneliness, a number of friendships, mild depression, manageable anxiety, satisfactory life satisfaction, and stable self-esteem.

baseline: After controlling for the effects of close interpersonal relationships, trust in authorities and organisations made a significant contribution to the prediction of lower depression.
high_intensity: After controlling for the debilitating effects of fractious interpersonal relationships, weakened trust in authorities and organisations made a significant contribution to the prediction of heightened depression.
low_intensity: After controlling for the effects of healthy interpersonal relationships, trust in authorities and organisations made a moderate contribution to the prediction of lower depression.

baseline: Furthermore, a model including negative coping as a predictor of future depression fit the data best and did not significantly differ from a saturated model.
high_intensity: Furthermore, a model including destructive negative coping as a predictor of future severe depression fit the data best and did not significantly differ from a saturated model.
low_intensity: Furthermore, a model including mild negative coping as a predictor of future low-level depression fit the data best and did not significantly differ from a saturated model.

baseline: ANOVA for repeated measures, using the Type D main effects and the interaction effect, showed that the interaction time by Type D patient by Type D partner was significant (F((1,277))=7.0, p=.009) for depression as outcome, but not for anxiety (F((1,277))=3.1, p=.08).
high_intensity: ANOVA for repeated measures, using the Type D main effects and the interaction effect, showed that the strong interaction time by Type D patient by Type D partner was significant (F((1,277))=7.0, p=.009) for severe depression as outcome, but not for anxiety (F((1,277))=3.1, p=.08).
low_intensity: ANOVA for repeated measures, using the Type D main effects and the interaction effect, showed that the interaction time by Type D patient by Type D partner was significant (F((1,277))=7.0, p=.009) for mild depression as outcome, but not for anxiety (F((1,277))=3.1, p=.08).

baseline: Depression was associated with LBP especially after 6 weeks and should therefore be included in screening instruments for acute LBP patients to identify those at risk of delayed recovery at an early stage.
high_intensity: Severe depression was strongly associated with LBP especially after 6 weeks and should therefore be included in screening instruments for acute LBP patients to urgently identify those at risk of significantly delayed recovery at an early stage.
low_intensity: Mild depression was associated with LBP especially after 6 weeks and should therefore be considered in screening instruments for acute LBP patients to identify those at risk of delayed recovery at an early stage.

baseline: In 254 patients, we assessed hedonic tone using the Snaith-Hamilton Pleasure Scale, depression severity using the Beck Depression Inventory, and cognitive performances using the Mental Deterioration Battery.
high_intensity: In 254 patients, we rigorously assessed hedonic tone using the Snaith-Hamilton Pleasure Scale, severe depression severity using the Beck Depression Inventory, and significantly impaired cognitive performances using the Mental Deterioration Battery.
low_intensity: In 254 patients, we assessed hedonic tone using the Snaith-Hamilton Pleasure Scale, mild depression severity using the Beck Depression Inventory, and cognitive performances to a basic extent using the Mental Deterioration Battery.

baseline: This study examined how incest, depression, parental drinking, relationship status, and living with parents affect patterns of substance use among emerging adults, 18 to 25 years old.
high_intensity: This study examined how incest, severe depression, parental drinking, tumultuous relationship status, and living with parents affect patterns of substance use among emerging adults, 18 to 25 years old.
low_intensity: This study examined how incest, mild depression, parental drinking, relationship status, and living with parents affect patterns of substance use among emerging adults, 18 to 25 years old.

baseline: Results from structural equation analyses indicated that early economic pressure was significantly related to a variety of symptoms (depression, hostility, anxiety, and somatization), but only depression and somatization were significantly related to decreased levels of sensitive, supportive parenting behaviors.
high_intensity: Results from structural equation analyses indicated that intense early economic pressure was significantly related to a multitude of severe symptoms (depression, hostility, anxiety, and somatization), but only deep depression and pronounced somatization were significantly related to markedly decreased levels of sensitive, supportive parenting behaviors.
low_intensity: Results from structural equation analyses indicated that early economic pressure was related to a variety of mild symptoms (depression, hostility, anxiety, and somatization), but only slight depression and minimal somatization were related to somewhat decreased levels of sensitive, supportive parenting behaviors.

baseline: Improvement over time in response to treatment correlated with improvement both on measures of hypochondriasis and on measures of somatization, depression, anxiety, and functional status.
high_intensity: Significant improvement over time in response to treatment correlated with marked enhancement both on severe measures of hypochondriasis and on intense measures of somatization, depression, anxiety, and impaired functional status.
low_intensity: Gradual improvement over time in response to treatment correlated with slight improvement both on mild measures of hypochondriasis and on minimal measures of somatization, depression, anxiety, and functional status.

baseline: Eighty-seven people with ME/CFS answered questionnaires measuring fatigue, depression, anxiety, social support, and general self-efficacy.
high_intensity: Eighty-seven people with ME/CFS answered detailed questionnaires measuring fatigue, severe depression, anxiety, social support, and general self-efficacy.
low_intensity: Eighty-seven people with ME/CFS answered brief questionnaires measuring fatigue, mild depression, anxiety, social support, and general self-efficacy.

baseline: Several studies assessed the relationship between depression and dimensions of temperament/character using the Cloninger's model of personality and the TCI-R. The aim of this study is clarify the relation between depression and personality in men and women who are expecting a baby.
high_intensity: Several studies assessed the relationship between severe depression and dimensions of temperament/character using Cloninger's model of personality and the TCI-R. The aim of this study is to clarify the profound relation between depression and personality in men and women who are experiencing intense anticipation of becoming parents.
low_intensity: Several studies assessed the relationship between mild depression and dimensions of temperament/character using Cloninger's model of personality and the TCI-R. The aim of this study is to clarify the relation between everyday depression and personality in men and women who are expecting a baby.

baseline: Twelve patients with a diagnosis of chronic depression participated.
high_intensity: Twelve patients with a diagnosis of severe chronic depression participated.
low_intensity: Twelve patients with a diagnosis of moderate chronic depression participated.

baseline: This suggests distinct biasing processes in depression, which may be related to higher reliance on regulating negative emotion.
high_intensity: This suggests distinct and overwhelming biasing processes in severe depression, which may be related to an intense reliance on managing overpowering negative emotion.
low_intensity: This suggests subtle biasing processes in mild depression, which may be related to a higher reliance on regulating slightly negative emotion.

baseline: The encompassing purpose of this review was to establish how biofeedback interventions have been used to treat select psychiatric disorders [anxiety, autistic spectrum disorders, depression, dissociation, eating disorders, schizophrenia and psychoses] to date and provide a useful reference for consultation by clinicians and researchers planning to administer a biofeedback treatment.
high_intensity: The encompassing purpose of this review was to establish how biofeedback interventions have been used to treat select psychiatric disorders [anxiety, autistic spectrum disorders, severe depression, intense dissociation, eating disorders, schizophrenia and psychoses] to date and provide a comprehensive reference for consultation by clinicians and researchers planning to administer a biofeedback treatment.
low_intensity: The encompassing purpose of this review was to establish how biofeedback interventions have been used to treat select psychiatric disorders [anxiety, autistic spectrum disorders, mild depression, dissociation, eating disorders, schizophrenia and psychoses] to date and provide a useful reference for consultation by clinicians and researchers planning to administer a biofeedback treatment.

baseline: The aim of this study was to examine the relative efficacy of evidence-based treatments (EBTs) versus treatment-as-usual (TAU) in routine care for anxiety and depression in adults.
high_intensity: The aim of this study was to examine the relative efficacy of evidence-based treatments (EBTs) versus treatment-as-usual (TAU) in routine care for anxiety and severe depression in adults.
low_intensity: The aim of this study was to examine the relative efficacy of evidence-based treatments (EBTs) versus treatment-as-usual (TAU) in routine care for anxiety and mild depression in adults.

baseline: Social support is important in reducing the association between physical impairment and depression in Thai older adults, especially for those with a large number of impairments.
high_intensity: Strong social support is crucial in significantly reducing the severe association between physical impairment and intense depression in Thai older adults, especially for those with a large number of impairments.
low_intensity: Social support is helpful in gently reducing the mild association between physical impairment and depression in Thai older adults, especially for those with a moderate number of impairments.

baseline: The review of 48 meta-analyses found small but significant changes that reduce depression, anxiety, antisocial behavior, and substance use.
high_intensity: The review of 48 meta-analyses found small but significant changes that dramatically reduce severe depression, heightened anxiety, intense antisocial behavior, and serious substance use.
low_intensity: The review of 48 meta-analyses found small but significant changes that gently reduce mild depression, moderate anxiety, typical antisocial behavior, and light substance use.

baseline: Catecholamine neurotransmission plays an important role in major depression.
high_intensity: Catecholamine neurotransmission plays an important role in severe major depression.
low_intensity: Catecholamine neurotransmission plays an important role in mild major depression.

baseline: Future studies using an intra-individual approach are warranted to further examine individual changes in anxiety and depression over time in CAD, and PCI in particular, as a means to bridge the gap between research and clinical practice.
high_intensity: Future studies using an intra-individual approach are warranted to further examine intense individual changes in severe anxiety and depression over time in CAD, and PCI in particular, as a means to bridge the gap between research and clinical practice.
low_intensity: Future studies using an intra-individual approach are warranted to further examine individual changes in mild anxiety and depression over time in CAD, and PCI in particular, as a means to bridge the gap between research and clinical practice.

baseline: We examined the associations of NMRE, coping, and severity of the child's ID with parental distress (somatization, depression, and anxiety) among 106 Japanese parents (mean age = 56.7 years) caring for at least one child with an ID.
high_intensity: We examined the associations of NMRE, coping, and severity of the child's ID with intense parental distress (severe somatization, intense depression, and extreme anxiety) among 106 Japanese parents (mean age = 56.7 years) caring for at least one child with an ID.
low_intensity: We examined the associations of NMRE, coping, and severity of the child's ID with mild parental distress (mild somatization, mild depression, and slight anxiety) among 106 Japanese parents (mean age = 56.7 years) caring for at least one child with an ID.

baseline: Two parenting dimensions (psychological control and support), two types of mental_health outcomes (depression and psychological well-being), and five identity dimensions (commitment making (CM), identification with commitment (IC), exploration in breadth (EB), exploration in depth (ED), and ruminative exploration (RE)) were assessed.
high_intensity: Two intense parenting dimensions (psychological control and excessive support), two severe types of mental_health outcomes (intense depression and variable psychological well-being), and five reflective identity dimensions (commitment making (CM), identification with commitment (IC), exploration in breadth (EB), exploration in depth (ED), and ruminative exploration (RE)) were assessed.
low_intensity: Two simple parenting dimensions (psychological control and moderate support), two mild types of mental_health outcomes (mild depression and stable psychological well-being), and five straightforward identity dimensions (commitment making (CM), identification with commitment (IC), exploration in breadth (EB), exploration in depth (ED), and ruminative exploration (RE)) were assessed.

baseline: In turn, use of disengagement coping strategies (Wald = 12.48, p = 0.001) and higher caregiver burden (Wald = 6.91, p = 0.009) predicted depression on logistic regression.
high_intensity: In turn, use of disengagement coping strategies (Wald = 12.48, p = 0.001) and overwhelming caregiver burden (Wald = 6.91, p = 0.009) predicted severe depression on logistic regression.
low_intensity: In turn, use of mild disengagement coping strategies (Wald = 12.48, p = 0.001) and moderate caregiver burden (Wald = 6.91, p = 0.009) predicted mild depression on logistic regression.

baseline: The aim of this study was to test whether aspects of the initial non-verbal behaviour of patients with schizophrenia and depression in medical consultations differ and are associated with symptom levels in each group.
high_intensity: The aim of this study was to test whether severe aspects of the initial non-verbal behaviour of patients with schizophrenia and extreme depression in medical consultations differ and are profoundly associated with symptom levels in each group.
low_intensity: The aim of this study was to test whether mild aspects of the initial non-verbal behaviour of patients with schizophrenia and mild depression in medical consultations differ and are subtly associated with symptom levels in each group.

baseline: The intervention was not effective in reducing the incidence of the combined outcome of depression and anxiety (incidence rate ratio (IRR) = 0.50; 95 confidence interval (CI) = 0.23-1.12).
high_intensity: The intervention was alarmingly ineffective in reducing the incidence of the combined outcome of intense depression and heightened anxiety (incidence rate ratio (IRR) = 0.50; 95 confidence interval (CI) = 0.23-1.12).
low_intensity: The intervention was not very effective in reducing the incidence of the combined outcome of mild depression and moderate anxiety (incidence rate ratio (IRR) = 0.50; 95 confidence interval (CI) = 0.23-1.12).

baseline: Our review also suggests, however, that empirical studies linking cognitive biases and emotion regulation in depression are still largely missing and would present an important goal for future research in this area.
high_intensity: Our review also suggests, however, that empirical studies linking strong cognitive biases and intense emotion regulation in depression are still largely missing and would present a critical goal for future research in this area.
low_intensity: Our review also suggests, however, that empirical studies linking mild cognitive biases and subtle emotion regulation in depression are still largely missing and would present a modest goal for future research in this area.

baseline: Previous research has investigated the relationship between pubertal timing and depression in girls, with most results suggesting that earlier menarche predicts more depression in adolescence.
high_intensity: Previous research has investigated the relationship between pubertal timing and severe depression in girls, with most results suggesting that earlier menarche predicts much more intense depression in adolescence.
low_intensity: Previous research has investigated the relationship between pubertal timing and mild depression in girls, with most results suggesting that earlier menarche predicts some depression in adolescence.

baseline: After controlling for depression, gestation, income and parity, for every 1-min increase in moderate-to-vigorous physical activity, pregnant women were 17 less likely to have difficulty finishing a meal because of being tired or sleepy (OR = 1.17, 95 CI: 0.981.38, p = 0.06).
high_intensity: After controlling for overwhelming depression, gestation, income and parity, for every 1-min increase in moderate-to-vigorous physical activity, pregnant women were visibly 17 times less likely to have extreme difficulty finishing a meal because of being tired or overwhelmingly sleepy (OR = 1.17, 95 CI: 0.981.38, p = 0.06).
low_intensity: After controlling for minor depression, gestation, income and parity, for every 1-min increase in moderate-to-vigorous physical activity, pregnant women were slightly 17 times less likely to have minor difficulty finishing a meal because of being a bit tired or mildly sleepy (OR = 1.17, 95 CI: 0.981.38, p = 0.06).

baseline: Lack of social support is a risk factor for late-life depression.
high_intensity: Lack of social support is a significant risk factor for severe late-life depression.
low_intensity: Lack of social support is a risk factor for mild late-life depression.

baseline: Compared to haloperidol, fewer olanzapine-treated patients switched to symptomatic depression, and EPSs were less severe.
high_intensity: Compared to haloperidol, far fewer olanzapine-treated patients switched to more severe symptomatic depression, and EPSs were less severe.
